The Dublin office will focus on recruiting talent for development, technical delivery, and operations to support VivoPower's global AI data center buildout.

title: How Expedia’s CTO is using AI to transform work for 17,000 employees—and travel for millions
summary: Expedia's CTO, Ramana Thumu, is leading a company-wide initiative to democratize AI, impacting 17,000 employees and travelers. This includes providing access to numerous large language models for employees to build AI agents, integrating AI coding assistants for software developers, and embedding AI squads within business divisions. The goal is to enhance productivity internally and deliver innovative, multi-step agentic AI experiences for millions of travelers.

title: Amazon Stock (NASDAQ: AMZN) Price Prediction and Forecast 2026-2030 for January 14
summary: This article provides a price prediction and forecast for Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) stock from 2026 to 2030, emphasizing key growth drivers such as e-commerce, Amazon Web Services (AWS), and advertising. Despite past volatility, the company's strategic investments in AI, robotics, and new business segments are expected to drive significant revenue and net income growth, projecting a stock price of $524.67 by 2030. The analysis includes detailed financial tables and discusses assumptions regarding market share and competition.

title: Should Fidelity Nasdaq Composite Index ETF (ONEQ) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The Fidelity Nasdaq Composite Index ETF (ONEQ), launched in 2003, is a passively managed fund providing broad exposure to US large-cap growth companies, with over $9.54 billion in assets. With an expense ratio of 0.21% and a Zacks ETF Rank of 1 (Strong Buy), ONEQ is considered a good option for investors looking for exposure to this market segment. The ETF heavily invests in the Information Technology sector, with top holdings including Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft, and has shown a 24.29% return over the last year.

title: Fair Isaac stock price target raised to $1,981 from $1,914 at Clear Street
summary: Clear Street raised its price target for Fair Isaac (NYSE:FICO) to $1,981 from $1,914, maintaining a Buy rating. The firm increased its earnings per share estimates for Q1 fiscal 2026, fiscal 2026, and fiscal 2027, citing stronger mortgage originations, lower operating expenses, and confidence in the company's Mortgage Direct License Program. Clear Street forecasts significant revenue and adjusted EPS growth, with key investor focus areas including program rollout, pricing, competition, and FICO Platform growth.

title: Microsoft Pledges To Bear Own Data Center Power Costs Amid Trump Pressure Over Surging Energy Bills
summary: Microsoft has committed to covering the power costs for its data centers to prevent local electricity bills from rising, a move made amid growing scrutiny of tech companies' environmental impact and direct pressure from former President Donald Trump. The company plans a "community-first" approach, collaborating with utilities and creating jobs, while also specifically addressing concerns about water usage and the financial burden posed by its AI infrastructure expansion. This pledge follows a contentious data center project in Michigan and reinforces Microsoft's earlier commitment to investing heavily in AI.

title: The Next Phase of the AI Boom May Not Come From Chipmakers
summary: The article argues that the next phase of the AI boom will shift focus from chipmakers to nuclear energy stocks due to the immense power demands of AI data centers. It highlights that data centers' electricity consumption is rapidly increasing, making nuclear power a crucial and reliable solution. The piece details how major tech companies like Microsoft and Alphabet are investing in and partnering with nuclear energy producers such as Constellation Energy, NextEra Energy, and uranium supplier Cameco to meet their growing power needs.

title: The Renaissance of Compute: A 2026 Deep Dive into AMD’s AI Transformation
summary: The article provides a 2026 deep dive into AMD's transformation into a key player in AI-driven compute, surpassing its role as a mere component manufacturer. It details AMD's historical journey, its current business model centered on heterogeneous computing solutions, and its strong financial performance driven by AI accelerators like the MI400 series. The piece also highlights AMD's competitive positioning against Nvidia and Intel, its strategic advantages in an "open ecosystem" approach, and the risks and opportunities it faces in a rapidly evolving market.

title: 3 AI ETFs Underperforming the S&P 500 That Are Set to Surge 26% or More
summary: This article identifies three AI-focused ETFs—Ark Next Generation ETF (ARKW), iShares Future Exponential Technologies ETF (XT), and Roundhill Generative AI & Technology ETF (CHAT)—that have recently underperformed the S&P 500 but are poised for significant growth based on historical performance. It provides a detailed breakdown of each fund's holdings, expense ratios, and management, suggesting they offer compelling entry points for investors seeking diversified exposure to the AI sector despite recent weakness. The author argues that their strong one-year returns indicate that current underperformance is temporary.

title: Merit Financial Group LLC Grows Stock Position in Microsoft Corporation $MSFT
summary: Merit Financial Group LLC increased its stake in Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) by 10.3% in the third quarter, now owning 334,754 shares valued at $173.39 million, making it their 9th largest holding. This move follows Microsoft's strong Q3 earnings, which surpassed analyst expectations, and comes amidst mixed insider selling activity and a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating from analysts with a target price of $630.37. The company recently declared a quarterly dividend of $0.91 per share.

title: CBRE Group Inc Class A Stock Live Price, Chart, Analysis, News & Forecast – Buy, Sell & Trade US Equities Today
summary: This article provides a detailed analysis of CBRE Group Inc Class A stock, including its current price, key financial metrics, analyst ratings, and historical performance. As of January 15, 2026, the stock is priced at $170.83, with a market capitalization of $51.06 billion. The company, a leading provider of commercial real estate services, has shown strong historical returns, making it an interesting prospect for investors.

title: IBM Q4 2025 Preview: The Renaissance of Big Blue in the Era of Agentic AI
summary: IBM is preparing for its Q4 2025 earnings call, where it is expected to demonstrate sustained momentum in hybrid cloud and generative AI. The company has repositioned itself as a leader in enterprise AI through strategic acquisitions like Red Hat and investments in its watsonx platform, showing strong financial performance and ambitious plans for future growth. Investors will be keenly watching for updates on its AI "book of business," Confluent integration, and the upcoming z17 mainframe cycle.

title: Dan Ives Predicts Tesla Will Own '80%' Of Robotaxi Market — Says TSLA In His Top 5 List For 2026
summary: Dan Ives of Wedbush Securities reiterates his bullish outlook on Tesla, predicting the company will dominate 80% of the Robotaxi market by 2026. He places Tesla at the top of his personal list of top five stocks for the year, alongside Microsoft, Apple, Palantir, and CrowdStrike. Ives's prediction comes despite Tesla's Robotaxi service missing previous self-imposed deadlines and the strong performance of competitors like Waymo.

title: HB Wealth Management LLC Acquires 18,495 Shares of Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: HB Wealth Management LLC increased its stake in Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOG) by 5.7% in the third quarter, acquiring an additional 18,495 shares to bring its total holdings to 340,867 shares valued at $83,018,000. This increase comes amid positive market sentiment for Alphabet, driven by a multi-year AI deal with Apple for its Gemini models and the company achieving a $4 trillion valuation. Despite some insider selling and valuation concerns, analysts maintain a "Buy" rating with a consensus price target of $318.36, highlighting continued confidence in Google's AI and cloud growth.

title: Semtech Corporation stock hits 52-week high at 81.38 USD
summary: Semtech Corporation's stock has reached a new 52-week high of $81.38 USD, demonstrating a 21.93% one-year return and a 65.65% surge over the past six months. This performance reflects strong investor confidence and the company's robust market position, supported by significant revenue growth and a $7.34 billion market capitalization. Analyst firms like UBS, Piper Sandler, Benchmark, and Stifel have maintained or raised their price targets for Semtech, citing positive fiscal third-quarter results and the potential of its IoT business.

title: Pearson shares tank on lack of 2026 guidance, NJ contract loss
summary: Pearson's shares fell sharply after the company reported accelerated growth in Q4 but disappointed investors by not providing 2026 guidance and losing a significant US contract in New Jersey. Despite exceeding profit consensus and launching an AI-powered learning solution, the market reacted negatively to the lack of forward outlook and the contract loss expected to be a headwind in H1 2026.

title: The AMD Transformation: From x86 Underdog to AI Systems Architect
summary: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (AMD) has undergone a significant transformation, evolving from an x86 underdog into a dominant force in high-performance computing and AI infrastructure under Dr. Lisa Su's leadership. The company has shifted from focusing solely on chips to becoming a full-stack AI systems architect, challenging both Intel in server CPUs and Nvidia in the AI accelerator market. AMD's strategic acquisitions, Zen architecture, and aggressive annual AI hardware cadence have driven its impressive financial performance and stock growth, positioning it as a key player in the AI era despite facing competition and regulatory challenges.

title: Calamos Wealth Management LLC Boosts Holdings in Microsoft Corporation $MSFT
summary: Calamos Wealth Management LLC increased its stake in Microsoft Corporation by 9.1% during the third quarter, making it their 4th largest holding. Other institutional investors have also adjusted their positions in Microsoft, which reportedly had strong quarterly earnings, exceeding analyst expectations. The company recently announced a quarterly dividend and analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with an average target price of $630.37, despite some expressing concerns about increasing AI data center costs and macroeconomic headwinds.

title: Franco-Nevada Corporation $FNV Shares Acquired by PKO Investment Management Joint Stock Co
summary: PKO Investment Management Joint Stock Co increased its stake in Franco-Nevada Corporation (FNV) by 9.6% in the third quarter of 2025, bringing its total holdings to 62,764 shares valued at $13.98 million. This makes FNV the 17th largest position for PKO Investment Management. Franco-Nevada exceeded Q3 earnings estimates with EPS of $1.43 and revenue of $487.7 million, a 76.9% increase year-over-year, and pays a quarterly dividend of $0.38 per share.

title: 1 Stock I'd Buy Before Joby Aviation
summary: The article suggests Kraken Robotics (OTC: KRKN.F) as a better investment than Joby Aviation (NYSE: JOBY). While Joby Aviation is an early leader in eVTOL aircraft with a high market cap and speculative commercialization, Kraken Robotics, a deep-sea battery and sonar technology company, already boasts reliable revenue streams, encouraging growth (60% year-over-year sales increase), strong gross margins (59%), and profitability. The author highlights Kraken's existing financial performance and less speculative path to profitability compared to Joby Aviation.

title: Morgan Stanley reiterates Overweight rating on Microsoft stock at $650
summary: Morgan Stanley has maintained an Overweight rating and a $650 price target for Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) following a CIO Survey indicating accelerating software spending and strong growth for Microsoft in 2026. The tech giant's Azure cloud service remains a top choice, and adoption of its AI capabilities like GitHub Copilot and M365 Copilot continues to rise. Investors await Microsoft's Q2 2026 earnings report on January 28th to see if these trends translate into sustained revenue growth.

title: AI learning launches and big tech deals mark Pearson’s 2025 growth
summary: Pearson reported underlying group sales growth of 4% for FY2025, accelerating to 8% in Q4, with adjusted operating profit guided at £610–615m. The company's strategic priorities for 2025 included expanding partnerships, growing Enterprise reach, and advancing AI in learning, highlighted by the launch of an AI-powered Communication Coach and a strategic partnership with IBM. Although results were largely in line with guidance, the stock declined 5.70%, potentially due to factors like weakness in International Higher Education or upcoming contract headwinds in H1 2026.

title: How AI-Focused Deals and Margin Pressures At Palo Alto Networks (PANW) Have Changed Its Investment Story
summary: Palo Alto Networks (PANW) is experiencing increased attention due to strong revenue growth, analyst endorsements, and strategic AI acquisitions like the $3.35 billion Chronosphere deal. However, insider share sales and rising hardware costs are creating a more complex investment picture. The company's future success depends on effectively integrating and monetizing these AI-driven platforms, balancing growth ambitions with execution and margin pressures, and navigating intensifying competition.

title: How Investors May Respond To CyberArk (CYBR) Spotlighting Just‑in‑Time Privileged Access Gaps In AI Era
summary: CyberArk's recent research indicates that only 1% of organizations have fully implemented Just-in-Time privileged access, with 91% still using always-on access, highlighting security gaps amplified by AI. This reinforces CyberArk's investment narrative around identity security, particularly with its new Secure AI Agents Solution, aiming to expand its role from a point solution to a broad identity security provider. While the company projects significant revenue and earnings growth, execution risks related to recent acquisitions remain a factor for investors to consider.

title: Technology Sector Powers Strong Returns for iShares MSCI World ETF
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) has shown strong performance, reaching new 52-week highs primarily driven by U.S. technology stocks. The fund, with $6.97 billion in assets and significant investor inflows, tracks the MSCI World Index and achieved a 21.28% return in 2025. It maintains a strong concentration in U.S. equities and the technology sector, with major holdings like NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft.

title: Did Benchmark Electronics' (BHE) New AI-Focused CTO Just Reshape Its Technology Investment Narrative?
summary: Benchmark Electronics (BHE) recently appointed Josh Hollin, an AI, robotics, and advanced manufacturing expert, as its new CTO. This appointment is expected to influence the company's technology investments, particularly in advanced computing and AI data center programs. While Hollin's focus aligns with the existing advanced computing recovery thesis, the article notes that investors should be aware of potential headwinds in semi-cap and industrial demand.

title: Does Credo (CRDO) Needham Remarks Clarify Its Edge in AI Data Center Connectivity?
summary: Credo Technology Group Holding Ltd (CRDO) recently presented at the 28th Annual Needham Growth Conference, where its leaders discussed the company's role in AI data center connectivity amidst rising earnings estimates. The article explores how investor enthusiasm around these estimates and the conference presentation might influence Credo's investment narrative, particularly concerning its premium valuation and sensitivity to AI infrastructure spending fluctuations. It also highlights varying fair value estimates among investors and notes significant insider selling, suggesting a need for caution despite high expectations.

title: Wolfspeed Achieves 300mm Silicon Carbide (SiC) Technology Breakthrough
summary: Wolfspeed, a leader in silicon carbide technology, has announced a significant breakthrough with the successful production of a single crystal 300mm silicon carbide wafer. This development is expected to enable new performance thresholds and manufacturing scalability for applications such as AI computing, AR/VR systems, and advanced power devices. The larger wafer size will facilitate higher-volume production and improved economics for silicon carbide technology, positioning it as a strategic material for future technological advancements.

title: How Sterling’s E-Infrastructure Focus and CEC Integration Shape the STRL Investment Narrative
summary: Sterling Infrastructure's investment narrative is increasingly shaped by its E-Infrastructure Solutions business, driven by demand for data centers and the CEC acquisition. The company presented at the Needham Growth Conference, highlighting its growing backlog in this segment. While the E-Infrastructure Solutions segment offers strong growth potential, investors should be aware of potential project or customer concentration risks.

title: Riding the AI Wave: iShares MSCI World ETF Maintains Momentum
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) has shown significant momentum, trading near its 52-week high in early 2026, largely driven by its substantial allocation to US technology giants and beneficiaries of the AI wave. The ETF slightly outperformed its benchmark in 2025, despite its focused exposure to developed markets and higher expense ratio compared to more diversified global peers. Its performance, however, comes with notable concentration risks due to its heavy weighting in tech and AI-related stocks.

title: Motorola Enhances AI Security to Address Complex Safety Challenges
summary: Motorola Solutions, Inc. (MSI) is advancing AI-driven security to help critical enterprises move from reactive incident detection to proactive safety and situational awareness. Their new Avigilon Visual Alerts leverage generative AI to detect a wide range of visual events across camera networks, delivering these capabilities on-premise without cloud reliance. This innovation aims to enhance safety, security, and compliance, particularly in sectors like oil and gas and healthcare, and has led to solid traction in Motorola's Products and Systems Integration segment.

title: CoreWeave CEO Calls Nvidia Circular Financing Claims 'Ridiculous,' Says Stake Too Small To Prop Up $42 Billion Company
summary: CoreWeave CEO Michael Intrator has strongly refuted claims of "circular financing" with Nvidia, calling the allegations "ridiculous." He argues that Nvidia's $300 million investment is a "de minimis" amount compared to CoreWeave's $25 billion capital raise and $42 billion valuation, emphasizing that demand for compute, not financial engineering, drives their relationship. Intrator also defended CoreWeave's aggressive use of debt through "box" strategies and highlighted the longevity of older AI hardware, citing renewed contracts for Nvidia A100 chips at near original value.

title: Is ServiceNow (NOW) Attractive After Recent Share Price Pullback And DCF Valuation Gap
summary: ServiceNow (NOW) has experienced a significant share price pullback, raising questions about its current valuation. A Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggests the stock is undervalued by 30.3% at US$138.19, with an intrinsic value of US$198.16. However, its Price-to-Earnings (P/E) ratio of 82.82x is higher than the industry average, indicating it might be overvalued by this metric, leading to conflicting valuation signals for investors.

title: 3 Reasons to Sell BL and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article recommends selling BlackLine (BL) due to weak billings indicating soft demand, customer churn evidenced by an adequate but not leading net revenue retention rate, and an operating margin that has remained stagnant despite revenue growth. The authors suggest seeking better investment opportunities, highlighting an "all-weather company that owns household favorite Taco Bell" and other high-quality growth stocks that have outperformed the market. They specifically warn against BlackLine's current valuation given its recent underperformance.

title: Arista Networks Inc. stock outperforms competitors on strong trading day
summary: Arista Networks Inc. (ANET) stock experienced a strong trading day, outperforming its competitors. The stock closed at $289.47, marking a 1.25% increase and surpassing the S&P 500's daily gain of 1.22%. This positive performance comes despite a mixed trading session for other tech giants.

title: A Look At Plug Power (PLUG) Valuation After Recent Share Price Volatility
summary: Plug Power (PLUG) has experienced recent share price volatility, with a small gain over the past month but a significant decline over the last three months. Despite this, its fair value estimate remains at $2.79 per share, suggesting it is undervalued by 18.2%. However, the company's Price/Sales ratio of 4.6x is considerably higher than the industry average, indicating potential valuation risk if market sentiment shifts.

title: Broadcom issues $4.5 billion in senior notes, plans debt redemption
summary: Broadcom Inc. has announced the issuance of $4.5 billion in senior notes across four series, with interest rates ranging from 4.300% to 5.700% and maturities between 2031 and 2056. The company plans to use these proceeds for general corporate purposes and to redeem several existing senior notes, including those issued by its subsidiary VMware LLC. This move comes as Broadcom reports a 24% year-over-year revenue increase for fiscal year 2025, driven by a 65% expansion in AI semiconductor revenue.

title: GPIX ETF 8% Monthly Yield and S&P 500 Upside at $53
summary: The article analyzes the Goldman Sachs S&P 500 Premium Income ETF (GPIX), highlighting its 8% monthly yield and structure designed to capture S&P 500 upside with a dynamic covered-call strategy. GPIX uniquely blends exposure to "Magnificent 7" tech stocks with a flexible overwrite mechanism (25%-75%) to generate income while aiming to avoid the common NAV bleed seen in static covered-call funds. The article concludes that GPIX is a buy for investors seeking high, tax-efficient income and exposure to AI-driven tech, while accepting equity-like drawdowns.

title: Wall Street Analyst Upgrades on AI Platforms Might Change The Case For Investing In Palantir Technologies (PLTR)
summary: Recent analyst upgrades from firms like Citi Research, citing stronger confidence in Palantir's AI-driven government and commercial software growth, are shaping the investment narrative for Palantir Technologies (PLTR). While the upgrades reinforce the company's story of converting government roots and commercial growth into high-margin software revenue, the article suggests that the modest share price movement indicates a shift in sentiment rather than fundamentals. Investors are cautioned that current expectations and valuation might be running ahead of deliverable results, encouraging them to build their own investment narrative.

title: Horizon Kinetics compra ação da Texas Pacific Land (TPL) a US$ 311
summary: Horizon Kinetics Asset Management LLC, uma acionista significativa da Texas Pacific Land Corp (TPL), adquiriu 1 ação ordinária por US$ 311,84 em 12 de janeiro de 2026, elevando sua participação direta para 3.487.690 ações. Esta compra segue o desdobramento de ações de três para um da TPL e anúncios recentes de resultados abaixo do esperado no terceiro trimestre de 2025, um acordo estratégico com a Bolt Data & Energy, e uma cobertura "acima da média" do KeyBanc.
source: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos

title: ServiceNow to Acquire Cybersecurity Firm Armis in $7.75 Billion Deal
summary: ServiceNow announced its agreement to acquire cybersecurity firm Armis for $7.75 billion in an all-cash deal, making it ServiceNow's largest acquisition to date. This move aims to bolster ServiceNow's security and automation offerings amidst increasing cyber risks. The acquisition is expected to close in the second half of 2026, pending regulatory approvals, and will integrate Armis's threat detection data into ServiceNow's existing cybersecurity portfolio.

title: Metaverse – the next e-commerce revolution
summary: This article from Deutsche Bank discusses the metaverse as the next e-commerce revolution. It covers the opportunities, risks, technology, and legal/regulatory environment, noting the increasing investment despite the cryptocurrency market contraction. The white paper aims to guide readers through the metaverse, exploring its definition, benefits for individuals and corporates, technological maturity, and strategies for risk mitigation.

title: Microsoft vows to ‘pay its way’ as it seeks to defuse data centre backlash
summary: Microsoft is pledging to pay higher electricity rates and replenish water used by its AI data centers to address public backlash over rising energy costs and environmental concerns. This move comes as the Trump administration faces criticism for increased electricity bills despite prioritizing AI development. Other utilities, like Georgia Power, are also reassuring customers that data center energy demands will not impact their rates.

title: Adobe stock hits 52-week low at $311.55
summary: Adobe's stock has hit a new 52-week low of $311.55, representing a 24.42% decline over the past year due to broader market challenges and investor concerns. The company has also faced multiple analyst downgrades from Goldman Sachs, BMO Capital, Jefferies, and KeyBanc, citing increased competition from AI-enhanced alternatives and valuation concerns, despite strong recent Q4 2025 results. These factors highlight the challenging market landscape impacting Adobe's financial performance.

title: Why Udemy (UDMY) Stock Is Falling Today
summary: Shares of Udemy (NASDAQ:UDMY) fell by 4.8% after KeyBanc Capital Markets downgraded the stock to 'Sector Weight' from 'Overweight' following the company's merger announcement with Coursera. The investment firm also removed its price target for UDMY, signaling a more cautious outlook. Despite the current drop, the article notes that market volatility surrounding Udemy is common.

title: Will Lumentum (LITE) Finance Transition Shape Its Credibility In AI-Driven Optical Infrastructure?
summary: Lumentum (LITE) announced the upcoming retirement of Chief Accounting Officer Matthew Sepe and the appointment of Eric Chang, a high-tech finance executive, to the role. This leadership transition occurs amidst strong external analyst projections for AI-related optical demand for Lumentum's products. The article explores how this finance transition might influence the company's investment narrative, particularly concerning its stability in providing optical infrastructure for AI and cloud computing, while also highlighting the risks of customer concentration.

title: Cadence Delivers Enterprise-Level Reliability with Next-Gen Low-Power DRAM for AI Applications Featuring Microsoft RAIDDR ECC Technology
summary: Cadence has announced the industry's first LPDDR5X 9600Mbps memory IP system solution, specifically designed for enterprise and data center applications requiring high reliability. This innovative solution integrates Cadence’s LPDDR5X IP with Microsoft’s advanced redundant array of independent double data rate (RAIDDR) error correction code (ECC) technology. It offers high performance, low power consumption, and robust reliability, making it ideal for AI and HPC workloads while providing enterprise-grade RAS capabilities comparable to DDR5 memory.

title: Apple Partners With Google's Gemini to Power AI Version of Siri
summary: Apple Inc. is reportedly partnering with Google, integrating Google's Gemini AI models to power a new AI-driven version of Siri. This multiyear deal is a significant move for Apple into the competitive AI space, with reports suggesting Apple could pay Google around $1 billion annually for the technology. The updated Siri, leveraging both Gemini and Apple's own Foundation Models, is expected to launch later this year.

title: Kinross Gold Corp stock reaches all-time high at 33.45 USD
summary: Kinross Gold Corp (KGC) has achieved an all-time high of $33.45 USD, reflecting strong performance with a 229.95% 1-year return and an "EXCELLENT" financial health score, including a Piotroski Score of 9. Despite trading above its InvestingPro Fair Value, the company's robust fundamentals and recent analyst coverage with a "Buy" rating from Desjardins, along with a C$44.00 price target, highlight continued investor confidence even as other gold miners face declines. Kinross Gold's strategic initiatives, such as potential share buybacks, dividend increases, and the advancement of its Great Bear project, are key factors driving its success.

title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise: How HPE Is Re?Architecting the Enterprise for the AI Era
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) is transforming its business by focusing on hybrid cloud, its GreenLake platform, and AI-native infrastructure to cater to the evolving needs of the enterprise. The company aims to provide consistent workload management across public clouds, data centers, and edge locations with cloud economics and on-prem control. This strategy positions HPE as a formidable competitor against traditional hardware rivals and hyperscale cloud providers, offering a compelling alternative for organizations seeking to modernize while avoiding vendor lock-in.

title: Conduent opens AI experience center at New Jersey headquarters By Investing.com
summary: Conduent Incorporated has opened an AI Experience Center at its New Jersey headquarters to showcase its AI and generative AI solutions for various clients. Despite financial challenges and a declining stock price, the company emphasizes its long-standing use of AI and showcases technologies for improving customer experience, streamlining operations, and optimizing enterprise functions. Microsoft is a key partner in this initiative, focusing on healthcare claims, fraud detection, and customer engagement.

title: Five Below stock hits 52-week high at $204.97
summary: Five Below Inc. stock reached a new 52-week high of $204.97, reflecting a significant 103.81% increase over the past year. This performance is attributed to the company's strategic expansion, successful product offerings, and strong holiday sales which led to raised guidance for Q4 and full-year 2025. While analysts have varying price targets, the overall sentiment highlights Five Below's robust market position and growth potential.

title: Conduent opens AI experience center at New Jersey headquarters
summary: Conduent Incorporated has opened an AI Experience Center at its Florham Park, New Jersey headquarters to showcase its AI and generative AI solutions for commercial, transportation, and government clients. This strategic move aims to foster collaboration and innovation despite the company facing financial challenges, as it leverages advanced technologies and partnerships with firms like Microsoft to enhance its digital business solutions. The center features demonstrations for improving customer interactions, streamlining operations, and optimizing enterprise functions.

title: Should Retirees Look At John Hancock’s Large Cap ETF, Or Move Along? | JHML
summary: The article evaluates John Hancock Multifactor Large Cap ETF (JHML) for retirees, concluding that its high technology allocation, modest dividend yield, and recent underperformance compared to the S&P 500 make it unsuitable for income-focused retirement strategies. While JHML has tax efficiency with low turnover, retirees needing cash flow might still face capital gains by selling shares to generate income. The article suggests alternatives like the WisdomTree U.S. Quality Dividend Growth Fund (DGRW) for those seeking both factor exposure and meaningful, growing income.

title: AMD (AMD) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) jumped 6.9% after KeyBanc upgraded the stock to Overweight, raising its price target to $270. The upgrade was driven by significant demand for AMD's server chips used in AI applications, with supply chain checks indicating the company is nearly sold out for 2026 and considering a price increase. Analysts estimate AMD's server CPU business could grow by at least 50% this year.

title: Salesforce Launches AI-Powered Slackbot with Anthropic's Claude Model
summary: Salesforce has introduced an AI-powered Slackbot, leveraging Anthropic's Claude model, to enhance enterprise productivity for Business+ and Enterprise+ subscribers. This new tool accesses data from various platforms like Slack, Salesforce, Google Drive, Box, and Confluence, while maintaining user permissions. The launch stems from an expanded partnership with Anthropic, focusing on providing secure AI solutions for regulated industries, with companies like CrowdStrike already utilizing Claude within Salesforce's Agentforce platform.

title: Davita stock hits 52-week low at $108.37
summary: DaVita HealthCare Partners stock has fallen to a 52-week low of $108.37, marking a 33.52% decline over the past year. Despite this downturn and a recent earnings miss in Q3 2025, InvestingPro data suggests the stock is undervalued with strong underlying financial health, including a P/E ratio of 11.01 and a 17% free cash flow yield. Analysts maintain price targets ranging from $126 to $186, while UBS reiterated a Buy rating due to long-term operating income growth expectations.

title: Microsoft launches data center initiative to limit power costs, water use
summary: Microsoft has launched a new initiative to address concerns about its data centers' power consumption and water usage in the U.S. The company has pledged to pay utility rates that cover power costs, work with local utilities to expand supply, replenish more water than consumed, and publish water-use information for each data center region. This move comes as political leaders push for AI data center expansion, while local communities express worries about increased utility bills and resource depletion.

title: Microsoft Data-Center Pledges Seeking to Address Electricity Prices Draw Trump’s Praise
summary: Microsoft has pledged to cover the full electricity costs for its U.S. data centers powering AI, a move that received praise from former President Trump. This commitment aims to address concerns about AI's impact on electricity prices and prevent these costs from being passed on to consumers. The company also promised to replenish more water than it uses and pay full property taxes, extending practices already in place in some states to its entire portfolio.

title: Thomson Reuters Convenes Global AI Leaders to Advance Trust in the Age of Intelligent Systems
summary: Thomson Reuters, through its innovation research center, Thomson Reuters Labs, has launched the "Trust in AI Alliance." This alliance brings together leading AI organizations like Anthropic, AWS, Google Cloud, and OpenAI to collaborate on advancing trustworthy, agentic AI systems. The initiative aims to define shared principles and technical pathways for responsible AI, particularly in high-stakes professional environments, by focusing on reliability, interpretability, and verification.

title: F5 launches managed application delivery service on Google Cloud
summary: F5 (NASDAQ:FFIV) has launched NGINXaaS for Google Cloud, a new managed application delivery service developed in partnership with Google Cloud. This service integrates load balancing, security, and observability features to help enterprises manage modern applications efficiently and address challenges in deploying AI-enabled applications. The company, which boasts a strong financial position with more cash than debt and an impressive gross profit margin, has also seen recent analyst upgrades and continued efforts to enhance its technology offerings.

title: Can Salesforce's Data 360 Push Drive Its Next Phase of Sales Growth?
summary: Salesforce is relying on its Data 360 platform, formerly Data Cloud, to rejuvenate its slowing revenue growth which has fallen to single digits. Data 360 unifies data tools for real-time management and integration with other Salesforce offerings, generating significant recurring revenues and projected annual income of $10 billion by fiscal 2027. While it faces strong competition from Microsoft and Snowflake, Salesforce's data-driven strategy aims to drive high-value contracts and reaccelerate growth, with analysts forecasting revenue increases of 9.5% and 11% for fiscal 2026 and 2027, respectively.

title: The Biggest Loser: Tim Cook of Apple
summary: The article argues that Apple CEO Tim Cook has fallen behind in the artificial intelligence race, failing to launch a proprietary state-of-the-art AI product. Instead, Apple has partnered with Alphabet to use Gemini AI software, despite Cook's prior assurances of Apple's leadership in AI. This move places Apple at a disadvantage compared to other tech giants who have developed their own advanced AI technologies.

title: AI data centers get low-power memory with Microsoft RAIDDR ECC tech
summary: Cadence has introduced an industry-first LPDDR5X memory IP system solution specifically designed for enterprise and data center AI applications. This solution integrates Cadence's LPDDR5X IP with Microsoft's RAIDDR ECC technology, offering high performance, low power, and robust reliability necessary for AI and HPC workloads. Microsoft is the first customer to deploy this technology, which aims to provide enterprise-grade reliability comparable to DDR5 while maintaining the power and performance advantages of LPDDR5X.

title: What Investors In JPMorgan’s Active Growth ETF Need To Pay Attention To Now
summary: The JPMorgan Active Growth ETF (JGRO) underperformed the S&P 500 over the past year, raising concerns given its 0.44% expense ratio for active management. The ETF's concentrated portfolio, with its top three positions controlling over a quarter of assets and Nvidia alone making up 12%, makes it highly susceptible to movements in mega-cap technology stocks and Federal Reserve policy. Investors should closely monitor the Fed's interest rate decisions and Nvidia's performance to gauge the fund's future direction.

title: Conduent Launches AI Experience Center to Showcase AI & GenAI-Powered Solutions for Commercial, Transportation and Government Clients
summary: Conduent Incorporated has opened its AI Experience Center in Florham Park, New Jersey, to demonstrate its AI and GenAI-powered solutions to commercial, transportation, and government clients. The center showcases how these technologies can improve business performance, enhance customer experience, and drive financial outcomes. Collaborations with Microsoft and other tech leaders are integral to Conduent's innovation pipeline in this area.

title: Inside Conduent's new AI hub rethinking customer help and fraud detection
summary: Conduent (Nasdaq: CNDT) has launched its AI Experience Center in Florham Park, New Jersey, to demonstrate AI and Generative AI solutions for commercial, transportation, and government clients. In collaboration with Microsoft and other tech partners, the center focuses on enhancing customer experience, streamlining operations, and optimizing enterprise functions through applications like real-time translation, automated fraud detection, and personalized employee benefits. The initiative aims to drive business performance, improve customer satisfaction, and achieve better financial outcomes for clients.

title: Microsoft Corporation $MSFT Shares Purchased by Weaver Capital Management LLC
summary: Weaver Capital Management LLC increased its stake in Microsoft Corporation by 14.0% in the third quarter, bringing their total holdings to 18,340 shares. This increase reflects a positive outlook, supported by Goldman Sachs initiating coverage with a "Buy" rating and a $655 price target, and Microsoft's advancements in AI with Copilot Checkout and strategic partnerships. However, the company faces risks from rising competition from Chinese AI firms, potential regulatory pressures, and recent insider selling, which could temper sentiment.

title: Nearly 10x growth: Rezolve Ai targets $350M 2026 sales, $500M ARR
summary: Rezolve Ai (NASDAQ: RZLV) has issued updated guidance, forecasting ~$350 million in revenue for full-year 2026 and an exit-2026 run rate of at least $500 million ARR, significantly exceeding prevailing market expectations. The company expects at least $40 million revenue in 2025 and reported exiting 2025 with approximately $209 million ARR, with December 2025 marking its first profitable month. This guidance highlights rapid scaling, significant institutional investments, and strong enterprise adoption of its AI-powered solutions.

title: From Control to Command: The Future of Multicloud Security
summary: The article discusses the evolution of multicloud security, moving from reactive control to proactive command through an automated security fabric. It highlights the failings of traditional security models in modern, dynamic cloud environments and proposes a new operating model focused on continuous visibility, automated deployment, advanced threat prevention, and flexible operationalization. The piece emphasizes that managed firewall-as-a-service (FWaaS) is foundational to achieving this future state, specifically across AWS and Azure.

title: Microsoft Pledges to Pay More for Electricity, Drawing Praise From Trump
summary: Microsoft's president, Brad Smith, announced that the company will advocate for higher electricity rates for its data centers to prevent increased costs for residential customers. This move, aimed at ensuring Microsoft pays its fair share, has garnered praise from former President Trump, who emphasized that Americans should not face higher electricity bills due to data center operations.

title: Should iShares Russell Top 200 Growth ETF (IWY) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The iShares Russell Top 200 Growth ETF (IWY) is a passively managed ETF focusing on large-cap growth companies in the US equity market, with over $16.29 billion in assets. It has an expense ratio of 0.2% and is heavily allocated to the Information Technology sector, with top holdings including Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft. The ETF holds a Zacks ETF Rank of 1 (Strong Buy) and has shown a 20.06% return over the last year, making it a strong option for investors seeking exposure to large-cap growth.

title: Jack Henry Rapid Transfers Delivers Competitive Edge to Banks and Credit Unions
summary: Jack Henry has launched "Rapid Transfers," a new cloud-native solution that enables fast and secure "me-to-me" money movement for consumers and SMBs, leveraging debit card rails through integrations with Visa Direct and Mastercard Move. This solution, offered exclusively through financial institutions and integrated into the Banno Digital Platform, aims to help banks and credit unions attract new deposits, enhance digital experiences, and increase accountholder loyalty by meeting the growing demand for instant money movement. Banks like IncredibleBank and Magnolia Federal Credit Union are already utilizing Rapid Transfers to compete with fintechs and drive membership growth.

title: Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL Shares Sold by Nordea Investment Management AB

The company maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with an average price target of $116.03.

title: S Bank Fund Management Ltd Grows Stock Holdings in Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL

title: Microsoft Wants to Power Retail Without Competing With It
summary: Microsoft is expanding into agentic commerce with its new Copilot Checkout, allowing users to complete purchases within its AI chatbot while retailers manage fulfillment. The company aims to provide AI tools and cloud infrastructure to retailers, enhancing their operations without competing for customer relationships. Analysts remain bullish on Microsoft (MSFT) stock, seeing it as well-positioned in the AI stack despite recent dips, with a Goldman Sachs price target of $655.

title: JPMorgan Chase (NYSE:JPM) Reports Q4 CY2025 In Line With Expectations
summary: JPMorgan Chase (NYSE:JPM) reported Q4 CY2025 results, meeting Wall Street's revenue expectations with a 6.9% year-on-year sales increase to $46.77 billion. The company's non-GAAP profit of $5.23 per share exceeded analysts' consensus estimates by 7.7%, and its tangible book value per share also slightly beat expectations. Despite strong performance in these areas, the article also notes a mediocre compounded annual revenue growth rate over the last five years.

title: Productivity Surprise Supports 2026 Setup - WisdomTree, Inc. - Commentaries
summary: Jeremy J. Siegel of WisdomTree, Inc. discusses surprising macro data showing slow job growth but stable unemployment, coupled with a significant surge in output. This points to a powerful productivity surge driven by reduced low-productivity labor influx and increased technology investments, supporting disinflation without recession. Siegel anticipates continued equity strength, particularly in small caps and non-tech cyclicals, with international markets also becoming more compelling due to reasonable valuations and improved corporate governance.

title: Intel Stock Gains. Why the Chip Company and AMD Got Upgrades.

summary: GRIMES & Co WEALTH MANAGEMENT LLC significantly increased its stake in the Avantis U.S. Large Cap Equity ETF (AVLC) by 43.0% in the third quarter, holding 327,058 shares valued at $25.02 million. title: Jamf appoints David Helfer as chief revenue officer By Investing.com
summary: Jamf (NASDAQ:JAMF), an Apple device management company, has appointed David Helfer as its new Chief Revenue Officer, effective immediately. Helfer, previously with Mimecast, GitLab, and F5, will lead Jamf's sales organization and growth strategy, succeeding Liz Benz. Jamf, with a market capitalization of $1.73 billion, boasts a 79.11% gross profit margin and serves over 75,000 organizations.

title: AI And Automation Will Take 6% Of US Jobs By 2030
summary: A new forecast predicts that 6.1% of US jobs, or 10.4 million, will be lost to AI and automation by 2030, with generative AI accounting for 50% of these losses. While AI's direct job replacement is significant, its influence on jobs is even greater, strongly impacting 20% of roles. The article emphasizes a human-centered strategy, investing in employee AIQ, as the future of work will remain largely human, with AI supporting increased productivity and employee experience.

title: Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL Shares Sold by Financiere des Professionnels Fonds d investissement inc.
summary: Financiere des Professionnels Fonds d investissement inc. reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) by 17.3% in the third quarter, selling 8,889 shares. This comes amidst significant insider selling by CEO Sundar Pichai and John Kent Walker, totaling over $66 million in the past 90 days. Despite the selling, Alphabet is experiencing commercial momentum, particularly after a multi-year deal with Apple to integrate Google’s Gemini models, which has contributed to the stock reaching a record high and its market capitalization surpassing $4 trillion, leading to positive analyst revisions.

title: Should You Buy Oracle Stock Now?
summary: Oracle (ORCL) stock has fallen 11% in the last six months due to concerns about its rising debt from AI expansion and skepticism regarding backlog conversion to revenue. Despite these concerns, Trefis believes ORCL stock is undervalued, projecting a 46% upside to $300 per share, driven by a massive $523 billion backlog and significant AI infrastructure contracts. The article suggests that the market is overly pessimistic and not adequately pricing in Oracle's clear revenue growth visibility.

title: 2026 Investment Perspectives
summary: Blackstone's 2026 Investment Perspectives report highlights five key dynamics shaping markets: AI investment and productivity gains, solid but uneven growth, a cooling labor market, moderating inflation, and declining global cost of capital. The firm believes these factors create an attractive environment for investors who can adapt and act with conviction, especially within private markets. The report delves into opportunities across private equity, real estate, credit, and infrastructure, emphasizing their potential for growth, durability, and downside protection amidst market shifts.

title: IonQ, Inc. (NYSE:IONQ) Receives Average Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" from Brokerages

While the company missed EPS expectations, it significantly beat revenue estimates, reporting a 221.5% year-over-year increase. Insider activity shows a director buying shares, but overall insider selling of 125,000 shares in the last three months.

title: Jim Cramer Calls Alphabet's Gemini 3 a "Home Run"
summary: Jim Cramer praised Alphabet's Gemini 3 AI platform, calling it a "home run" and noting its potential to compete with ChatGPT for mindshare. He reiterated his positive outlook on Alphabet, particularly its AI capabilities through Gemini, despite having previously sold it from his Charitable Trust. Cramer believes that Alphabet, along with NVIDIA, will be a significant outperformer in 2026 due to its strong AI platform, YouTube, Waymo, Google Cloud, and reasonable valuation considering its growth rate.

title: Trump Says Microsoft, Big Tech Must Bear Data Center Power Bills, So Americans Don't 'Pick Up The Tab'
summary: Former President Donald Trump announced that his administration is working with major U.S. tech companies, including Microsoft, to ensure they cover the costs of data center power consumption, preventing higher electricity bills for Americans. He emphasized that while the U.S. leads in AI, tech companies must "pay their own way" for the energy-intensive data centers. The move comes as data centers are projected to nearly triple their electricity use by 2028, straining the grid and increasing reliance on natural gas, leading to rising utility costs for consumers.

title: A Deep Dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF: Concentration and Performance
summary: This article provides a deep dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH), an ETF that has significantly benefited from the global equity rally since late 2025. It highlights the fund's heavy concentration in major U.S. technology stocks, outlining performance data, fund structure, portfolio composition, and market context. The analysis also compares URTH with competitors and discusses critical drivers for its performance in 2026, emphasizing the dual nature of its U.S. mega-cap concentration.

title: Microsoft expands Copilot into online commerce with in-chat checkout and seller tools
summary: Microsoft is expanding its Copilot AI capabilities into the retail sector, introducing new tools for online commerce, merchandising, store operations, and fulfillment. These updates include Copilot Checkout, allowing in-chat purchases in the US, and personalized shopping agents for conversational product discovery. Additionally, new Copilot Studio templates aim to automate catalog enrichment and assist store operations with intelligent insights.

title: Direxion Daily MSFT Bull 2X Shares declares quarterly distribution of $0.2670
summary: Direxion Daily MSFT Bull 2X Shares has declared a quarterly distribution of $0.2670 per share. This financial announcement provides shareholders with information regarding the upcoming dividend payment.

title: Apple opts for Google Gemini to power Siri in multi-billion dollar AI deal | Business News
summary: Apple Inc. has chosen Google's Gemini over OpenAI's ChatGPT to power its AI technology and Siri, marking a significant win for Alphabet in the global AI race. This multi-year deal will enable Gemini to tap into two billion active Apple devices, with Apple ensuring privacy by running AI services on devices or via Private Cloud Compute. Google Gemini is set to support a new version of Siri launching this year.

title: United Community Banks (UCB) Reports Earnings Tomorrow: What To Expect
summary: United Community Banks (UCB) is set to report its earnings on Wednesday before market open. Analysts anticipate an 8.9% year-on-year revenue growth to $274.3 million and adjusted earnings of $0.71 per share. Despite missing revenue estimates twice in the last two years, analysts have reconfirmed their estimates, suggesting stability, and the stock heads into earnings with an average analyst price target of $35.42.

title: Alphabet Inc. (Class C): The Quiet Engine Powering Google’s Next Decade
summary: This article highlights Alphabet Inc. (Class C) as a key investment vehicle for global investors seeking exposure to Google's AI, cloud, and advertising empire, emphasizing its role as a "productized" slice of Google's technology stack. It details how the Class C shares offer economic exposure without diluting founder control, and discusses Alphabet's competitive advantages in data scale, AI integration, and diversified monetization channels against rivals like Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, and Meta. The piece concludes that the stock offers a robust, growth-oriented investment with a shareholder-friendly structure.

title: IonQ (NYSE:IONQ) Trading Up 3% - Here's What Happened
summary: IonQ (NYSE:IONQ) shares increased by 3% to $50.95, with a trading volume of 16.7 million shares. title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang "Loves" This Artificial Intelligence (AI) Company. The Stock Could Soar 77% in 2026, According to 1 Wall Street Analyst
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently praised Serve Robotics, a food delivery robot company, calling it an example of the coming wave of physical AI. Serve Robotics, a partner with DoorDash and Nvidia, is rapidly expanding its fleet of over 2,000 sidewalk delivery robots and projects a tenfold revenue increase in 2026. Despite mounting losses and a high valuation, a Wall Street analyst predicts a 77% upside for the stock, though investors are advised to proceed cautiously.
authors: Danny Vena, CPA, The Motley Fool

title: Apple Stock: Despite The Selloff, 2026 Still Priced At A Premium (NASDAQ:AAPL)
summary: Despite a recent selloff, Apple Inc. (AAPL) is still considered a Hold due to its stretched valuation at 31.4x forward P/E, even with technical oversold signals. The company is projected to have high single-digit revenue growth and an EPS CAGR of 7.8% from FY2022 to FY2026. The article questions the sustainability of AI-driven iPhone upgrade cycles, suggesting Apple needs stronger AI monetization strategies beyond just product sales.

title: Alaska Air Group to upgrade tech systems after costly outages
summary: Alaska Air Group is planning to upgrade its technology systems, including exploring cloud-based platforms with providers like Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure, to prevent future costly outages. This decision follows significant disruptions such as a primary data center failure in October that led to the cancellation of over 400 flights. The airline expects to increase its annual technology investments by tens of millions of dollars to enhance redundancy and resiliency.

title: Why HCA Healthcare (HCA) Stock Is Down Today
summary: HCA Healthcare's (HCA) stock fell by 3.3% after its second-quarter earnings report, despite beating revenue and profit forecasts. Investors reacted negatively to a decline in surgical procedures and shrinking operating margins, which overshadowed the positive top-line results. The stock also faced a downgrade from BofA Securities 9 days prior due to concerns over new legislation potentially impacting Medicaid and ACA funding.

title: Salesforce (CRM) stock: Goldman starts with a Buy, Barclays lifts target — what to watch before Tuesday
summary: Goldman Sachs initiated coverage on Salesforce (CRM) with a Buy rating and a $330 price target, while Barclays raised its target to $338, maintaining an Overweight rating. Shares of Salesforce dipped slightly on Monday, closing at $259.40. Investors are now looking forward to Tuesday's U.S. CPI report and Salesforce's conference comments for insights into AI demand and the company's growth trajectory.

title: Phoenix Financial Ltd. Acquires Significant Stake in Perion Network Ltd.
summary: Phoenix Financial Ltd. (Trades, Portfolio) has acquired 1,956,583 shares of Perion Network Ltd. at $9.58 per share, adding Perion to its $7.5 billion equity portfolio. This strategic investment in the online advertising and search solutions company reflects Phoenix Financial's focus on undervalued technology opportunities. Perion Network Ltd. is considered modestly undervalued with a GF Value of $13.19 and has a strong balance sheet despite recent growth challenges.

title: Vision Marine announces 1-for-40 reverse stock split to meet Nasdaq requirements
summary: Vision Marine Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:VMAR) announced a 1-for-40 reverse stock split, effective January 14, 2026, to meet Nasdaq's minimum $1.00 bid price requirement. The company's stock has fallen 99% in the past year, currently trading at $0.15. Following the split, the approximately 37 million outstanding shares will consolidate to about 925,218 shares, with no fractional shares issued.

title: Apple strikes major deal with Google to power Siri with Gemini AI
summary: Apple and Google have announced a multi-year partnership where Google Gemini AI and cloud technology will power Apple Intelligence features, including a more personalized Siri. This marks a significant shift for Apple, which has historically avoided relying on other companies for its core AI tools, though Apple assures user privacy will be maintained. The deal is a major win for Google, expanding its AI presence beyond Samsung and potentially raising concerns from figures like Elon Musk about Google's growing influence.

title: Coca-Cola stock barely moves after-hours with CPI hours away — what KO traders watch next
summary: Coca-Cola (KO) shares remained flat after hours, trading near $70, as investors await the U.S. inflation report (CPI) due Tuesday. The CPI data is crucial for "defensive" stocks like Coca-Cola, impacting interest rate expectations and the U.S. dollar, which in turn affects overseas revenue. Traders will also be watching for insights from Coca-Cola's upcoming earnings report in February and the CEO transition in March.

title: Trump says Microsoft, peers, to make ’major changes’ in AI data center power bills
summary: Donald Trump announced that his administration is collaborating with major American technology firms, starting with Microsoft, to address the rising utility costs associated with running AI data centers. The goal is to prevent these higher costs from being passed on to household bills, ensuring companies "pay their own way." Trump emphasized that while more data centers are crucial for U.S. dominance in AI, concerns about increased electricity and water costs for American consumers must be mitigated.

title: Trump Touts New Microsoft Data-Center Pledges After Local Backlash
summary: President Trump announced that Microsoft has pledged to cover higher utility bills for all its U.S. data centers powering AI models, addressing local concerns about rising electricity prices. This move by Microsoft is part of a broader effort by the tech industry and the administration to assuage fears among consumers and local governments, with other tech giants like Meta, Amazon, and Google taking similar steps. Trump indicated that further announcements regarding collaborations with top tech companies are expected.

title: Trump says Microsoft to make changes to curb data center power costs for Americans
summary: Former U.S. President Donald Trump announced that Microsoft will implement significant changes this week to prevent American consumers from facing higher electricity bills due to data center power consumption. His administration is also collaborating with other major technology companies on this issue to secure commitments that will be revealed in the coming weeks, aiming to protect consumers from increased utility costs.

title: Is the Vanguard 500 Index Fund ETF a Buy Now?
summary: The article discusses the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO), highlighting its benefits such as easy access to the S&P 500, a strong track record of returns (322% in the past decade), and a very low expense ratio of 0.03%. It suggests that investors should focus on long-term investing and avoid market timing, despite current high valuations and concerns about an AI bubble. The ETF is presented as one of the best available investment options due to its diversified exposure to the U.S. economy.

title: Tevogen Demonstrates Platform Scalability and Multi-Indication T Cell Pipeline Expansion in 2025
summary: Tevogen Bio Holdings Inc. (Nasdaq: TVGN) reported significant scientific and operational achievements in 2025, highlighting the scalability of its ExacTcell™ platform and expanded pipeline of cytotoxic T lymphocyte (CTL) therapies. The company advanced its in-house GMP cell therapy manufacturing capabilities and identified new targets for treating various viral and oncology indications, including Epstein-Barr virus, chronic hepatitis B, and HPV-related cancers. These milestones position Tevogen for value creation through enhanced scalability, broader pipeline, and manufacturing readiness, with further updates expected at the J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference.

title: Walmart Expands AI Push With Google Gemini Shopping Integration
summary: Walmart is partnering with Alphabet Inc.'s Google Gemini to integrate shopping experiences for its stores and Sam's Club, marking a significant push into AI-driven retail. This initiative, announced at the National Retail Federation's Big Show, will initially launch in the U.S. and follows Walmart's previous collaboration with OpenAI's ChatGPT for "Instant Checkout." The move highlights the growing influence of AI in retail, aimed at streamlining shopping and enhancing customer engagement, with AI-driven traffic seeing substantial growth.

title: Alaska Air undertakes tech upgrades after painful outages
summary: Alaska Air Group Inc. is undertaking significant technology upgrades to address past operational outages and strengthen its position as a global carrier. The revamp includes evaluating cloud migration for operational, back-office systems, and data center operations, with Amazon Web Services and Microsoft's Azure being considered.

title: Microsoft, Oracle and ServiceNow could be the top stocks to play a software comeback
summary: Analysts from Goldman Sachs and Deutsche Bank suggest that infrastructure software companies, specifically Microsoft, Oracle, and ServiceNow, are poised for significant gains in 2026. This sector is expected to benefit greatly from the increasing adoption of AI, as these companies manage the hardware and data essential for AI infrastructure. Goldman Sachs projects that AI could expand the total addressable market for the software sector by 30% by 2037.

title: Google stock (GOOG) pops on Apple’s Gemini-powered Siri deal as Alphabet brushes $4 trillion
summary: Alphabet's non-voting Class C shares (GOOG) climbed by 1.1% in late trading after Apple announced a multi-year deal to integrate Google's Gemini models into Siri. This agreement positions Gemini as the default AI layer for Apple's ecosystem, enhancing Alphabet's reach and pushing its market value briefly to $4 trillion. Investors are now looking to Alphabet's upcoming Feb. 4 earnings report for clarity on AI spending and revenue generation from these investments, alongside potential regulatory scrutiny due to the deepened partnership with Apple.

title: The future of work: Key UCaaS trends for IT leaders in 2026
summary: This article forecasts five key Unified Communications as a Service (UCaaS) trends for IT leaders in 2026, emphasizing the transformative role of AI. It discusses the expansion of AI copilots, the shift towards outcome-oriented meetings, UCaaS becoming a centralized work hub, increasingly strict compliance requirements, and the integration of employee experience into workplace productivity. The author provides a checklist for IT leaders to navigate these changes, focusing on AI capabilities, strategic UCaaS integration, and viewing productivity within the broader context of employee experience.

title: Behind the Scenes at CES 2026: Intelligent Product Lifecycle with PTC
summary: This article discusses how PTC, a software company specializing in product lifecycle management, is leveraging AI to transform product development and manufacturing. Steve Dertien of PTC highlights how AI can free engineers from time-consuming change management tasks to focus on innovation, optimize supply chains, and accelerate time to market. The piece emphasizes the importance of data quality, process reevaluation, and organizational change for companies adopting AI in their product development strategies.

title: Top Stock Reports for Microsoft, Eli Lilly & Lam Research
summary: This article highlights top stock reports from Zacks Research Daily, focusing on Microsoft Corp. (MSFT), Eli Lilly and Co. (LLY), and Lam Research Corp. (LRCX). (AP) and mentions other companies like Marsh & McLennan, Ross Stores, and Cardinal Health.

title: Apple will use Google’s Gemini models to power new Siri release
summary: Apple Inc. has announced a multi-year partnership with Google LLC to integrate Google's Gemini series of large language models into its Siri voice assistant. The upgraded Siri, part of Apple's new AI suite called Apple Intelligence, is expected to provide more personalized responses and handle multi-step tasks across various apps, rolling out later this year. This collaboration has also reportedly pushed Alphabet Inc.'s market capitalization above $4 trillion, making it the fourth company to reach this milestone.

title: Adobe Firefly gets GPT-Image 1.5 support, limited-time free images
summary: Adobe Firefly now supports OpenAI’s GPT-Image 1.5 model, allowing Firefly Pro and Premium subscribers to generate unlimited images with this model until January 15. This integration is part of Adobe's broader strategy to incorporate AI-based features across its products, including Photoshop, Illustrator, and Adobe Express. Firefly offers various subscription plans based on generative credits, which are used for generating high-quality image, vector, video, and audio outputs.

title: Apple Teams Up With Google for A.I. in Its Products
summary: Apple announced a partnership with Google to base its upcoming Apple Intelligence models on Google's Gemini A.I. models and cloud computing services. This move comes after Apple faced increasing scrutiny for its slower adoption of artificial intelligence compared to other tech giants. The collaboration will power Apple's Siri and other A.I. features, though the deal's financial terms were not disclosed, and the partnership is not exclusive.

title: Key facts: Goldman Sachs raises Microsoft target; Bank of America sees $300B bonds; Microsoft upgrades Foundry
summary: Goldman Sachs has increased its price target for Microsoft (MSFT) to $655, maintaining a Buy rating, citing AI sector strength. Bank of America projects that Microsoft and other major tech companies will issue between $140 billion and $300 billion in corporate bonds annually for the next three years to fund AI investments. Microsoft has also enhanced its Foundry platform with Claude integration, specifically benefiting healthcare and life sciences clients.

title: Equinix Inc.: The Quiet Super?Infrastructure Powering the Cloud Wars
summary: Equinix Inc. has evolved beyond a traditional data center operator to become a critical software-defined backbone for the internet and multi-cloud environments. The company's strategy focuses on neutrality, interconnection services, and a global, consistent platform to cater to growing demands from AI, cloud, and data-intensive applications. This positioning allows Equinix to maintain a premium valuation as a growth-oriented digital infrastructure asset in a competitive market.

title: Apple calls on Google to help smarten up Siri and bring other AI features to the iPhone
summary: Apple is partnering with Google to integrate Google's Gemini AI technology into its "Apple Intelligence" suite for the iPhone and other products. This collaboration aims to enhance Siri and other AI features, addressing Apple's previous delays in the AI race. The deal is seen as a significant validation for Google, whose parent company, Alphabet, recently surpassed Apple in market value, driven by its AI advancements.

title: ServiceNow stock steadies after Goldman’s fresh “Buy” call as earnings near
summary: ServiceNow shares slightly increased after Goldman Sachs initiated coverage with a "Buy" rating and a $205 price target, providing a lift following a two-day drop. Investors are now closely watching the company's Q4 and full-year 2025 earnings report on January 28, especially for signs that AI hype is translating into actual bookings and renewals. Despite a positive analyst call, concerns remain about federal business flatlining and potentially uneven AI adoption impacting near-term performance.

title: Gartner lista as empresas que são referências na corrida dos fornecedores de IA
summary: Gartner identificou as "Companies to Beat" em cerca de 30 categorias de IA, baseando-se em critérios como recursos técnicos, implementações de clientes, modelo de negócios e parcerias. O relatório destaca Google pela IA agêntica, Palo Alto Networks para segurança de IA e Microsoft para IA corporativa. A competição no mercado de IA está se intensificando, com o Gartner prevendo que essas avaliações evoluirão conforme o setor amadurece.

title: Sizing Up Whether The Global Select Equity ETF Is A Buy Right Now
summary: The JPMorgan Global Select Equity ETF (JGLO) launched in September 2023 with $7.1 billion in assets and a 0.47% expense ratio. The ETF, which has gained 15% over the past year, is heavily concentrated in six mega-cap tech stocks, holding over a quarter of its assets in NVIDIA, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, and Meta. This concentration creates vulnerability if global equity returns broaden beyond U.S. mega-caps, exemplified by its underperformance against the iShares MSCI ACWI ETF in early 2026.

title: Microsoft Stock Can Grow 37%, Goldman Sachs Says. It Has Many Paths to AI Profit.
summary: Goldman Sachs believes Microsoft stock could surge by 37% due to its diversified investments in artificial intelligence. The report highlights Microsoft's historical success in benefiting from major technological shifts, positioning it strongly for the AI era.

title: Why Alphabet (GOOGL) stock is up today: Google shares jump over 1% as Alphabet becomes the fourth company
summary: Alphabet (GOOGL) shares surged over 1% on January 12, 2026, pushing its market capitalization beyond $4 trillion for the first time, making it the fourth company to reach this milestone. This rally is primarily driven by a multi-year AI partnership with Apple, making Google's Gemini the AI backbone for Siri, along with strong Google Cloud growth and successful Gemini 3 model rollout. The company has also surpassed Apple in total market value for the first time since 2019, reflecting renewed investor confidence in its AI and cloud strategies.

title: PayPal's Agentic Commerce Expansion: Will it Boost Top-Line Growth?
summary: PayPal recently announced a strategic partnership with Microsoft to integrate Copilot Checkout into Copilot, enabling seamless shopping experiences. This is part of PayPal's broader push into "agentic commerce" through collaborations with various platforms like OpenAI, Perplexity, Wix, and Shopify, aiming to leverage AI for enhanced discovery and checkout processes. Despite these initiatives, PayPal's shares have declined 22% in the last six months, though the stock appears undervalued with a Value Score of A and its 2026 EPS is projected to grow by 9.7%.

title: Alphabet hits $4 trillion valuation as AI refocus lifts sentiment
summary: Alphabet achieved a $4 trillion market valuation, driven by its intensified focus on artificial intelligence, following a deal for Apple's AI models to be based on Google's Gemini. The company's stock has surged about 65% in 2025, outperforming peers, and it has also seen significant growth in its Google Cloud unit and a stable advertising business. This milestone makes Alphabet the fourth company to reach this valuation, reflecting a significant shift in investor sentiment.

title: Google-Parent Alphabet Becomes Newest $4 Trillion Company, Joining Nvidia
summary: Alphabet's market capitalization briefly surpassed $4 trillion, making it the latest tech company to hit this valuation, driven by optimism over its AI advancements. This surge follows the successful launch of its Gemini 3 model and Apple's decision to integrate Gemini into Siri. Alphabet joins Nvidia above the $4 trillion mark, while Apple and Microsoft have fallen slightly below it.

title: Smart Data-Driven Pest Control
summary: Rentokil Initial plc has developed a "Smart Data-Driven Pest Control" system utilizing IoT, sensor networks, and cloud-based analytics for real-time monitoring and predictive pest management. This approach aims to improve responsiveness and resource allocation by shifting from scheduled visits to condition-based service delivery, reducing chemical use and operational disruption. The system provides prioritized work orders for technicians and dashboards for compliance, informing site design and sanitation changes for long-term effectiveness.

title: Alphabet hits $4-trillion valuation as AI refocus lifts sentiment
summary: Alphabet briefly reached a $4 trillion market valuation, driven by its intensified focus on artificial intelligence. This surge, which saw its class-A shares hit a record high, reflects growing investor confidence and follows the company surpassing Apple in market capitalization for the first time since 2019. The company's AI efforts, including its Google Cloud unit and the Gemini models, have contributed significantly to its strong performance and market leadership.

title: 'Big Short' Investor Michael Burry Bets Against Oracle—Here's His Advice

Despite his bearish stance on Oracle, he remains hesitant to short larger tech companies like Meta, Alphabet, and Microsoft, believing their diverse businesses will weather potential challenges.

title: Accelsius Closes $65 Million Series B Funding Led by Johnson Controls; Legrand Joining Round to Scale Liquid Cooling for Gigawatt-Class AI Factories – Company Announcement - FT.com
summary: Accelsius, a leader in two-phase, direct-to-chip liquid cooling for AI and high-performance computing, has closed a $65 million Series B funding round. The round was led by Johnson Controls, with strategic investment from Legrand, to scale liquid cooling solutions for AI factories. This investment will accelerate Accelsius' expansion, global reach, and the deployment of its proprietary NeuCool® technology, crucial for managing the extreme thermal demands of next-generation AI and HPC chips.

However, investors should remain aware of execution risks such as widening losses, ongoing dilution, volatile share price, and a high valuation.

title: AlphaTON Capital Closes $46M AI Infrastructure Expansion to
summary: AlphaTON Capital has announced a $46 million AI infrastructure expansion to address the demand for confidential compute, involving the deployment of 576 NVIDIA B300 chips. summary: SKYX Platforms Corp. announced it will supply its smart home platform technologies to a new luxury waterfront smart home community, Lake Shore Reserve, in Granite Falls, North Carolina. title: 3 Funds for 2026 and Beyond

title: Why RBC Sees Opportunity in F5 Inc. (FFIV) After the Breach-Driven Pullback

title: Radware Discovers ZombieAgent: New Zero-Click Vulnerability in OpenAI's Deep Research Agent Exposes Enterprises to Data Theft Risks
summary: Radware has identified a new zero-click indirect prompt injection vulnerability called ZombieAgent in OpenAI's Deep Research agent, which poses significant data theft and agent hijacking risks for enterprises. This vulnerability allows attackers to embed malicious directives invisibly within everyday communications, enabling them to manipulate AI agent behavior and exfiltrate sensitive information without user interaction. The attacks operate within OpenAI's cloud infrastructure, bypassing traditional security measures and highlighting a critical blind spot in current AI security practices.

title: iShares ETF Has A ‘Set And Forget’ Investment For Retirees You Don’t Need To Overthink

While it provides broad diversification and strong historical returns, it lacks downside protection and offers a modest dividend yield, making it suitable for retirees using it as an equity core paired with other stabilizing assets. Retirees needing stable, predictable income or those with a short time horizon should consider other options or pair ITOT with bonds or cash.

title: Radware Unveils “ZombieAgent”: A Newly Discovered Zero-Click, AI Agent Vulnerability Enabling Silent Takeover and Cloud-Based Data Exfiltration

The attack is invisible to traditional security tools as it occurs entirely within OpenAI's cloud infrastructure, posing a significant challenge for detection and prevention.

title: If You'd Invested $1,000 in the Invesco QQQ ETF 27 Years Ago, Here's How Much You'd Have Today

title: ‘ZombieAgent’ flaw exposes blind spots in ChatGPT AI
summary: Cybersecurity firm Radware has uncovered a new vulnerability called "ZombieAgent" that targets OpenAI’s ChatGPT-based AI agents, enabling silent data theft and autonomous spread within organizations. This zero-click indirect prompt injection flaw affects agentic AI workflows by embedding hidden instructions in content that AI agents process. The attack operates entirely in the cloud, creating blind spots for traditional monitoring tools and posing a significant threat of persistent data exfiltration and widespread infection.

title: ASX opens higher driven by a rally in Mesoblast and Codan

title: Alphabet Dethrones Apple Amid Tech Stock Shuffle

Apple, in contrast, has struggled to articulate a clear AI strategy. This reordering highlights the increasing importance of AI leadership in the tech sector and offers insights into the evolving landscape for Magnificent Seven stocks.

title: PayPal Powers Microsoft’s Launch of Copilot Checkout

This collaboration allows shoppers to discover, decide, and pay within Copilot, with PayPal handling merchant inventory surfacing, branded checkout, guest checkout, and credit card payments. The initiative aims to create seamless end-to-end shopping journeys and opportunities for merchants to connect with high-intent customers, leveraging AI to transform the e-commerce landscape.
