title: ‘ZombieAgent’ Attack Let Researchers Take Over ChatGPT
summary: Radware researchers have discovered a "ZombieAgent" attack that can bypass ChatGPT's protections to exfiltrate user data and implant persistent malicious logic into its long-term memory. The attack uses indirect prompt injection via malicious emails or files, allowing the AI to act as a spy tool without direct user interaction. OpenAI has since released a fix for these vulnerabilities, which were reported in September.

Wall Street analysts maintain a consensus Buy rating, with an average price target of $630.

title: The AI Throne Shifts: Alphabet Briefly Overtakes Apple as Monetization Momentum Rewrites Market Hierarchy

Alphabet's success is attributed to its "full-stack" AI leadership, including its Gemini models and custom AI chips, while Apple faces challenges with hardware plateauing and slower AI rollout. This event represents a fundamental shift in market sentiment, prioritizing "AI Utility" and "Compute Efficiency" and marking the transition from the mobile age to the agentic AI age.

title: IBM Finalizes $11 Billion Confluent Acquisition, Cementing Dominance in the "Data-in-Motion" Era

This deal strengthens IBM's position in real-time data processing, crucial for AI agents, and creates a "Trifecta" of hybrid cloud infrastructure when combined with previous acquisitions of Red Hat and HashiCorp. The acquisition is a strategic move to dominate the "data-in-motion" era, with IBM expecting significant software revenue growth and the deal also signals a shift in regulatory priorities towards fostering AI innovation.

title: Radware Unveils “ZombieAgent”: A Newly Discovered
summary: Radware has announced the discovery of "ZombieAgent," a new zero-click indirect prompt injection (IPI) vulnerability affecting OpenAI’s Deep Research agent. This vulnerability can lead to invisible data theft, persistent agent hijacking, and service-side execution that bypasses conventional security controls. ZombieAgent can implant malicious rules into an agent's long-term memory, allowing for autonomous propagation and silent exfiltration of sensitive data within OpenAI's cloud infrastructure without user interaction.

title: This High-Yield ETF Has Increased Payouts 11 Years Straight, and It's Still Undervalued

title: Microsoft Earnings Preview: What to Expect
summary: Microsoft (MSFT) is set to announce its fiscal Q2 2026 results, with analysts forecasting an adjusted EPS of $3.86, an increase of 19.5% year-over-year, and $15.86 for fiscal 2026. Despite a Q1 earnings beat, shares declined due to profitability pressures from AI investments, particularly a $3.1 billion loss related to OpenAI. Analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" rating with an average target price of $630.07, indicating a potential 31.7% upside.

title: Vistra Corp Acquires Cogentrix Energy Natural Gas Power Plants, Including 2 In PA, As Part Of Strategy To Feed A.I. Data Centers [Locking Up More Energy For A.I. Data Centers]
summary: Vistra Corp has acquired Cogentrix Energy's 10 natural gas power generation facilities, totaling 5,500 MW, including two in Pennsylvania. This acquisition is part of a broader strategy by energy companies and AI data center developers to secure power for data centers, raising concerns among consumer advocates about potential energy price increases for regular ratepayers. The article highlights that the soaring demand from AI data centers is pushing Pennsylvania's electric grid closer to unreliability.

title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Video Background Replacement Global Market Report 2025-2029 & 2034: Banuba and Agora Integrate AI Background Features for Advanced Video Platforms
summary: The global market for AI Video Background Replacement is experiencing significant growth, driven by increased video content creation, virtual backgrounds in hybrid workplaces, and advancements in AI algorithms and real-time processing. The market is projected to grow from $1.46 billion in 2024 to $1.77 billion in 2025, and further to $3.85 billion by 2029, with a CAGR of 21.4%. Key players include Amazon Web Services, Apple, Google, Microsoft, and others, with North America leading the market and Asia-Pacific expected to be the fastest-growing region.

title: SMX Announces $111.5M Equity Purchase Agreement with Target Capital 1, LLC
summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC has entered into an equity purchase agreement with Target Capital 1, LLC, totaling $111.5 million. This agreement includes the purchase of a $11.5 million convertible promissory note and an option for Target Capital to purchase up to $100 million in SMX ordinary shares, providing SMX with flexible funding for business development. A portion of the net proceeds will also be used to acquire bitcoin or another cryptocurrency as a reserve asset, subject to mutual consent.

title: Is It Worth Investing in Sterling Infrastructure (STRL) Based on Wall Street's Bullish Views?
summary: This article evaluates Sterling Infrastructure (STRL) based on Wall Street's average brokerage recommendation (ABR) and compares it with the Zacks Rank. While STRL currently has a bullish ABR of 1.80, the article cautions against relying solely on brokerage recommendations due to potential biases. It recommends using the Zacks Rank, which for STRL is currently #3 (Hold), as a more reliable indicator for investment decisions.

title: Microsoft Corporation $MSFT is Brian Low Financial Group LLC's 2nd Largest Position
summary: Brian Low Financial Group LLC significantly increased its stake in Microsoft (MSFT) by 16.3% in Q3, making it their second-largest holding. Microsoft also exceeded quarterly earnings estimates, reporting impressive EPS and revenue figures, alongside announcing a quarterly dividend of $0.91 per share. The company continues to show strong financial performance, high profitability, and strategic advancements in AI and cloud infrastructure.

title: TNL Mediagene Introduces NLWeb Support to Strengthen Its Digital Media as AI-Native Content Infrastructure for the AI-Driven Web
summary: TNL Mediagene has implemented Natural Language Web (NLWeb) support across its digital media assets, transforming its content into an AI-native infrastructure. This integration allows AI systems to directly understand, query, and utilize TNL Mediagene's content, moving beyond traditional link-based navigation to enable new monetization models like AI content licensing. The company views this as a foundational step in its long-term AI platform strategy, positioning its content to be highly interoperable within the evolving AI-driven web ecosystem.

title: Rezolve Ai to Take Center Stage at NRF 2026 as Agentic Commerce Emerges as Retail’s Next Growth Engine
summary: Rezolve Ai will participate in NRF 2026 to showcase its Brain Suite of AI solutions, focusing on Agentic Commerce for retail transformation. They will demonstrate how AI agents can drive sales, personalize customer experiences, and facilitate autonomous transactions through live sessions with Microsoft and Fashable, as well as executive roundtables. The company emphasizes Agentic Commerce as a pivotal technology for retailers to achieve ROI and enhanced customer engagement.

title: Earnings Preview: What to Expect From Jacobs Solutions’ Report
summary: Jacobs Solutions Inc. (J) is set to release its Q1 earnings, with analysts projecting a 12.8% increase in profit to $1.50 per share. The company has consistently beaten Wall Street's earnings estimates in the past four quarters. Despite underperforming relevant market indices over the past year, analysts have a "Moderate Buy" rating on the stock, with a projected upside of 14.9%.

title: 3 Top Quantum Computing Stocks to Buy in 2026
summary: This article identifies three leading technology companies - Nvidia, IBM, and Microsoft - as top quantum computing stocks to consider in 2026. While pure-play quantum companies can be risky, these established giants offer exposure to the emerging field without all-or-nothing gambles. Each company is actively involved in quantum computing research and development, leveraging their strong existing businesses and strategic investments to position themselves for future growth in this potentially vast market.

title: The iShares MSCI World ETF: A Concentrated Bet on U.S. Technology
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) is increasingly concentrated in U.S. technology stocks, with the U.S. constituting about 70% of its holdings, making its performance closely tied to a few American tech giants. Recent MSCI methodology decisions have temporarily stabilized the fund by postponing the removal of Digital Asset Treasury firms, avoiding significant outflows. However, investors face potential reweighting risks, valuation concerns in the tech sector, and the influence of systematic fund flows.

title: Guggenheim Lifts Palo Alto Networks (PANW) Rating Following Deal Activity and AI Tailwinds
summary: Guggenheim has upgraded Palo Alto Networks (PANW) from Sell to Neutral, citing the stock's recent underperformance, strategic acquisitions, and strong Free Cash Flow margins. The firm believes these factors, along with PANW's leadership in the security space and improving operational performance, mitigate the case for shorting the stock. Additionally, Palo Alto Networks is seen as well-positioned to benefit from AI-related threats due to its status as the largest pure-play vendor in cybersecurity.

title: Why Dine Brands (DIN) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Shares of Dine Brands (NYSE:DIN) rose 5.8% after UBS increased its price target for the stock from $21 to $35, while maintaining a "Neutral" rating. This positive adjustment, alongside an upgrade for a competitor, suggests increased analyst confidence in the restaurant industry and Dine Brands' value. Despite the stock's volatility, today's move indicates meaningful news that has contributed to Dine Brands reaching a new 52-week high, up 9.9% year-to-date.

title: Better Buy: Comparing the SPY and EQL ETF
summary: This article compares two ETFs, SPY and EQL, which both track the S&P 500 but use different weighting strategies. SPY is market-cap weighted, heavily concentrating in technology, while EQL is equal-sector weighted, distributing investments evenly across all eleven sectors. The article discusses their performance, expense ratios, dividend yields, and scenarios for which investor type each fund is best suited, also mentioning RSP as an alternative for true equal-weighting.

title: The Invesco RAFI US 1000 ETF (PRF) launched in 2005, provides extensive large-cap value market exposure
summary: The Invesco RAFI US 1000 ETF (PRF), launched in 2005, offers exposure to the Large Cap Value market through a smart beta strategy that aims to outperform by focusing on fundamental characteristics. With over $8.72 billion in assets and a 0.34% expense ratio, PRF primarily allocates to Financials, Information Technology, and Healthcare sectors. The ETF has performed well, gaining 19.44% over the last year, and its lower volatility and sensitivity to interest rates make it an interesting option for value-oriented traders.

title: Microsoft Acquires Osmos To Bring Autonomous Data Engineering to Fabric
summary: Microsoft has acquired Osmos, a Seattle-based startup specializing in autonomous data engineering powered by agentic AI. This acquisition aims to integrate Osmos's AI agents into Microsoft Fabric, enhancing data preparation and transformation workflows and directly challenging competitors like Databricks in the automated ETL space. Osmos's technology is expected to significantly reduce the time organizations spend on data preparation, allowing them to focus more on analysis.

title: Did Colgate-Palmolive’s (CL) Dividend King Status and Q4 Preview Just Redefine Its Defensive Edge?
summary: Colgate-Palmolive is gaining attention as a Dividend King, with analysts highlighting its innovation, cost initiatives, and focus on high-growth oral and home care categories ahead of its Q4 earnings. This reinforces its image as a defensive consumer staples leader. The company's investment narrative centers on its ability to convert a science-led franchise into steady earnings and dividend power, with upcoming Q4 earnings providing a key catalyst.

title: PC Connection launches AI webinar with Microsoft 365 Copilot
summary: PC Connection has launched a new webinar titled "Mastering AI with Microsoft 365 Copilot," aimed at helping users enhance their skills by demonstrating how to streamline tasks and improve security using AI tools. The webinar is accessible at any time, allowing participants to integrate AI effectively into their workflows. This initiative helps users leverage AI for task optimization and security within the Microsoft 365 environment.

title: ServiceNow Drops 30% in a Year: Buy, Sell or Hold the NOW Stock?
summary: ServiceNow's shares have dropped nearly 30% in the past year, underperforming the sector due to macroeconomic challenges and slowing subscription revenue growth. Despite being currently overvalued with a bearish technical trend, the company's AI-powered workflows, expanding partner base, and recent acquisitions are expected to improve its top-line growth in 2026. Given the mixed outlook, Zacks Investment Research suggests a "Hold" rating for NOW stock.

title: Western Digital stock jumps nearly 14% as CES chip talk lifts storage and memory shares
summary: Western Digital shares soared by nearly 14% after Nvidia's CEO announced a new storage technology at CES, fueling a rally in storage and memory stocks. This surge, also seen in SanDisk, Seagate, and Micron, is attributed to increasing demand for AI infrastructure and improved memory market conditions. Investors are reacting positively to signs of tight memory supply and the critical role storage plays in AI buildouts.

title: Is This Under-the-Radar Infrastructure Stock the Best Way to Play AI Without Buying Chips?
summary: As artificial intelligence (AI) continues to develop at a rapid pace, the infrastructure supporting it requires a reliable and clean power source. Brookfield Renewable, a leader in clean energy with a global presence, is poised to capitalize on this demand by supplying power to AI infrastructure build-outs for companies like Microsoft and Google. For investors looking for a less direct play on AI, Brookfield Renewable offers an attractive opportunity with its stable distribution yield and potential for consistent dividend growth.

title: Cloud Agent in 2025: A Year of Scale, Security, and Smarter Visibility
summary: The Qualys Cloud Agent experienced significant growth and evolution in 2025, driven by increased adoption across diverse environments and a focus on scale, security, and visibility. Key advancements included Deep Scan for comprehensive vulnerability detection, bifurcated Software Composition Analysis (SwCA) for runtime and build-time security, and Manifest Version Control for safer updates. The platform also expanded support for major operating systems like AIX and BSD, achieved FedRAMP High Authorization, and introduced ETM Identity to quantify the identity attack surface.

title: AerCap’s Big Run Has Investors Asking What’s Next
summary: AerCap Holdings (NYSE: AER), the world's largest aircraft leasing company, has significantly outperformed the S&P 500 with a 56.2% share price gain over the past year. This growth is fueled by strong post-pandemic travel demand, rising lease rates, and record asset sale gains, alongside a $500 million share repurchase program and consistent profitability. Despite its strong performance and a low valuation, future growth hinges on sustained travel demand and stable interest rates, which affect its capital-intensive business model.

title: J.P. Morgan: AI Bubble Not About to Burst
summary: J.P. Morgan believes that despite the ingredients for an AI bubble being present, an imminent burst is unlikely, with AI investments being justified and sustainable. The firm forecasts significant capital expenditure growth in AI, tripling for large US tech companies by 2026, and notes that AI is poised to transform industries. However, challenges like power infrastructure, data privacy, and regulatory concerns could moderate excessive investor enthusiasm.

title: Will the Hanley Energy Buyout Fuel JBL's Prospects in AI Data Center?
summary: Jabil (JBL) recently acquired Hanley Energy Group for $725 million, aiming to strengthen its position in the rapidly expanding AI data center market. Hanley's expertise in energy management and critical power solutions will complement Jabil's existing capabilities, especially as AI data centers require significant power optimization. Jabil is also investing heavily and has made other acquisitions to expand its footprint in this competitive sector, facing rivals like Celestica and Flex Ltd.

title: Is Microsoft (MSFT) a Buy as Wall Street Analysts Look Optimistic?
summary: Wall Street analysts currently have an optimistic outlook on Microsoft (MSFT), with an average brokerage recommendation of 1.27, representing a strong buy. However, the article suggests that investors should not solely rely on these recommendations due to potential biases and recommends using tools like the Zacks Rank for a more effective analysis of future stock price movements. The Zacks Rank for Microsoft is currently a #2 (Buy), supported by increasing earnings estimates.

title: Trex (TREX) Stock Is Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of Trex Company (NYSE:TREX) jumped 3.6% after UBS upgraded the stock to Buy from Neutral and raised its price target to $52, reflecting confidence in future sales growth and margin expansion. Despite the upgrade and recent positive sentiment from Goldman Sachs, Trex's shares are still trading significantly below their 52-week high, with a 5-year investment showing a substantial loss. The company benefits from rising demand for sustainable building materials.

title: Stock Market Live January 6: Nvidia Revs Up, S&P 500 (VOO) Slips
summary: Nvidia announced plans to produce AI chips and software for robotaxis by 2027, with Mercedes-Benz already planning to use Nvidia's tech. This news has led Wedbush analyst Daniel Ives to call Nvidia, Microsoft, and Oracle "table-pounder opportunities" for investors, highlighting underestimation of demand for Nvidia. Meanwhile, Ford reported a 6% sales growth in 2025, but faced headwinds in Q4 from supply chain issues and decreased EV sales due to expiring tax credits, leading to a mixed market performance where the S&P 500 (VOO) slightly declined despite Nvidia's gains.

title: SP Electricity North West Moves from Outages to Outstanding Performance with Rimini Street
summary: SP Electricity North West (SP ENW) has successfully resolved its SAP system challenges and enhanced performance by partnering with Rimini Street for support and professional services. The collaboration led to significant cost savings and eliminated persistent issues, such as login problems that generated hundreds of thousands of British pounds in overhead costs and numerous password reset tickets. SP ENW now views Rimini Street as a critical supplier, enabling them to maximize their SAP investment and build a stable technology roadmap for the future.

title: Goldman's 2026 Call: S&P 500 To 7,600 — But Valuations Are The Wild Card
summary: Goldman Sachs projects the S&P 500 to reach 7,600 by 2026, driven by strong earnings growth and AI adoption, expecting a 12% total return. However, the firm highlights elevated market valuations as a significant risk that could lead to substantial volatility if corporate performance disappoints. The investment bank also points out concentration risk in the S&P 500, with a few mega-cap stocks heavily influencing index returns.

title: Weave Communications stock downgraded by Raymond James on growth timing
summary: Raymond James downgraded Weave Communications Inc. (NYSE: WEAV) from Strong Buy to Outperform and reduced its price target to $10.00 from $12.00, citing concerns about growth timing and a challenging small and medium-sized business software sector. Despite this, the firm maintains a positive long-term outlook due to the company's progress in key growth initiatives and its current valuation being deemed undervalued by InvestingPro.

title: International Business Machines: How IBM Is Re?Wiring Enterprise AI for the Next Decade
summary: International Business Machines is transforming itself into an enterprise AI and hybrid cloud backbone for organizations requiring high reliability and compliance. The company is focusing on Watsonx, Red Hat OpenShift, and updated mainframes and Power servers to enable in-place modernization for regulated and mission-critical workloads. IBM aims to differentiate itself by offering governed AI, deep integration with legacy systems, and consulting-driven stickiness, contrasting with hyperscalers like Microsoft, Amazon, and Google.

title: Amkor Technology (AMKR) Hits 25-Year High on Rosy Prospects
summary: Amkor Technology Inc. (AMKR) saw its stock reach a 25-year high after Needham & Company upgraded its price target by 35% to $50, citing Amkor's potential to become a leader in Chip on Wafer on Substrate (CoWoS) technology. This surge is driven by increasing demand for AI chips and an anticipated transition to Chip on Polymer on Substrate (CoPoS), which could lead Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd. to outsource CoWoS demand to Amkor.

title: Oracle stock slips as Jefferies sticks to $400 target; what investors watch next
summary: Oracle stock dipped slightly despite Jefferies maintaining a "buy" rating and a $400 price target, highlighting investor concerns over the cost of AI data-center infrastructure. The company's valuation remains a point of contention, with its forward P/E ratio higher than some tech giants, while its next major test will be its fiscal third-quarter 2026 earnings update in mid-March.

title: Adobe Underperforms Broader Tech Gains: What the "Software Slog" Means for AI Monetization
summary: Adobe Inc. (ADBE) underperformed broader tech gains on January 6, 2026, creating investor skepticism around the immediate monetization of its AI strategies despite strong Q4 2025 revenues. A "Hold" downgrade by Jefferies Financial Group Inc. (JEF) and concerns over decelerating growth and competition from AI-native startups highlight a broader shift from "AI Euphoria" to "Fundamental Scrutiny" in the software sector. The article suggests Adobe's success will depend on its ability to effectively monetize its AI offerings, particularly in the video AI space, to move past the current valuation gap.

title: The Best Dividend ETF to Invest $1,000 in Right Now
summary: The Schwab U.S. Dividend Equity ETF (SCHD) is presented as a strong investment option for dividend investors despite recent underperformance compared to the S&P 500. The ETF follows a specific index that screens for financially strong companies with consistent dividend growth, high yields, and fast-growing dividends. Its lower exposure to technology stocks positions it well for a potential market rotation away from concentrated tech leadership.

title: A Deep Dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF’s Standout Year
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) had a strong year in 2025, returning over 22% and growing its assets to more than $6.8 billion, primarily driven by U.S. technology stocks. The ETF provides diversified access to large and mid-cap companies across 23 developed nations, with a significant allocation to U.S. mega-cap firms, particularly in technology. Despite its concentration in U.S. tech, the fund holds 1,320 individual securities and maintains a 5-star Morningstar rating, making it suitable for investors seeking developed market exposure while avoiding emerging economies.

title: How Ciena’s AI Webscale Surge And S&P 500 Prospects At Ciena (CIEN) Has Changed Its Investment Story
summary: Ciena has recently reported strong fiscal fourth-quarter results, driven by a significant increase in AI-focused webscale customers, which now constitute 42% of its sales. The company is also seen as a strong candidate for S&P 500 index inclusion in early 2026, potentially impacting its investor base and liquidity. This article examines how Ciena's evolving role in AI infrastructure is reshaping its investment narrative and long-term business outlook, projecting $6.5 billion in revenue and $590.5 million in earnings by 2028.

title: Should iShares S&P 100 ETF (OEF) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The iShares S&P 100 ETF (OEF) is highlighted as a large-cap blend ETF focusing on major US companies, offering stability and diversification. The article details its expense ratio, sector exposure with top holdings in Information Technology, and its performance and risk profile. It suggests OEF as a strong option for investors in this segment, while also mentioning alternative ETFs like IVV and VOO.

title: AI-First Hyperscalers: 2026’s Sprint Meets the Power Bottleneck
summary: In 2026, hyperscalers are aggressively expanding their AI-first infrastructure, with a projected doubling of total data center capacity within twelve quarters and capital expenditures exceeding $600 billion. However, this rapid growth is encountering significant challenges, including power constraints, long equipment lead times, local opposition, and the need to address growing sustainability pressures. The shift towards AI-optimized data centers, requiring tens of gigawatts of power, is driving innovative strategies across major players like AWS, Microsoft, Google, Meta, and Oracle, while also pushing the industry to prioritize renewable energy and advanced cooling solutions amidst increasing grid pressure and geopolitical regulations.

title: Ryanair Reports 7% December Traffic Growth and 206.5 Million Rolling Annual Passengers
summary: Ryanair announced a 7% year-on-year increase in December 2025 traffic, reaching 14.5 million passengers, while maintaining a 92% load factor. The airline's rolling 12-month passenger count grew by 5% to 206.5 million, with a steady 94% load factor, reinforcing its strong market position. An analyst has a Buy rating on RYAAY stock with a $74.00 price target, and TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, also rates it "Outperform" due to its strong financial performance and strategic initiatives.

title: Microsoft Corp. (MSFT) RBC & Jefferies Maintain “Buy” Ratings
summary: RBC Capital Markets and Jefferies Financial Group have both reaffirmed "Buy" ratings for Microsoft Corp. (MSFT), highlighting strong analyst confidence in the company's long-term growth. Analysts point to Microsoft's diversified business model, leadership in high-growth technology sectors like cloud and AI, and robust free cash flow generation as key drivers for continued outperformance and stability. This consistent support underscores Microsoft's position as a leading technology company with a strong outlook.

title: Ag Plus, Inc. -
summary: Revvity, Inc. (RVTY), a Massachusetts-based life sciences and diagnostics company, is set to announce its Q4 2025 earnings. Analysts expect an adjusted EPS of $1.54, an 8.5% increase from the prior year, with a strong history of exceeding bottom-line estimates. Despite this, RVTY's stock has underperformed the broader market over the past year due to weak revenue growth, declining profitability, and a relatively full valuation, leading to caution among investors.

title: ServiceNow (NOW) stock barely moves after ex-Microsoft legal chief Nowbar is named president — here’s what investors watch next
summary: ServiceNow appointed former Microsoft legal chief Hossein Nowbar as its new president and chief legal officer, replacing Russ Elmer, with its stock closing up 0.05% after the announcement. The move occurs as the company focuses on AI and cybersecurity amidst increased scrutiny on data and privacy. While analysts have cut price targets slightly, they maintain bullish ratings, with investors now watching for the next earnings report in February and updates on the Armis acquisition timeline.

title: ServiceNow snags Microsoft vet to run legal amid M&A spree
summary: ServiceNow has appointed Hossein Nowbar, a veteran from Microsoft, as its new chief legal officer and president, tasked with overseeing its extensive legal and compliance operations. Nowbar brings significant experience in complex M&A deals and developing AI-related legal policies from his 28 years at Microsoft. His appointment aligns with ServiceNow's aggressive acquisition strategy, as the company is currently on an M&A tear in 2025 with several deals announced or expected to close.

title: ServiceNow names Microsoft veteran Hossein Nowbar as president and chief legal officer
summary: Hossein Nowbar, a Microsoft veteran with nearly 30 years of experience, has been appointed as the president and chief legal officer of ServiceNow. His role will be critical in driving ServiceNow's aggressive AI-powered growth strategy. The announcement highlights ServiceNow's focus on strengthening its leadership team to support its future initiatives.

title: NVIDIA Rubin Platform, Open Models, Autonomous Driving: NVIDIA Presents Blueprint for the Future at CES
summary: At CES 2026, NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang unveiled the Rubin platform, an extreme-codesigned AI platform in full production, and introduced Alpamayo, an open reasoning model family for autonomous vehicle development. He emphasized NVIDIA's commitment to open models for various domains, trained on NVIDIA supercomputers, and showcased AI integration into personal devices and physical AI through robotics and autonomous driving. Huang highlighted NVIDIA's full-stack approach to drive AI innovation, from data centers to physical AI applications.

title: NVIDIA Kicks Off the Next Generation of AI With Rubin — Six New Chips, One Incredible AI Supercomputer
summary: NVIDIA has launched the Rubin platform, a new generation of AI supercomputers featuring six advanced chips designed to accelerate AI development. The Rubin platform promises significantly reduced training times and inference token costs, aiming for up to a 10x reduction in inference token cost and requiring 4x fewer GPUs for MoE models compared to the Blackwell platform. Major industry players like Microsoft, OpenAI, and Meta are already on board to adopt this new technology, which introduces innovations like NVIDIA Vera CPU, Rubin GPU, and NVLink 6 Switch.

title: Nvidia Details New A.I. Chips and Autonomous Car Project With Mercedes
summary: Nvidia introduced its new Vera Rubin A.I. chip at CES, promising increased computing power with less energy consumption. This chip, shipping later in the year, is designed to enhance A.I. training efficiency and reduce operational costs for companies like Microsoft and Amazon. Additionally, Nvidia announced a partnership with Mercedes-Benz to integrate its self-driving technology into cars this year, rivaling Tesla's Autopilot.

title: A Deep Dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH): Performance and Positioning
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) saw strong performance in 2025, driven by AI investments and U.S. tech, but faces increased volatility in 2026 due to high concentration and valuation. Its portfolio is heavily weighted towards U.S. large-cap tech companies, with NVIDIA now its largest holding. Investors should watch upcoming MSCI index reviews, tech earnings, and the "soft landing" economic scenario for its Q1 2026 trajectory.

title: Iqvia stock hits 52-week high at 234.33 USD By Investing.com
summary: Iqvia Holdings Inc. (IQV) stock reached a 52-week high of $234.33, reflecting a 14.17% return over the past year and a 37.22% surge in six months, with a "GOOD" financial health rating and a market cap of $39.87 billion. Recent strategic moves include refinancing loans, a partnership with Amazon Web Services for AI-powered clinical trial automation, and the appointment of Nobel laureate Dr. William G. Kaelin Jr. to its board.

title: ZoomInfo, Upstart, F5, Marqeta, and Upland Software Stocks Trade Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Several tech stocks, including ZoomInfo, Upstart, F5, Marqeta, and Upland Software, saw significant jumps in trading, driven by investor attention on the annual CES 2026 technology conference and the central theme of artificial intelligence. This rally continued the AI-fueled momentum from the previous year, boosting shares across the semiconductor and technology sectors. Specifically, Upstart's shares experienced a 9% surge, building on recent market optimism due to easing inflation data.

title: Oracle shares suffer on OpenAI concerns, But UBS sees 2026 upside
summary: Oracle's shares have fallen 41% since mid-September 2025 due to investor concerns about the company's outlook and broader skepticism surrounding OpenAI's growth prospects. Despite this, UBS maintains a Buy rating on Oracle, predicting a potential revenue acceleration and a rebound in the AI narrative in the first half of 2026. The bank identifies several catalysts that could restore confidence in OpenAI and related tech stocks, including planned capital raises, improved ChatGPT usage, the anticipated release of GPT-6, increased enterprise adoption, and partnerships like Oracle's with xAI.

title: Microsoft announces acquisition of Osmos to accelerate autonomous data engineering in Fabric
summary: Microsoft has announced the acquisition of Osmos, an agentic AI data engineering platform, to enhance its Microsoft Fabric offering. This acquisition aims to simplify complex data workflows and accelerate autonomous data engineering by using AI to transform raw data into analytics and AI-ready assets within OneLake. The Osmos team will join Microsoft's Fabric engineering organization to further the vision of intuitive and AI-ready data experiences.

title: Sandisk stock hits fresh 52-week high after CES “Optimus” rebrand as memory-supply story drives swings
summary: Sandisk shares reached a new 52-week high on Monday before closing slightly lower, driven by a broader interest in memory-related stocks and the company's "Optimus" rebrand at CES 2026 for its consumer NVMe SSDs. The stock's performance reflects the volatile NAND flash market, where supply changes heavily influence pricing, especially with increasing demand from AI infrastructure buildouts. Investors are now looking to Sandisk's upcoming Q2 earnings call on January 29th for further insights into demand and pricing.

title: ServiceNow appoints Hossein Nowbar as President and CLO
summary: ServiceNow (NYSE: NOW) has announced the appointment of Hossein Nowbar as President and Chief Legal Officer (CLO), succeeding Russ Elmer, who transitions to Special Counsel. Nowbar brings extensive experience from Microsoft, where he served as Chief Legal Officer, and will oversee global legal, ethics, governance, compliance, and corporate affairs, helping to advance responsible innovation and support ServiceNow's long-term growth strategy.

title: NaaS Technology Sets January 23, 2026 Extraordinary General Meeting for Key Shareholder Votes
summary: NaaS Technology Inc. announced an Extraordinary General Meeting (EGM) for January 23, 2026, in Langfang, Hebei Province, to vote on proposed resolutions. Shareholders as of January 2, 2026, are eligible to participate, with the board strongly endorsing a "yes" vote for these strategically important decisions. Despite the board's optimism, NaaS (NAAS) currently holds a Neutral rating from analysts, with a $3.50 price target, primarily due to financial performance concerns.

title: Insight Enterprises (NASDAQ:NSIT) Receives Outperform Rating from Barrington Research
summary: Barrington Research has reissued an "outperform" rating for Insight Enterprises (NASDAQ:NSIT), setting a $120 price target, which implies a potential 41.8% upside. Despite this, other analysts offer a mixed outlook, resulting in an average "Hold" rating and a $103.33 price target. The company recently missed quarterly revenue and EPS estimates and provided FY2025 guidance that aligns with consensus.

title: RBC Bearings stock hits all-time high at 466.1 USD By Investing.com
summary: RBC Bearings Incorporated (NYSE:RBC) has reached an all-time high of $466.1, marking a 54.7% increase over the past year. Following these positive developments, Truist Securities and BofA Securities have maintained or upgraded their ratings, highlighting growth potential in the aerospace and defense markets.

title: MKS Instruments stock hits 52-week high at 173.81 USD By Investing.com
summary: MKS Instruments (MKSI) stock recently hit a 52-week high of $173.81, reflecting a strong performance with a 51.37% increase over the past year. This surge is supported by positive Q3 2025 earnings which exceeded analyst expectations and upward revisions in price targets from firms like KeyBanc and Mizuho, indicating continued optimism for the company's semiconductor market position. MKS Instruments has also maintained dividend payments for 15 consecutive years with a 0.52% yield.

title: The Platform Paradox: Tenable Hits 52-Week Low as Cybersecurity Giants Crowd Out the Specialists
summary: Tenable Holdings (NASDAQ: TENB), a leader in vulnerability management, recently hit a new 52-week low as the cybersecurity market shifts towards "platformization" and away from specialized tools. This trend benefits larger companies like Palo Alto Networks, CrowdStrike, and Microsoft, forcing specialists to either pivot their strategies or become acquisition targets. The article highlights Tenable's options, including margin focus, acquisition by a larger entity, or its own "roll-up" strategy, emphasizing that the market now favors integrated platforms over best-of-breed technology.

title: Palo Alto Networks won't end spend with rumored $400M endpoint acquisition
summary: Palo Alto Networks is rumored to be acquiring Israeli endpoint security vendor Koi Security for $400 million, following its recent $25 billion acquisition of CyberArk and $3.35 billion acquisition of Chronosphere. Koi Security, founded in January 2024, specializes in endpoint security posture management and has already raised $48 million. title: The AI PC Arms Race: Qualcomm, AMD, and Intel Battle for the NPU Market

This arms race is significantly reshaping the tech ecosystem, impacting software developers, hardware OEMs, and the broader GPU market, while also addressing critical concerns about privacy and latency through "Local AI."

title: Royal Bank Of Canada $RY Shares Bought by Osaic Holdings Inc.
summary: Osaic Holdings Inc. significantly increased its stake in Royal Bank of Canada (NYSE:RY) by 104.6% in the second quarter, now holding 75,866 shares valued at $9.14 million. This move follows RBC's strong earnings report, which beat analyst expectations with $2.76 EPS and revenue of $12.27 billion, a 14.2% year-over-year increase. The bank also raised its quarterly dividend to $1.64, offering an annualized yield of approximately 3.9%.

title: Flputnam Investment Management Co. Buys 25,173 Shares of Lam Research Corporation $LRCX
summary: Flputnam Investment Management Co. increased its stake in Lam Research Corporation by 5.3%, purchasing an additional 25,173 shares and now holding 496,854 shares valued at $66.53 million. This makes Lam Research the 17th largest position in Flputnam's portfolio, representing 1.0% of their total holdings. The increase in holdings aligns with a positive sentiment from several sell-side firms, which have raised price targets for LRCX and maintained buy/outperform ratings, coupled with the company's strong Q3 earnings beat and positive Q2 2026 guidance.

title: Infosys Stock News Today (Dec 21, 2025): INFY’s “Mystery” ADR Spike, Company Clarification, and Analyst Forecasts Ahead of Q3 Results
summary: Infosys Limited's U.S.-listed ADRs experienced an unexplained surge and subsequent trading halts on December 19, 2025, which the company clarified was not due to any material events requiring disclosure. Analysts and commentators attribute the volatility to market-structure issues like short squeezes, thin liquidity, or data-feed errors rather than fundamental changes. The article also provides a comprehensive update on Infosys' recent fundamentals, corporate actions, and analyst forecasts ahead of its Q3 FY22 results on January 14, 2026.

title: UBS Analyst Maintains A Buy On DTE Energy Company (DTE)
summary: UBS analyst William Appicelli maintained a Buy recommendation on DTE Energy Company (NYSE:DTE) shares but lowered the price objective to $151 from $155 on December 17, 2025. This follows Jefferies upgrading DTE to Buy on December 11, 2025, increasing its price objective to $150 and projecting an 8.1% compound annual EPS growth rate for 2026-2030 due to data center prospects. JPMorgan, however, retained a Neutral rating and reduced its price target to $145.

title: Agentic AI to drive autonomous enterprises by 2026, says Wipro CTO
summary: Wipro CTO Sandhya Arun predicts that by 2026, Agentic AI will lead to autonomous enterprises where networks of AI agents manage complex business workflows across various functions. This shift will involve a fundamental change in the human workforce's role from execution to orchestration, with a focus on specialized, domain-native AI models. Workforce readiness and continuous skilling will be crucial for enterprises to thrive in this AI-first world.

title: Will New Board Additions and NAVER Tie-Up Change Spotify Technology's (SPOT) Growth Narrative?
summary: Spotify Technology S.A. recently elected new board members Alex Norström and Gustav Söderström and advanced a key partnership with NAVER Corp in South Korea. These developments highlight Spotify's efforts to deepen engagement and expand monetization in global markets, with the NAVER integration serving as a testbed for user growth and paid conversion. Despite a projected fair value offering a 29% upside, investors should consider the ongoing regulatory challenges and the need for Spotify to scale higher-margin, non-music formats.

title: Is monday.com’s (MNDY) AI Spending Power Quietly Redefining Its Competitive Moat?
summary: monday.com's strong gross margins and free cash flow enable aggressive AI investments, positioning it uniquely against competitors. Recent analyst optimism highlights the company's AI-driven growth strategy and ecosystem expansion, despite risks like high sales costs and slowing SMB customer additions. Upcoming product updates like monday agents, magic, and campaigns aim to deepen enterprise usage and solidify its market position.

title: Martin Marietta extends and modifies key credit facility
summary: Martin Marietta Materials (MLM) has extended and modified a key credit facility with its lenders and JPMorgan Chase Bank, amending its existing financing arrangements. This move, announced on December 19, 2025, aims to support the company's capital structure and liquidity. Analysts currently rate MLM as a Buy with a $730.00 price target, and TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, also rates it "Outperform" due to its strong financial position despite potential overvaluation risks.

title: Polestar Secures USD 300 Million PIPE and USD 300 Million Debt-to-Equity Swap to Bolster Liquidity
summary: Polestar has announced a series of financial maneuvers designed to significantly improve its liquidity and strengthen its balance sheet. This includes a $300 million private equity investment through a PIPE from two banks and a $300 million debt-to-equity conversion by Geely Sweden Holdings. These actions underscore continued backing from its largest shareholder and aim to ease funding pressures in the competitive EV market.

title: XLK vs. IYW: Which is the Better Choice for Tech-Focused Investors?
summary: This article compares two leading tech-focused ETFs, XLK and IYW, to help investors decide which is better. While both track U.S. technology stocks and have similar performance, XLK offers a lower expense ratio and higher dividend yield. IYW provides broader diversification within the tech sector with more holdings.

title: Insider Purchase and Analyst Confidence Signal Potential Turnaround for Glimpse Group
summary: The Glimpse Group (Glimpse) has garnered market attention due to a significant insider purchase by CEO Lyron Bentovim and a reaffirmed "Buy" rating from WestPark Capital analyst Casey Ryan. This comes despite a 43% decline in quarterly revenue attributed to delays in U.S. Department of Defense contracts. Major institutional investors have also increased their stakes, and the company maintains a debt-free balance sheet, suggesting potential for recovery.

title: Willdan Group (WLDN) Is Up 7.6% After Raising 2025 Targets And Buying AI Power Firm
summary: Willdan Group (WLDN) saw a 7.6% stock increase after announcing strong earnings, elevating its 2025 financial targets, and acquiring Alternative Power Generation, Inc. This strategic move enhances Willdan's AI-driven energy infrastructure capabilities, especially crucial with surging AI-workload electricity demand. The company's expansion into data-center solutions and growing utility-focused software contracts position it as a key player in the U.S. energy transition.

title: Salesforce (CRM) Stock News and Forecasts on Dec. 20, 2025: Agentforce AI Momentum, Qualified Acquisition, and Wall Street Price Targets
summary: Salesforce (CRM) stock is at a critical juncture, facing debates about its valuation as a potential bargain versus a "value trap" amid market shifts towards AI infrastructure. The company is emphasizing its Agentforce and Data 360 AI offerings, showcasing measurable traction and strategic acquisitions like Qualified, while analysts provide mixed, yet generally constructive, price targets. Investors are closely watching how Salesforce's AI strategy impacts growth and margins in 2026.

title: What Pegasystems (PEGA)'s Agentic AI Upgrade and Dividend Reaffirmation Means For Shareholders
summary: Pegasystems Inc. (PEGA) has upgraded its Pega Client Lifecycle Management platform with advanced agentic AI to automate key financial institution processes, reinforcing AI-led compliance as a growth driver. The company also reaffirmed its quarterly cash dividend of US$0.03 per share for January 2026, signaling management's confidence in cash generation despite significant AI investments. While the new AI capabilities are central to Pega's growth catalysts, competitive pressures and the need for clear differentiation are noted as crucial factors for investors to consider.

title: Oracle Corporation $ORCL Stake Lowered by Voya Financial Advisors Inc.
summary: Voya Financial Advisors Inc. significantly decreased its stake in Oracle Corporation by 60% during the third quarter, reducing its holdings to 4,207 shares valued at approximately $1.19 million. This move comes amidst insider selling totaling over $45 million in the last 90 days, though corporate insiders still own a substantial 40.9% of the company's stock. Oracle recently beat EPS expectations but fell slightly short on revenue, and despite a "Moderate Buy" consensus from analysts, the company faces mixed news regarding its involvement in the U.S. TikTok joint venture and concerns over data-center financing and leverage.

title: Roomba's bankruptcy may wreck a lot more than one robot vacuum maker
summary: The bankruptcy of iRobot, maker of Roomba vacuums, highlights broader issues for struggling tech companies, exacerbated by regulatory blockades on M&A deals and intense competition from cheaper rivals. The abandoned Amazon acquisition, intended to save iRobot, ultimately led to its sale to a Chinese contract manufacturer, illustrating the complex environment for tech innovation and consolidation. Experts view this as a cautionary tale for the M&A landscape and the impact of antitrust scrutiny.

title: Nebius Group N.V. (NBIS) Stock News: Blackwell Ultra Launch, Microsoft & Meta Deals, and Wall Street Forecasts (Dec. 20, 2025)
summary: Nebius Group N.V. (NBIS) stock surged after the company announced the launch of its AI Cloud 3.1 with NVIDIA Blackwell Ultra capacity and detailed multi-year deals with Microsoft and Meta worth billions. Despite explosive revenue growth, Nebius faces widening losses and massive capital expenditures as it aggressively builds out its AI infrastructure. Wall Street analysts have highly dispersed price targets, reflecting the high-stakes and volatile nature of the "neocloud" sector.

title: Amdocs (NASDAQ: DOX) files 2025 Form 20-F, makes annual report available
summary: Amdocs (NASDAQ: DOX) has filed its Annual Report on Form 20-F for the fiscal year ended September 30, 2025, with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on December 15, 2025. This report, which includes the company's financial statements, is accessible on Amdocs' investor website and can be requested free of charge by shareholders. The filing is a routine regulatory event that follows several positive operational announcements, including new multi-year agreements and expanded managed services.

title: Wells Fargo Reiterates Overweight Rating on Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN)
summary: Wells Fargo reiterated an Overweight rating on Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) with a $295 price target, following a similar move by BMO Capital that raised its price target to $304. The reaffirmation comes amidst reports of Amazon negotiating a potential $10 billion investment in OpenAI, which could involve using Amazon's AI chips. Wall Street analysts currently hold a consensus Strong Buy rating for AMZN with an average target price of $296.12.

title: Analysts See 33% Upside To Microsoft Corporation (MSFT)
summary: Wall Street analysts have a consensus Strong Buy rating on Microsoft Corporation (MSFT), with a one-year average share price target of $632.22, representing a 33% upside. Recent analyst updates include a Buy rating from Morgan Stanley and an Accumulate rating from Phillip Securities. The company is actively investing in AI and cloud infrastructure, with significant planned investments in India and Canada.

title: How TD SYNNEX’s New AI Game Plan Workshops Could Impact TD SYNNEX (SNX) Investors
summary: TD SYNNEX recently introduced AI Game Plan workshops, positioning itself as an AI enablement hub and shifting towards higher-value consultative services. This move supports its strategy of evolving from low-margin IT distribution to more lucrative AI solutions, aiming for steady revenue and earnings growth by 2028. While individual fair value estimates for SNX vary, these initiatives are seen as reinforcing its investment narrative, despite potential near-term margin pressures.

title: Infosys Stock Leaps: Is it a Buy Now?
summary: Infosys Limited's stock has risen by 5.32% following a significant AI partnership announcement with Microsoft, involving the deployment of over 200,000 AI Copilot licenses. The company's strong financial health, strategic AI initiatives, and robust balance sheet suggest a promising outlook, leading analysts to express a bullish sentiment on the stock. While current market movements show short-term volatility, the long-term prospects, driven by technological foresight and financial discipline, make it an attractive proposition for investors.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: Amazon in early talks for major OpenAI stake, source says
summary: Amazon is reportedly in early discussions to make a significant investment in OpenAI, potentially valuing the AI firm at over US$500 billion, with Amazon possibly investing around $10 billion. This potential deal would strengthen Amazon's ties to OpenAI, which is also preparing for a possible IPO, and would underscore the high demand for computing capacity in the AI industry. The talks also highlight OpenAI's increasing flexibility in forming partnerships following its move from non-profit roots and its restructured relationship with Microsoft.

title: Western Digital Stock (WDC) After Hours Today, Dec. 19, 2025: Nasdaq-100 Inclusion Looms—What to Know Before the Next Market Open
summary: Western Digital (NASDAQ: WDC) saw its stock rise after closing on Friday, December 19, 2025, driven by anticipation of its inclusion in the Nasdaq-100 Index, effective December 22, 2025. This inclusion is expected to generate demand from index-linked products and is bolstered by strong fundamentals and a positive market narrative around AI-driven storage demand. Investors should be aware of potential volatility around Monday's opening due to the "index effect" and may see a "sell-the-news" dynamic after forced buying is satisfied.

title: Commvault Partners With Pinecone to Add Cyber Resilience for Enterprise AI Vector Data
summary: Commvault has partnered with Pinecone to enhance cyber resilience for vector databases used in enterprise AI applications. This collaboration aims to protect Pinecone vector workloads through Commvault Cloud's features like immutable backups, point-in-time recovery, and extended retention, without compromising query performance. The integration, expected in the first half of 2026, will provide crucial independent recovery options for AI data that often lacks robust protection against corruption or compromise.

title: Data Center Battle: Why Digital Realty Just Became The Top Pick
summary: Goldman Sachs analyst Michael Ng initiated coverage on several data center operators, highlighting Digital Realty Trust (DLR) as a Buy with a $188 price target. The company is positioned for significant revenue and profit growth due to AI infrastructure spending and cloud migration, with a large development pipeline. Equinix (EQIX) received a Neutral rating, while Iris Energy Limited (IREN), despite its "hyper growth" in AI cloud services, also received a Neutral rating from the analyst.

title: BMO Keeps Outperform on Amazon (AMZN), Sees AWS Growth Accelerating
summary: BMO Capital has raised its price target for Amazon (AMZN) to $304, maintaining an Outperform rating, following insights from former AWS employees suggesting accelerating cloud commitments and enterprise AI application scaling by 2027. Separately, Amazon is reportedly in discussions to invest approximately $10 billion in OpenAI, valuing the ChatGPT maker at over $500 billion, highlighting the surge in demand for computing power for advanced AI systems. Despite Amazon's potential, the article suggests other AI stocks may offer greater upside and less risk, especially those benefiting from Trump-era tariffs and onshoring trends.

title: Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE) Insider James Winston King Sells 1,860 Shares
summary: Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE) insider James Winston King sold 1,860 shares of the company's stock on December 18th for a total of $362,700. This sale reduces his holdings to 33,702 shares. The company recently reported strong Q3 earnings, beating revenue expectations, and analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with a $271.29 consensus target price.

title: Aris Mining Corp stock hits 52-week high at 15.95 USD
summary: Aris Mining Corp's stock has reached a new 52-week high of $15.95 USD, driven by exceptional performance including a 377.17% surge over the last year. Despite the rally, InvestingPro's analysis suggests the stock might still be slightly undervalued. The company's strong financial health, impressive revenue growth, and high investor confidence are key factors behind this significant growth, though a high P/E ratio and volatility are noted.

title: Is It Time to Sell Your Tech Stocks and Reinvest Elsewhere?
summary: Morningstar Wealth strategists are advising investors to trim their exposure to US tech and communication services stocks, especially those related to AI, due to elevated valuations. They suggest reinvesting in areas like small caps and emerging-market stocks, particularly in Latin America, which offer more attractive relative valuations and higher expected returns. This strategic shift is based on a decade-long outlook and aims to capitalize on undervalued sectors while reducing risk from potentially overvalued tech.

title: DTE Energy given greenlight to supply power for proposed data center in Saline Township
summary: The Michigan Public Service Commission has approved DTE Energy's contracts to supply power for a proposed data center in Saline Township, Michigan. The approval includes conditions making DTE responsible for development and operation costs and ensuring residents' service is prioritized in emergencies. While the decision aims to benefit Michigan by attracting new energy users, Attorney General Dana Nessel expressed disappointment, citing concerns about potential ratepayer harm and the lack of transparency regarding contract details.

title: Marvell Technology (MRVL) Stock News, Forecasts and Analyst Outlook — What Investors Are Watching on December 18, 2025
summary: Marvell Technology (MRVL) is experiencing a rebound due to cooling inflation and increased investor interest in AI infrastructure. The company's focus on AI data center demand, the Celestial AI acquisition for photonics technology, and addressing "lost sockets" rumors are key factors influencing its stock performance. Analysts have mixed views, but the consensus price target suggests notable upside, dependent on customer traction and successful execution of the Celestial roadmap.

title: Why TTM Technologies (TTMI) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Shares of TTM Technologies (NASDAQ:TTMI) surged 9% after analysts raised their price target on the stock due to strong demand for their advanced printed circuit boards (PCBs) from the artificial intelligence sector. This comes despite recent market volatility and a rotation out of AI-linked high-flyers, with the stock still trading below its 52-week high but showing significant year-to-date gains.

title: AlphaTON Capital Corp Announces Intention to Launch Decentralized AI-Native Biotech Platform Focused on Rare Cancers
summary: AlphaTON Capital Corp (NASDAQ: ATON) has announced its intention to launch a decentralized, AI-native biotech platform focusing on rare and immune-suppressed cancers, beginning with mesothelioma. This privacy-first platform will leverage Telegram distribution and Cocoon AI compute, aiming to accelerate therapeutic discovery and development by learning across institutions without centralizing sensitive patient data. The initiative will start by addressing mesothelioma with practical outputs like biomarker insights and trial design simulations, with plans to evolve into a continuous engine for new drug design.

title: Michigan regulators sign off on DTE agreement for massive data center
summary: Michigan's Public Service Commission has approved DTE Energy's plan to power a massive hyperscale data center in Saline Township, despite significant opposition. The agreement will supply 1.4 gigawatts of computing power for a project backed by Related Digital, Oracle, and OpenAI, which is part of OpenAI's "Stargate" initiative for AI development. Opponents, including environmental groups and the Attorney General's Office, raised concerns about the project's energy demands and potential impact on the electric grid and residential rates, while supporters highlight job creation and economic benefits.

title: MPSC approves DTE power contracts for proposed data center
summary: The Michigan Public Service Commission has unanimously approved two special power contracts requested by DTE Energy for a proposed data center near Saline, a subsidiary of Oracle Corporation involved in advancing AI. This decision was made on an "ex parte" basis, stirring debate due to concerns over energy consumption and transparency, despite conditions placing financial risks on DTE and receiving support from Governor Gretchen Whitmer. Attorney General Dana Nessel had called for a contested case, citing public demand for transparency regarding the project.

title: DTE Energy’s Saline data center contracts win quick state approval, despite uproar
summary: Michigan regulators have quickly approved DTE Energy's contracts for the $7 billion Oracle and OpenAI data center in Saline Township, despite significant opposition from residents and lawmakers. The Michigan Public Service Commission (MPSC) states that the decision ensures no costs will be passed on to other utility customers, but critics raised concerns about potential utility bill increases, energy reliability, and environmental impact. The approval comes amidst questions regarding Oracle's financial backing for the project.

title: Ex-Google CEO Eric Schmidt-backed firm teams up with Texas land baron for AI data center push
summary: Bolt Data & Energy, a data center startup co-founded by former Google CEO Eric Schmidt, has partnered with Texas Pacific Land Corporation to develop large-scale AI data centers in West Texas. Texas Pacific Land is investing $50 million, adding to Bolt Data's $150 million capital raise, leveraging the region's cheap power, vast land, and lighter regulatory hurdles. This collaboration aims to meet the escalating demand for energy-intensive AI computing infrastructure.

title: Constellation Energy Corporation (CEG): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Constellation Energy Corporation (CEG), highlighting its strategic advantages in nuclear power generation, concentrated asset base in tightening markets, and strong operational execution. The thesis emphasizes stable nuclear economics, merchant upside through various contracts, and robust policy support for free cash flow generation and growth. It also notes the company's stock appreciation since previous coverage and strong hedge fund interest.

title: Keefe, Bruyette & Woods Maintains Enact Holdings (ACT) Market Perform Recommendation
summary: Keefe, Bruyette & Woods has maintained a Market Perform recommendation for Enact Holdings (NASDAQ:ACT). The average one-year price target for ACT is $41.41/share, suggesting a 1.97% upside from its last closing price. Institutional ownership in the company shows a bullish outlook, with a put/call ratio of 0.09 and an increase in total shares owned by institutions.

title: The Next Big Theme: December 2025
summary: This article outlines key thematic trends in December 2025, focusing on significant developments in electrification, artificial intelligence, defense technology, AI semiconductors, HealthTech, and e-commerce. It highlights how these sectors are experiencing rapid growth and innovation, driven by new partnerships, technological advancements, and shifting consumer behavior. The report also includes financial data from Global X ETFs related to these themes.

title: Caterpillar (CAT) Stock on Dec. 18, 2025: CPI Surprise, Fresh Filings, Dividend Clarity, and 2026 Price Targets
summary: Caterpillar (CAT) stock gained traction on December 18, 2025, buoyed by a cooler-than-expected CPI report and a rebound after a prior day's selloff. The article details new ownership filings, including increased stakes by Czech National Bank and Legacy Private Trust Co., and a purchase by Rep. Gilbert Ray Cisneros, Jr. It also covers dividend stability, strategic analyses linking Caterpillar to AI infrastructure, and a range of analyst price targets for 2026, highlighting both bullish factors like backlog and AI demand, and bearish concerns around tariffs and valuation.

title: A Standout Year for the iShares MSCI World ETF
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) achieved a powerful performance in 2025 with a year-to-date return of approximately 20.5%, driven by strong technology holdings, a rally in developed equity markets, new US policy initiatives, and a softening US dollar. The fund's portfolio is heavily influenced by technology, with US equities dominating its geographic allocation, making it a "US-plus" strategy. Despite its higher expense ratio, URTH offers efficient global stock exposure specifically excluding emerging markets.

title: Microsoft, Netflix, Twilio And A Health Care Stock On CNBC's 'Final Trades'
summary: CNBC's "Halftime Report Final Trades" featured investment picks from various experts. Joseph M. Terranova named Twilio Inc., Rob Sechan chose AbbVie Inc., Jason Snipe liked Microsoft Corporation, and Stephen Weiss selected Netflix, Inc. The article also provides recent stock performances and upcoming financial result dates for Netflix.

title: Athira Pharma (ATHA) Stock Explodes 73% Higher on Breakthrough Cancer Drug Deal
summary: Athira Pharma's stock surged by 73% following its acquisition of global rights to lasofoxifene, a Phase 3 breast cancer drug, and securing $90 million in financing. This strategic move pivots the company into oncology, extending its cash runway into 2028 and funding the development of the new treatment targeting ESR1 mutations in metastatic breast cancer. The deal includes potential milestone payments and royalties to Sermonix Pharmaceuticals and Ligand Pharmaceuticals.

title: Microsoft (MSFT) Stock: Why This New Partnership Could Supercharge AI Revenue Growth
summary: Microsoft has entered a multi-year strategic partnership with Cognizant to develop and deliver AI-powered solutions across several key sectors, aiming to scale Copilot adoption in enterprises. This collaboration builds on Microsoft's strong AI revenue momentum, with Copilot contributing an estimated $10 billion annually and Azure cloud revenue climbing 40% in Q1 FY26. The partnership is expected to further enhance productivity and customer experience by embedding agentic AI capabilities into mission-critical workflows.

title: Cognizant partners with Microsoft to empower enterprises with AI
summary: Cognizant has announced a multi-year partnership with Microsoft to deliver AI-powered solutions to enterprises. This collaboration will focus on sectors such as financial services, healthcare and life sciences, retail, and manufacturing, integrating agentic AI and Copilot technologies.

title: Gartner: Palo Alto Networks Tops AI Security Front-Runners
summary: Gartner's latest analysis identifies key contenders in various AI segments, naming Palo Alto Networks as the leader in AI Security Platforms due to its comprehensive approach and dual innovation strategy. The report also highlights Microsoft's dominance in enterprise-wide AI, Google's leadership in Enterprise Agentic AI Platforms, and OpenAI's continued lead in Large Language Model providers. Gartner evaluates companies based on technical capabilities, customer success, business models, partnerships, and ecosystem strength.

title: Installed Building Products (IBP) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of Installed Building Products (IBP) jumped 3% after a favorable inflation report led to a broader market rally, offsetting a previous decline caused by disappointing results from peer Lennar (LEN). The rebound indicates the market considers the inflation news significant for the company, which has seen its stock rise 53.6% this year. The stock is currently trading close to its 52-week high established earlier in the year.

title: Should Invesco NASDAQ 100 ETF (QQQM) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The Invesco NASDAQ 100 ETF (QQQM), launched in 2020, is a passively managed fund designed for exposure to the Large Cap Growth segment of the US equity market, with over $68.87 billion in assets. It maintains a low expense ratio of 0.15% and has a significant allocation to the Information Technology sector, with top holdings including Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft. The QQQM has a Zacks ETF Rank of 1 (Strong Buy) and has shown strong performance, making it a compelling option for investors focusing on large-cap growth.

title: LiveOne renews audio ad partnership with DAX, expands to in-car audio
summary: LiveOne (NASDAQ:LVO) has renewed its exclusive audio advertising partnership with DAX, a digital advertising platform owned by Global, and expanded it to include in-car audio advertising opportunities in the United States. This strategic move aims to maximize advertising opportunities and follows a mixed fiscal Q2 2026 earnings report, where LiveOne posted a net loss of $5.7 million and missed revenue expectations. The company projects a 30% year-over-year increase in programmatic audio ad revenue for 2026.

title: IoT Technology Market Analysis 2025-2032: Revenues to Grow by $319 Billion | Features Profiles of Amazon, Microsoft, Cisco Systems, IBM, Alphabet, Intel, Huawei, Hewlett Packard, Siemens, SAP - ResearchAndMarkets.com
summary: The "IoT Technology Market - Global Forecast 2025-2032" report indicates significant growth, with the market projected to reach $797.98 billion by 2032 from $478.28 billion in 2025, demonstrating a CAGR of 7.58%. This expansion is driven by sustained enterprise commitment to connectivity and automation, transforming industrial, commercial, and consumer operations. The report details strategic coverage areas including components, end-user industries, connectivity types, and deployment models, while also profiling key companies like Amazon, Microsoft, and IBM.

title: BTIG Initiates ServiceNow (NOW) with Buy Rating on Expanding AI Platform
summary: BTIG initiated coverage of ServiceNow (NOW) with a Buy rating and a $1,000 price target, recognizing the significant advancements in its AI platform, Now Assist. The firm anticipates strong revenue and free cash flow growth, believing ServiceNow will continue to operate above the Rule of 50. Additionally, ServiceNow is reportedly in advanced talks to acquire cybersecurity startup Armis for approximately $7 billion, marking its largest potential acquisition to date.

title: Ascent Industries Launches New Buyback and Trading Plan
summary: Ascent Industries Co. (ACNT) has authorized a new stock repurchase program to buy back up to 2.0 million shares over two years, funded from working capital, superseding a prior program. The company also adopted a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan to facilitate repurchases, reflecting management's belief that the stock is undervalued. Analysts currently rate ACNT as a Hold with a $16.00 price target.

title: Osprey Private Wealth LLC Has $7.94 Million Stock Holdings in Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. $TMO
summary: Osprey Private Wealth LLC increased its stake in Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. to 16,360 shares, worth $7.94 million, making it their 13th largest holding. This comes as Thermo Fisher Scientific beat Q3 estimates, set FY2025 guidance, and authorized a $5.0 billion share repurchase program. Despite significant insider selling, institutional investors hold approximately 89% of the stock.

title: LUMN Surges 26% in the Past Year: Can It Sustain the Momentum in 2026?
summary: Lumen Technologies' shares have surged 25.9% in the past year, outperforming market averages, driven by its AI pivot, balance sheet repair, and improved operations. The company is strategically focusing on Private Connectivity Fabric and Network-as-a-Service solutions, securing major deals with tech giants for AI-fueled connectivity. While challenges remain from legacy business headwinds and competition, Lumen's cost-saving initiatives, significant debt reduction plans, and discounted valuation make it a compelling investment opportunity, earning it a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).

title: Defray Concentration Risk With This Equal-Weight ETF
summary: The article discusses how the ALPS Equal Sector Weight ETF (EQL) can help investors mitigate concentration risk, especially given the significant market share of the Magnificent Seven stocks. It highlights that EQL's sector-equal weighting approach has historically provided superior returns compared to stock-equal weighted ETFs. Both investors and advisors should consider EQL as a means to diversify portfolios and reduce vulnerability to market shifts driven by a few dominant stocks.

title: Bill Gates Could Have Been 'World's First Trillionaire' By Ignoring Buffett's Advice — Instead, He Lost $10 Billion Shorting Tesla, Says Elon Musk
summary: Elon Musk claims Bill Gates lost $10 billion by shorting Tesla, reigniting a debate about Gates's wealth potential had he not followed Warren Buffett's diversification advice. According to an investor, if Gates had retained his Microsoft shares instead of diversifying, he could have been the world's first trillionaire with a net worth of $1.5 trillion. This comes as Microsoft's market capitalization reached $3.6 trillion.

title: Does Caterpillar (CAT) Closing ESOP Shelves Hint at a Deeper Shift in Its AI Strategy?
summary: Caterpillar Inc. recently closed shelf registrations for its employee stock ownership plan and affirmed a quarterly dividend of US$1.51 per share, payable in February 2026. This comes as the company leverages a record US$39.8 billion backlog and expands into automation and AI-enabled services, reinforcing its role in both traditional and AI-driven infrastructure. The article explores how this focus on AI technologies and continued dividend affirmation affects Caterpillar's investment narrative, juxtaposing shareholder returns with long-term growth investments.

title: United Rentals expande ferramenta de IA para agilizar reparos de equipamentos
summary: United Rentals (NYSE:URI) has fully implemented its "Manual Assist AI" tool across the company to streamline equipment repairs. This AI-powered application, developed with Amazon Web Services, helps service teams diagnose issues and access manufacturer manuals efficiently, improving fleet utilization. With a market cap of $50.43 billion and a consensus "Buy" rating, United Rentals continues to leverage technology to enhance operational efficiency.
source: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos

title: Thrive Wealth Management LLC Lowers Stock Position in Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: Thrive Wealth Management LLC significantly reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG) by 19.4% in the third quarter of 2025, selling 6,634 shares and now holding 27,527 shares valued at $6.704 million. Despite this reduction, Alphabet remains a strong performer, posting robust earnings of $2.87 EPS and $102.35 billion in revenue, surpassing analyst expectations, and it continues to hold a consensus "Buy" rating with a target price of $313.04 among analysts. The company also declared a quarterly dividend of $0.21 per share, reflecting a 0.3% yield and an 8.28% payout ratio.

title: Oak Thistle LLC Invests $1.28 Million in Sonoco Products Company $SON
summary: Oak Thistle LLC recently acquired a new position in Sonoco Products Company (NYSE:SON), purchasing 29,669 shares valued at approximately $1.28 million in the 3rd quarter. This investment highlights strong institutional interest in Sonoco, which boasts an attractive valuation, a 4.9% dividend yield, and recent insider purchases. The company's stock currently has an average rating of "Hold" among analysts, with a consensus target price of $54.43.

title: Why Oracle keeps sparking AI-bubble fears
summary: Oracle's stock tumble and concerns over a planned data center investment have intensified fears regarding the AI boom. Investors are becoming wary of potential delays in AI profits, especially for companies heavily investing in infrastructure without immediate application-based returns. This recalibration of risk, particularly affecting companies like Oracle and CoreWeave, suggests the market is becoming more rational about the sustainability of the AI bubble.

title: IAC (IAC): Buy, Sell, or Hold Post Q3 Earnings?
summary: This report analyzes IAC (IAC) following its Q3 earnings, suggesting caution due to flat long-term revenue growth, declining EPS, and negative returns on invested capital. The company faces risks such as TSMC dependence and NVIDIA's software moat but is poised for continued growth through AI PC refreshes and MI350 adoption.

Their leadership in areas like enterprise agentic AI platforms and large language models drives the need for sophisticated data center designs and operations.

title: The Architect of the Intelligence Age: A Deep-Dive into Microsoft (MSFT) in 2025
summary: As of December 18, 2025, Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) has established itself as the primary architect of the "Intelligence Age," transitioning from generative AI experimentation to industrial-scale implementation. The company's strategic pivot under Satya Nadella towards an AI-native entity, integrating "Copilot" across its tech stack, has solidified its position at the apex of global equity markets, with its market capitalization fluctuating around $3.8 trillion. This deep dive examines Microsoft's business model, stock performance, financial health, leadership, products, competitive landscape, risks, opportunities, and regulatory considerations as it navigates the future of AI.

title: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) 2025 Deep Dive: AI Rebirth and the Antitrust Frontier

(GOOGL) is at a pivotal moment in its 27-year history, having undergone an "AI-first" pivot that has propelled its revenue past the $100 billion threshold for the first time, driven by innovations like the Gemini 3 model. Despite this financial success, the company faces significant regulatory pressure following a landmark antitrust ruling that alters its business relationships. GOOGL presents a complex investment opportunity, balancing its position as a high-growth AI powerhouse with scrutiny from global antitrust regulators.

It emphasizes the need for law enforcement to adapt investigations, prevention strategies, and digital preparedness to address these evolving threats.

title: Google Cloud Named AI Infrastructure Leader in Forrester Q4 2025 Report

The report emphasizes Google Cloud's comprehensive approach, including multi-cloud compatibility and strong security, as key differentiators.

ServiceNow emphasizes its architectural discipline in integrating acquired technologies, avoiding the pitfalls of disparate product portfolios.

This initiative is designed to fuel the Fourth Industrial Revolution and strengthen American leadership in artificial intelligence.

title: Arista Networks Stock (ANET) News Today: Fortinet AI Data Center Partnership, Morgan Stanley Target Cut, and Wall Street’s 2026 Forecasts
summary: Arista Networks (ANET) is experiencing a dynamic trading day driven by a new "secure AI data center" partnership with Fortinet, a Morgan Stanley price target reduction despite an Overweight rating, and positive forecasts from Zacks regarding its AI prospects into 2026. Arista’s strong Q3 2025 performance and ambitious AI-center growth targets for 2026 underpin investor debate, balancing its strategic positioning in AI infrastructure against valuation concerns and competitive pressures.

title: Microsoft Azure AI margins are positive, revenue likely to top estimates: MS (MSFT:NASDAQ)

This positive outlook suggests Microsoft's revenue may exceed current estimates.

title: It’s time to re-evaluate remote work security

Many companies demonstrate false confidence in their online attack protection while employees' expanded ability to work from home, increased data collection, and faster digital transformation have introduced new vulnerabilities. Organizations must validate their remote work security programs and adopt a data-centric approach, utilizing models like Zero Trust to balance security and user productivity.

title: The Unassailable Fortress: Why TSMC Dominates the Semiconductor Landscape and What It Means for Investors
