The fund tracks the S&P Global 1200 Shariah Information Technology Capped Index, screening companies based on Islamic finance principles for business activities and financial metrics. The ETF provides exposure to growth within disruptive innovation themes while mitigating leverage risks.

title: David Tepper Bets 30 % of His Fund on a Single ‘Fossil‑Free’ S&P Put—A $2.5 B Hedge You Can’t Ignore
summary: David Tepper's Appaloosa Management has made a significant hedge by investing 30% of its fund, approximately $2.5 billion, in put options on the SPDR S&P 500 Fossil Fuel Reserves Free ETF (SPYX). This move signals caution regarding the broader market, especially the S&P 500, given potential overvaluation and ongoing economic uncertainties like tariffs. The put position acts as a hedge against Appaloosa's substantial holdings in large-cap tech stocks, preparing the fund for potential market volatility.

title: PLDT Inc. Announces Board Changes with New Director Appointment
summary: PLDT Inc. announced changes to its Board of Directors, including the resignation of Mr. Kazuyuki Kozu and the appointment of Mr. Hidetada Hayashi as a new director, both effective September 16, 2025. The company stated that Mr. Kozu's departure would not significantly impact operations, and the new appointment followed a thorough screening process. title: How F5 And SonicWall Revealed The Fragility Of The Software Supply Chain - Forrester

The article concludes with recommendations for security leaders to audit deployments, decentralize critical assets, enhance third-party risk management to include product-level assessments, make SBOMs mandatory, encrypt backups with customer-controlled keys, enable operational resilience, and conduct thorough detection and threat hunting for anomalous activities.
authors: Carlos Rivera, Alla Valente, Allie Mellen, Andre Kindness, Erik Nost, Heidi Shey, James Plouffe, Janet Worthington, Sandy Carielli, Tope Olufon, Joseph Blankenship

title: BlackRock and Nvidia Lead $40 Billion AI Data Center Mega Deal
summary: BlackRock, Nvidia, and a consortium of partners are acquiring Aligned Data Centers for $40 billion to significantly expand AI infrastructure capacity. This deal, led by the newly formed Artificial Intelligence Infrastructure Partnership (AIP), aims to meet the escalating demand for computing power required by AI development. Aligned Data Centers operates 50 campuses across the U.S. and Latin America with over 5 gigawatts of operational and planned capacity, making it a critical asset for the future of AI.

title: U.S. Enterprises Redefine Workplace Services with GenAI - FinancialContent
summary: U.S. enterprises are integrating generative AI (GenAI), hybrid work models, and experience frameworks into workplace services to drive transformation, according to a new ISG report. AI is now a foundational component, with over 75% of large enterprises using GenAI, shifting from cost savings to intelligent augmentation. The focus on experience management and AI-enabled workplace design is improving retention, productivity, and inclusivity across distributed workforces.
authors: Information Services Group, Inc. via Business Wire

title: Nvidia, BlackRock-backed group to buy Aligned Data Centers in $40B AI infrastructure deal - Proactive Investors
summary: A consortium including BlackRock and Nvidia Corp will acquire Aligned Data Centers from Macquarie Asset Management in a $40 billion deal. This investment group, the Artificial Intelligence Infrastructure Partnership (AIP), plans to initially deploy $30 billion in equity, with potential to reach $100 billion including debt, highlighting a significant increase in AI-related infrastructure investments. The transaction is expected to close in the first half of 2026.

title: Group including Nvidia, BlackRock buying Aligned Data Centers in deal worth about $40 billion - Mother Lode's News - myMotherLode.com
summary: A consortium including BlackRock, Nvidia, and Microsoft is acquiring Aligned Data Centers in a deal valued at approximately $40 billion to bolster next-generation cloud and AI infrastructure. This acquisition is part of a larger trend of significant investments in the booming AI sector, aiming to address the substantial resource demands of artificial intelligence development. The consortium, named the Artificial Intelligence Infrastructure Partnership, plans to mobilize $30 billion in equity capital, potentially reaching $100 billion with debt.

title: Oracle Collaborates with Microsoft to Enhance Supply Chain Efficiency - MarketScreener
summary: Oracle has partnered with Microsoft to develop an integration blueprint aimed at improving supply chain efficiency and responsiveness for manufacturers. This collaboration will enable organizations using Oracle Fusion Cloud Supply Chain & Manufacturing (SCM) to leverage real-time data from factory equipment via Azure IoT Operations and Microsoft Fabric, thereby enhancing decision-making and automating key supply chain processes. The new capabilities include real-time intelligence, secure data flows, automated business events, and standardized best practices for seamless connectivity and deployment.

title: Jamie Dimon says AI isn't a bubble — but some projects may not work out - Business Insider
summary: Jamie Dimon, CEO of JPMorgan Chase, believes that while the AI industry as a whole is not a bubble and will likely "pay off," individual AI projects may not always succeed as planned. He emphasized the need to evaluate each project individually to determine its real productive capability and return on investment, rather than viewing the entire sector as a speculative bubble. Dimon pointed out that vast capital expenditures in AI involve diverse elements beyond just technology, including infrastructure and real estate, and predicted some projects would face challenges.

title: BlackRock & Nvidia’s $40 Billion AI Data Center Deal – Inside the Mega-Bet Powering the AI Boom
summary: BlackRock and Nvidia are leading an investor consortium, including Microsoft and xAI, to acquire Aligned Data Centers for approximately $40 billion. This mega-deal highlights an "AI arms race" to build the necessary infrastructure for advanced AI models, with an estimated $400 billion to be spent on AI data centers in 2025 alone. The acquisition is BlackRock's first major investment through its Artificial Intelligence Infrastructure Partnership (AIP) and aims to secure the computing capacity needed to power the future of AI.

title: Lumen Technologies (NYSE: LUMN) Stock Price Prediction and Forecast 2025-2030 (Oct 2025) - 24/7 Wall St.
summary: This article provides a stock price prediction and forecast for Lumen Technologies (NYSE: LUMN) from 2025 to 2030, highlighting a potential turnaround from past struggles due to strategic partnerships with tech giants like Microsoft and Google Cloud, debt restructuring, and significant insider buying. While near-term analyst ratings show no upside, 24/7 Wall St. projects positive EPS growth and a significant stock price increase by 2030, driven by increased demand for high-speed fiber-network solutions for AI.

title: Oracle Collaborates with Microsoft to Enhance Supply Chain Efficiency - Oracle
summary: Oracle announced a collaboration with Microsoft to integrate Oracle Fusion Cloud SCM with Azure IoT Operations and Microsoft Fabric. This partnership aims to help manufacturers improve supply chain efficiency and responsiveness by enabling data-driven decision-making, automating processes, and providing real-time insights from factory equipment. The integration blueprint will facilitate faster response times, greater visibility into supply chain operations, and standardized best practices.

title: Nvidia, Microsoft, xAI and BlackRock part of $40 billion deal for Aligned Data Centers - CNBC
summary: A consortium including Nvidia, Microsoft, xAI, and BlackRock has agreed to acquire Aligned Data Centers for $40 billion. This deal, the largest global data center transaction to date, is the first investment by the Artificial Intelligence Infrastructure Partnership (AIP), which aims to deploy $30 billion in equity capital to support AI infrastructure. The acquisition highlights the intense demand to build out the necessary infrastructure for growing AI technology.

title: Here’s Why Macquarie Large Cap Growth Fund Sold Equinix (EQIX) in Q3
summary: Macquarie Large Cap Growth Fund divested its holdings in Equinix, Inc. (EQIX) during the third quarter of 2025, citing unmet expectations for monetization of its assets in second- and third-tier cities despite its unique position in urban areas. The fund believes there will be a better opportunity to own the stock in the future and favors other AI stocks with higher return potential and shorter timeframes. Equinix's stock closed at $817.42 per share on October 14, 2025, with a market capitalization of $79.996 billion, and its shares have lost 7.13% of their value over the last 52 weeks.

title: Oracle AI Agents Help Supply Chain Leaders Boost Operational Efficiency - MarketScreener
summary: Oracle Corporation has introduced new AI agents within Oracle Fusion Cloud Applications to enhance supply chain performance. These AI agents, built with Oracle AI Agent Studio for Fusion Applications and running on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, aim to automate processes, optimize planning and fulfillment, and enable faster, data-driven decisions for supply chain leaders. The new agents cover various functions including planning, product lifecycle management, procurement, maintenance, manufacturing, inventory management, logistics, and order management.

title: Morgan Stanley says the colossal AI spending spree could pay for itself by 2028 - AOL.com
summary: Morgan Stanley suggests that the immense investments in AI infrastructure by companies are not a speculative bubble and could yield substantial returns. The bank's analysts forecast that AI spending will start paying for itself by 2028, generating an estimated $1.1 trillion in AI software revenue. This outlook provides a reassuring perspective for investors concerned about the significant capital being committed to AI.

title: CoreWeave Announces Partnership with Foundation Model Company Poolside to Deliver AI Cloud Services - MarketScreener
summary: CoreWeave has partnered with Poolside, an AI foundation model company, to provide advanced AI cloud services. This collaboration includes CoreWeave supplying a cluster of NVIDIA GB300 NVL72 systems with over 40,000 GPUs and acting as the anchor tenant for Poolside's Project Horizon AI campus in West Texas, which includes 250MW of gross power and an option for an additional 500MW. This partnership aims to accelerate AI research and development by providing essential infrastructure for building and scaling AI models.

title: OpenAI partners with Walmart to let users buy products in ChatGPT
summary: OpenAI has partnered with Walmart to enable users to make purchases directly within ChatGPT using "Instant Checkout." This collaboration aims to transform e-commerce by allowing customers to buy various products, from groceries to household goods, through conversational AI. The partnership signifies OpenAI's broader strategy to expand into online commerce and generate revenue, following similar integrations with Shopify and Etsy.

title: Nova Minerals (NVA) Stock Explodes After U.S. Government Meeting Request
summary: Nova Minerals (NVA) stock surged 110% after the U.S. Ambassador to Australia requested a briefing on its Alaska mining project. This briefing is scheduled prior to an upcoming meeting between President Trump and Australian PM Anthony Albanese to discuss critical mineral supply chain security. The Estelle Project, valued at $41 billion in gold and containing antimony, is a key focus of this U.S.-Australia cooperation.

title: Webus International Limited Launches AI-Powered Points Optimization Platform Leveraging OpenAI’s AgentKit Framework - The Manila Times

This new platform is designed to provide businesses with advanced tools to analyze customer behavior, optimize loyalty programs, and enhance personalized engagements. It aims to revolutionize how companies manage their loyalty initiatives by leveraging cutting-edge AI.

title: Oracle Launches Fusion Applications AI Agent Marketplace to Accelerate Enterprise AI Adoption - GuruFocus
summary: Oracle has launched its Fusion Applications AI Agent Marketplace, designed to accelerate enterprise AI adoption by allowing customers to seamlessly deploy partner-built AI agents within Oracle Fusion Cloud Applications. The marketplace features agents from various system integrators and independent software vendors, transforming processes across finance, HR, supply chain, and customer experience. It offers built-in domain expertise, no-code deployment, customizable templates, and validated security, all supported by Oracle.

title: TEN Holdings and V-Cube Partner to Deliver Advanced Enterprise Communication Technology to the North American Market
summary: TEN Holdings and V-Cube are partnering to deliver advanced enterprise communication and event technology to the North American market, projected to be valued at $34.39 billion in 2024. This strategic collaboration combines V-Cube's virtual event technologies with TEN Holdings' market presence to offer scalable, secure, and customizable communication tools for businesses. The partnership aims to position TEN Holdings as a leader in digital transformation, driving new revenue streams through engagement-driven event solutions.

title: Jensen Huang's Personal Account of 'NVIDIA's Founding History': Insights from 1993, Breakthrough in 2012, and the Future of AI - 富途牛牛
summary: Jensen Huang, NVIDIA's CEO, details the company's journey from its 1993 founding based on "accelerated computing" to its pivotal role in the AI revolution. He highlights the 2012 deep learning breakthrough with CUDA and cuDNN, leading to the development of AI factories like the DGX-1. Huang predicts AI will create trillion-dollar markets in digital labor and physical AI, emphasizing that future computing will be 100% generative.

title: BlackRock, Nvidia, Microsoft and xAI to acquire Aligned Data Centers in $40B deal - Türkiye Today
summary: BlackRock, Nvidia, Microsoft, and xAI are set to acquire Aligned Data Centers from Macquarie Asset Management for approximately $40 billion. This acquisition, led by the Asset and Infrastructure Partners (AIP) consortium, aims to significantly expand Aligned Data Centers' operations across the United States and Latin America to meet the growing demand for AI and cloud computing infrastructure. The consortium plans to commit $30 billion in equity and raise an additional $70 billion to fund this expansion, addressing long-term challenges in energy and water management for large-scale data facilities.

title: Microsoft And Nvidia-Backed Nscale Announce Large-Scale AI Project In US And Europe - Benzinga
summary: Nscale has announced an expanded partnership with Microsoft and NVIDIA to deploy approximately 200,000 NVIDIA GB300 GPUs across Europe and the United States. This multi-country effort, which also involves Dell Technologies, will establish hyperscale NVIDIA AI capacity for Microsoft's customers, with initial phases starting in 2026. The project highlights the increasing demand for high-performance computing to support AI model training and deployment on a global scale.

title: Nscale Signs Landmark Deal with Microsoft for 200,000 NVIDIA GPUs - TradingView
summary: Nscale has secured one of the largest AI infrastructure deals to date with Microsoft, agreeing to supply approximately 200,000 NVIDIA GB300 GPUs across facilities in the United States and Europe. This partnership highlights Microsoft's strategic efforts to expand its AI capabilities globally and NVIDIA's dominant position in high-performance computing. Deliveries are planned across multiple locations, including Texas, Portugal, Norway, and the UK, commencing from early 2026.

title: Microsoft’s $58MM Infrastructure Play Powers Redmond’s Real Estate Boom
summary: Microsoft's $58 million investment in infrastructure is significantly boosting Redmond's real estate market. This financial play, coupled with campus refreshes and development district funding, is driving a surge in city revenue.

title: Vivian Health Launches AI Assistant for Recruiters to Transform Healthcare Hiring - Yahoo Finance
summary: Vivian Health has launched an AI Assistant for healthcare recruiters, aiming to transform the healthcare hiring process by streamlining job searches and improving candidate engagement. Built on extensive proprietary marketplace data, the AI Assistant enhances efficiency for both recruiters and healthcare professionals, leading to faster placements and increased responsiveness. This innovation addresses labor shortages and the demand for flexible roles, offering smarter and more transparent hiring.

This partnership aims to combine Walmart's product selection and delivery network with OpenAI's technology to simplify online shopping. Walmart also utilizes AI internally to enhance various operations and is expanding its use of AI tools for employees and supply chain management.

title: Nvidia (NVDA) Stock: Oracle-AMD Partnership Sends Shares Tumbling
summary: Nvidia (NVDA) shares dropped 4.4% as Oracle announced a partnership with AMD for AI chips, despite several positive developments for Nvidia, including a $2 billion investment in Elon Musk's xAI and U.S. approval to export advanced AI chips to the UAE. The company also launched its DGX Spark supercomputer and reported strong trailing revenues and profit margins. Analysts project continued growth for Nvidia, but competition and trade tensions remain factors.

title: BlackRock, Nvidia Group to Buy Aligned Data for $40B - Newsmax
summary: An investment consortium comprising BlackRock, Nvidia, xAI, and Microsoft will acquire Aligned Data Centers for $40 billion. This deal marks the first investment for the Artificial Intelligence Infrastructure Partnership (AIP), which aims to deploy up to $100 billion including debt. Aligned Data Centers, which designs and operates data centers, will maintain its headquarters in Dallas, Texas.

title: Nasdaq 100 Futures Surge 1% as US–China Trade Fears Ease; BTC, ETH Correlation Watch for Risk-On Follow-Through - Blockchain News

title: BlackRock, Nvidia-backed group including Temasek strikes US$40 billion data centre deal to fuel AI boom - The Business Times

The Artificial Intelligence Infrastructure Partnership (AIP) aims to deploy an initial US$30 billion of equity capital, potentially reaching US$100 billion including debt, to build the necessary infrastructure for the future of AI.

title: BlackRock, Nvidia-backed group strikes US$40 billion data centre deal to fuel AI boom - The Business Times
summary: An investor group backed by BlackRock and Nvidia will acquire Aligned Data Centers from Macquarie Asset Management for US$40 billion. The Artificial Intelligence Infrastructure Partnership (AIP), which includes anchor investors like xAI, Microsoft, Kuwait Investment Authority, and Temasek Holdings, aims to deploy substantial capital to power AI development.

title: Nscale Wins $14B Microsoft AI Deal, Secures Texas Site via Lease with Ionic Digital - TheMinerMag
summary: Nscale, a U.K.-based spinoff from Arkon Energy, has secured a computing deal with Microsoft worth up to $14 billion, involving the deployment of 104,000 Nvidia GB300 chips at a Texas data center leased from Ionic Digital. This agreement, spanning 10 years and utilizing Ionic Digital's 234-megawatt Cedarvale facility, represents a significant pivot for Ionic Digital into AI infrastructure hosting and bolsters Nscale's plans for an initial public offering following recent successful funding rounds. The deal highlights a growing trend of monetizing energy and infrastructure assets for AI workloads.

title: Intel signals return to AI race with new chip to launch next year - The Edge Malaysia
summary: Intel announced its new AI chip, "Crescent Island," to be launched next year, marking a renewed push to re-enter the competitive AI chip market dominated by AMD and Nvidia. The chip will be optimized for energy efficiency and AI inference, with Intel committing to annual data center AI chip releases to capture a meaningful market share. This move aims to leverage the booming demand for GPUs in AI workloads and involves a partnership with Nvidia.

title: Nscale eyes IPO amid fresh $14 billion deal with Microsoft - CNBC
summary: AI cloud company Nscale is considering an IPO by late 2026, coinciding with a newly expanded $14 billion deal with Microsoft. This deal involves Microsoft purchasing approximately 200,000 NVIDIA GB300 GPUs from Nscale, contributing to a total deal value of around $23 billion when previous announcements are included. The announcement follows significant recent funding rounds for Nscale, highlighting the rapid growth in the AI infrastructure sector.

title: Oracle Launches Fusion Applications AI Agent Marketplace to Accelerate Enterprise AI Adoption - StreetInsider
summary: Oracle has launched the Fusion Applications AI Agent Marketplace to accelerate enterprise AI adoption, offering partner-built AI agent templates to streamline finance, HR, supply chain, and customer experience processes. This marketplace enables customers to deploy AI agents directly within Oracle Fusion Applications, promoting efficiency and productivity without complex technical implementations. The initiative includes contributions from major system integrators and independent software vendors, ensuring validated trust and security with Oracle's enterprise-grade support.

title: Oracle Launches Fusion Applications AI Agent Marketplace to Accelerate Enterprise AI Adoption - PR Newswire
summary: Oracle has launched the Fusion Applications AI Agent Marketplace to enable customers to easily find and deploy validated, partner-built AI agents within their enterprise environment. This marketplace, part of Oracle AI Agent Studio, aims to accelerate AI adoption at scale by providing secure, pre-built AI agents to enhance productivity and address complex business challenges across various functions like finance, HR, and supply chain. The solution allows customers to seamlessly integrate partner expertise directly into their Oracle Fusion Cloud Applications.

title: Oracle AI Agents Help Finance Leaders Accelerate Business Insights and Boost Efficiency - PR Newswire
summary: Oracle has announced new AI agents embedded within Oracle Fusion Cloud Applications to help finance leaders enhance productivity, reduce costs, and improve controls. These agents, built using Oracle AI Agent Studio, are designed to automate workflows and deliver predictive insights across core finance functions like payables, ledger, planning, and payments. The initiative aims to usher in an era of "agent-driven finance" to provide real-time business insights and improve operational efficiency.

Aligned Data Centers will continue to operate under its current leadership and headquarters, expanding its portfolio of data centers across the U.S. and Latin America.

title: VTI ETF Daily Brief: What Investors Need to Know – 10/15/2025
summary: This article provides a daily brief on the Vanguard Total Stock Market ETF (VTI), detailing its recent performance, key holdings, and price forecasts. The ETF has a "Moderate Buy" consensus with a 14% implied upside based on analyst ratings of its constituents.

title: Kong Konnect Service Catalog Now Supports AWS Auto Discovery - Morningstar
summary: Kong Inc. announced that its Konnect Service Catalog now supports AWS Auto Discovery, allowing for unified API discovery across AWS and other gateways. This integration aims to solve API sprawl and enhance governance through scorecards, providing a single source of truth for human and AI consumers of APIs. The update enables platform teams to manage API sprawl confidently and extends scorecards to AWS-discovered APIs for consistent compliance.

title: Oracle’s AI Agent Studio gets enterprise controls, LLM flexibility and deterministic workflows - SiliconANGLE
summary: Oracle Corp. is enhancing its AI Agent Studio for Fusion Applications with new enterprise controls, LLM flexibility, and deterministic workflows. These updates aim to operationalize AI for businesses by improving governance, security, and management visibility for AI agents. The studio now supports various LLMs, offers cost monitoring, and includes a marketplace for prebuilt agents, making AI adoption easier and more controlled for enterprises.

title: A guide to the $1 trillion-worth of AI deals between OpenAI, Nvidia and others
summary: The AI boom has led to extensive deal-making, with OpenAI alone involved in approximately $1 trillion worth of deals this year to finance and build AI infrastructure. Nvidia is also central to this network, investing in companies like CoreWeave and partnering on large-scale projects like the 'Stargate Project' with Oracle and SoftBank. Despite concerns of a potential "AI bubble" due to inflated valuations and funding shortfalls, industry leaders argue these partnerships are necessary for foundational infrastructure development.

title: IBM to Acquire Cognitus to Accelerate SAP Transformations Globally - Yahoo
summary: IBM (NYSE: IBM) is set to acquire Cognitus, an SAP Gold & Co-innovation partner, to enhance its SAP capabilities, particularly in regulated industries like Aerospace and Defense, Energy and Utilities, and Manufacturing. Cognitus brings over 20 years of expertise in SAP S/4HANA implementations and proprietary AI-enabled software assets. This acquisition aims to accelerate SAP transformations globally by integrating Cognitus' deep industry knowledge and AI solutions with IBM's extensive SAP technology and AI-led delivery platform.

title: Salesforce, ServiceNow Heading For Agentic AI Enterprise Software Battle - inkl
summary: Salesforce and ServiceNow are set for intensified competition in the enterprise software market, particularly in agentic AI. Salesforce's new Agentforce 360 platform and expanded partnership with OpenAI are positioning it as an AI orchestration layer, directly overlapping with ServiceNow's workflow automation territory. Analysts highlight this competitive overlap as both companies seek to re-accelerate revenue growth through AI agent deployment and data context.

title: Oracle : Collaborates with Microsoft to Enhance Supply Chain Efficiency - MarketScreener
summary: Oracle Corporation announced a collaboration with Microsoft to develop an integration blueprint aimed at improving supply chain efficiency and responsiveness for manufacturers. This initiative will enable data-driven decision-making and automate supply chain processes by integrating real-time insights from factory equipment via Azure IoT Operations and Microsoft Fabric into Oracle Fusion Cloud Supply Chain & Manufacturing (SCM). The partnership seeks to accelerate response times, enhance visibility, and reduce downtime through automated business events and standardized practices.

title: Canaccord Genuity Downgrades CyberArk Software to Hold From Buy, Adjusts Price Target to $502 From $440 - MarketScreener
summary: Canaccord Genuity has downgraded CyberArk Software to Hold from Buy and adjusted its price target to $502 from $440. This report appears alongside recent news of another downgrade by Barclays and other analyst recommendations concerning CyberArk's performance and market position.

title: Intel's Crucial Panther Lake Chips Start Production - Yahoo Finance
summary: Intel's upcoming Panther Lake laptop CPUs have begun production using the Intel 18A process, marking a significant step for the company's manufacturing and competitive efforts. These chips aim to deliver both high performance and efficiency, serving as a crucial showcase for Intel's 18A foundry business to attract third-party customers and regain market share. A successful launch is vital for Intel to capitalize on recent investment deals and maintain its stock gains.

title: Walmart and OpenAI Team Up for Revolutionary ChatGPT Shopping Experience! - OpenTools
summary: Walmart and OpenAI are partnering to integrate ChatGPT into Walmart's online shopping platform, launching in Fall 2025. This initiative signifies Walmart's strategic shift towards agentic commerce and AI-enhanced retail.

summary: Walmart and OpenAI are partnering to introduce AI-powered shopping through ChatGPT with Instant Checkout, aiming to revolutionize retail by enabling customers to chat, plan, and purchase items seamlessly. Walmart is also investing in AI literacy and tools for its employees, signaling a shift towards a more tech-driven retail future.

title: BMO Capital Reiterates Its “Outperform” Rating on Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) with $650 PT - Insider Monkey
summary: BMO Capital has reiterated its "Outperform" rating for Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) and set a $650 price target, citing strong growth in Azure amid increasing enterprise cloud migrations. Additionally, Microsoft is reportedly planning to launch an ad-supported version of Xbox Cloud Gaming to expand its audience.

title: Industrial-scale AI factory movement descends on SA
summary: South African technology group Altron has announced the deployment of an AI factory, powered by Nvidia infrastructure, making it one of several companies establishing industrial-scale AI operations in the region. This move signifies a broader shift from AI experimentation to industrialized deployment, with experts anticipating more companies in data services, telecommunications, and infrastructure to follow suit. While establishing AI factories is a capital-intensive endeavor requiring significant investment in infrastructure, software, and specialized hardware, the consensus is that more companies will pursue these ambitions as AI becomes foundational to business operations.

title: BMO Capital Reiterates Its “Outperform” Rating on Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) with $650 PT - Yahoo
summary: This article states that BMO Capital has reiterated its "Outperform" rating on Microsoft Corporation (MSFT). The firm has also maintained a price target of $650 for Microsoft. The content is a cookie consent page from Yahoo, not the actual article detailing BMO Capital's analysis.

title: Nscale Signs $14 Billion Microsoft Deal for 200,000 Nvidia AI Chips - Blockonomi
summary: British AI infrastructure company Nscale signed a substantial $14 billion deal with Microsoft to deploy 200,000 Nvidia AI chips across data centers in the US and Europe. This agreement enhances previous collaborations and involves Dell Technologies as a partner for deployment. Nscale, valued at approximately $3 billion after a recent $1.1 billion funding round, plans to go public by late 2026 and is investing significantly in UK data center development, facing challenges such as regulatory approvals, power supply, and supply chain logistics.

title: Salesforce says AI is helping save $100M every year - NewsBytes
summary: Salesforce announced it is saving $100 million annually by using AI in its customer service operations, automating tasks and reducing human agent needs. The company's AI platform has been adopted by over 12,000 businesses, demonstrating the efficiency and cost-saving potential of AI, though it has also led to job cuts. Despite these savings and new business opportunities, Salesforce's stock has seen a decline, indicating investor caution.

title: HSBC Upgrades Nvidia to Buy From Hold, Adjusts Price Target to $320 From $200 - MarketScreener
summary: HSBC has upgraded its rating for Nvidia from 'Hold' to 'Buy' and significantly increased its price target from $200 to $320. This positive revision reflects a strong vote of confidence from the financial firm in Nvidia's future performance. The article also provides detailed company information, including its sales breakdown by product and geography, along with analyst consensus and ratings.

title: Microsoft (MSFT) Unveils MAI-Image-1, Its First In-House AI Model for Image - TipRanks
summary: Microsoft (MSFT) has launched MAI-Image-1, its first in-house text-to-image AI model, which quickly ranked among the top image models on LMArena. This move signifies Microsoft's expanded AI strategy beyond its OpenAI partnership, focusing on developing its own AI technology for consumer platforms. Despite this, MSFT shares remained stable, and analysts maintain a Strong Buy consensus for the stock.

title: OpenAI Commissions Broadcom for AI Chip Manufacturing - All-About-Industries
summary: OpenAI has commissioned Broadcom to manufacture its own custom AI chips, a move aimed at reducing costs, avoiding supply bottlenecks, and strengthening control over its infrastructure. The chips are expected to be operational from the second half of 2026, delivering up to ten gigawatts of computing power and utilizing Broadcom's extensive peripheral portfolio for scalable and energy-efficient systems. This partnership highlights OpenAI's strategy to meet growing computing power demands and join other tech giants in developing proprietary AI hardware, though it's not seen as a direct threat to Nvidia's market position due to the complexity involved.

title: UK’s Nscale to supply Microsoft with 200,000 Nvidia AI chips - 104.1 WIKY
summary: British artificial intelligence company Nscale has secured an expanded agreement with Microsoft to deploy approximately 200,000 Nvidia AI chips across its European and U.S. data centers, a deal potentially worth up to $14 billion. This builds on a previous agreement to supply 52,000 Nvidia GPUs from its Norweigian hyperscale AI campus and follows Nscale's recent $1.1 billion fundraising. The chips will be supplied in collaboration with Dell Technologies, starting next year from Texas and Portugal.

title: Fossil India is said to weigh IPO that could raise $400 million - ET Retail
summary: Fossil Group is reportedly considering an Initial Public Offering (IPO) for its Indian subsidiary, Fossil India Pvt., aiming to raise between $300 million and $400 million by selling up to a 25% stake. This move aligns with a trend of multinational firms listing their Indian operations due to strong investor demand. Fossil India manages brands like Fossil and Skagen, along with licensed names such as Armani Exchange and Michael Kors, and reported revenue of 8.68 billion rupees and a net income of 704 million rupees for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2024.

title: Reasons Behind Microsoft's Recent 40% Stock Surge - Forbes
summary: This article by Trefis Team explains the 40.1% stock surge in Microsoft (MSFT), attributing it to exceptional performance in cloud computing and AI, strong financial results, major capital expenditures in AI infrastructure, and steady shareholder returns. It also references the Trefis High Quality Portfolio for a diversified investment strategy.

title: Microsoft-Backed OpenAI Mulls New Revenue Streams Under Five-Year Plan to Meet $1 Trillion Spending - MarketScreener
summary: OpenAI, backed by Microsoft, is exploring new revenue streams as part of a five-year plan to meet its massive $1 trillion spending pledges. The company's expansion efforts include collaborations with other tech giants to integrate AI across various services.

title: WPP and Google ‘to transform marketing as we know it’
summary: WPP announced a five-year expansion of its partnership with Google, involving a $400 million commitment to Google technologies. The company is preparing to unveil new MacBook Pros with M5 chips, iPad Pros, and an upgraded Vision Pro headset, while also subtly preparing for CEO Tim Cook's succession with John Ternus emerging as a leading internal candidate. Analysts are split on Apple's outlook, with some forecasting a new "supercycle" of demand and a $310 price target, while others express valuation concerns given the current market cap of $3.8 trillion.

title: Google Stock’s October Surge: Alphabet Nears Record Highs on AI Buzz and Analyst Upgrades - ts2.tech
summary: Alphabet's stock is nearing record highs in October 2025, driven by significant AI investments, new product launches, and strong analyst upgrades. Despite market volatility and ongoing regulatory scrutiny, the company's robust fundamentals, including a resurgent ad business and booming Google Cloud, position it as a leading performer among tech giants. Investors are closely watching its Q3 earnings report for continued double-digit growth.

title: Argent Capital Management Loads Up on Murphy USA (MUSA) With 43K Shares in Q3 Buy - The Motley Fool
summary: Argent Capital Management increased its stake in Murphy USA (MUSA) by purchasing 43,216 shares in Q3 2025, a transaction valued at approximately $17.11 million. This buy increased Argent's total holding to 130,640 shares, valued at $50.72 million, despite Murphy USA's recent underperformance compared to the S&P 500. The investment highlights Argent's bullish outlook on Murphy USA's long-term potential, driven by strategic expansion and a strong partnership with Walmart, despite current financial metrics that show significant reinvestment into growth.

title: Oracle brings AI-powered database to AWS with wider partner reach - DataCenterNews Asia Pacific
summary: Oracle has expanded its Oracle Database@AWS service with new AI-powered capabilities, including Oracle Autonomous AI Lakehouse and Oracle Zero Data Loss Autonomous Recovery Service, and has launched a partner program allowing customers to purchase the offering through Oracle and AWS channel partners. These enhancements aim to support mission-critical workloads and AI applications for enterprises migrating to the cloud, with plans for global expansion across 20 additional AWS regions. The expanded partner network and new features are designed to provide greater flexibility, simplified procurement, and advanced data protection for customers.

title: How OFA Group’s AI “PlanAid” Is Transforming Building Code Compliance and Architectural Efficiency
summary: Thomas Gaffney, COO of OFA Group (NASDAQ: OFAL), discusses how their AI platform PlanAid is revolutionizing building code compliance by automating the review of architectural blueprints against local and national codes. PlanAid aims to significantly reduce project timelines and costs by identifying non-compliance issues early, thereby improving efficiency for architects, developers, and investors. Gaffney also addresses the role of AI in boosting productivity, managing "black-box" risks through human oversight, and the company's future expansion into broader construction applications with tools like QuickBIM.

title: Jamie Dimon gets real on AI, sees stocks ‘in some form of bubble territory’ - Fortune
summary: Jamie Dimon, CEO of JPMorgan Chase, discussed the transformative power of AI while cautioning that some asset prices are in "bubble territory." He distinguished between AI's genuine breakthrough and the speculative nature of certain investments, urging businesses to adopt AI but also to prepare for potential job displacement. Dimon also highlighted JPMorgan's extensive AI investments and the need for thoughtful planning to mitigate AI's societal impacts.

title: TSMC Earnings: Here's What To Expect As AI Reaches A Fever Pitch (NYSE:TSM) - Seeking Alpha
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited (TSM) is preparing to report earnings, with expectations high due to the surging demand for AI technologies. The company is identified as a primary beneficiary of the AI "craze" and holds a dominant market position. This makes TSM a potentially strong long-term investment.

title: Siemens Treasury: leading innovation in real-time payments - flow – Deutsche Bank
summary: Heiko Nix, Siemens' Global Head of Cash Management and Payments, discusses the ongoing transformation of Siemens' Corporate Treasury, driven by technology and a four-pillar strategy: simplification, automation, acceleration, and innovation. The article highlights Siemens' pioneering use of virtual accounts and real-time payments, developed in collaboration with partners like Deutsche Bank, to streamline cash management and lay the groundwork for a machine-native economy. This innovative approach has led to significant efficiencies, including 24/7 liquidity management and increased automation across global operations.

title: Microsoft Bullied OpenAI Into Cloud Deal, Antitrust Suit Says - Law360
summary: A proposed class action lawsuit has been filed against Microsoft Corp. by ChatGPT subscribers, alleging the company inflated prices by forcing OpenAI into an exclusive cloud computing deal. The suit claims Microsoft wielded its significant investment in OpenAI to gain sole provider status for computing services for OpenAI's AI products. This action took place in a California federal court, with the suit filed on Monday.

title: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink: Asset Tokenization Is Just Beginning — 2025 RWA and Ethereum (ETH) Trading Implications - Blockchain News
summary: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink announced that the market is at the beginning of the tokenization of all assets, signaling a continued institutional focus on real-world asset (RWA) adoption on blockchain. This move could democratize investments, allowing retail traders to access high-value assets, and opens up significant trading opportunities in tokenized assets and related cryptocurrencies like Ethereum (ETH), Chainlink (LINK), and Polygon (MATIC). The article suggests that increased institutional adoption could bolster the overall crypto ecosystem and influence price dynamics across major tokens, leading to potential bullish breakouts.

title: Beyond Meat dealt another blow in latest bad news for plant-based company
summary: Beyond Meat's stock plunged by 12% in Tuesday trading after the company announced a debt exchange plan that will dilute the value of current shares. The plant-based meat maker, once a market darling, has struggled with poor sales in the U.S. and recently suspended operations in China, despite some success in Europe. CEO Ethan Brown indicated a strategic shift towards a broader "Beyond" brand and different protein offerings.

title: Oracle and Nvidia in $3.5bn investment to boost Abu Dhabi government services - thenationalnews.com
summary: Oracle and Nvidia are investing $3.54 billion to enhance Abu Dhabi's government services with AI, aiming to develop approximately 160 AI-driven services, including automatic notifications for benefits and license renewals. This initiative is part of Abu Dhabi's Digital Strategy 2025-2027, which seeks to establish an AI-native government and is expected to contribute over $6.53 billion to the economy by 2027 while creating more than 5,000 jobs. The project will utilize complete sovereign cloud adoption to ensure data security and digital sovereignty.

title: WisdomTree Bitcoin ETF Daily Flow $0 on Oct 14, 2025 — BTC Spot ETF Liquidity Update - Blockchain News
summary: On October 14, 2025, the WisdomTree Bitcoin ETF recorded $0 million in daily net flow, indicating no net creations or redemptions for that session. This neutral flow suggests a pause in new capital allocation and potential investor caution amid fluctuating Bitcoin prices. Traders are advised to monitor on-chain metrics and other market indicators to understand the implications for Bitcoin's price and broader market dynamics.

title: Dines Daniel, UiPath CEO, sells $4.1 million in PATH stock By Investing.com - Investing.com UK

These sales were conducted under a Rule 10b5-1 selling plan, following a 60% stock return for UiPath over the past six months. The company has also announced several new product integrations and AI-driven automation capabilities, leading to updated analyst ratings and price targets.

title: Microsoft Continues Dividend Prowess with Latest Declaration: A Beacon for Income Investors - FinancialContent

This commitment to shareholder returns positions Microsoft as an attractive option for income-oriented investors, signaling the company's robust financial health and stability within the technology sector. The consistent dividend policy also serves as a benchmark for other tech companies, balancing aggressive innovation with reliable income generation.

title: Apple Poised for Another Dividend Hike, Solidifying Appeal for Income Investors - FinancialContent
summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) is expected to announce another quarterly dividend hike, continuing its 14-year streak of increases and reinforcing its appeal to dividend growth investors. Despite a modest current yield, Apple's consistent dividend growth, strong financial health, and strategic capital allocation make it an attractive long-term investment. This move aligns with a broader trend among mature tech companies balancing growth with shareholder returns.

title: Nvidia’s (NVDA) Relentless Deal Flow Opens Door to $250 Price Target

The article highlights Nvidia's continued market dominance and innovative pace in the AI sector.

title: China abandons Microsoft file format - Big News Network.com
summary: China is reportedly beginning to replace Microsoft Word with its local WPS software for official government documents, as evidenced by the Commerce Ministry's recent rare earth export control announcement. This shift signals escalating trade and technology tensions between Beijing and Washington. Foreign software firms like Adobe and Citrix have been retreating from China, and Microsoft has closed its AI research lab and physical stores in mainland China amidst these tensions.

title: Rigetti Computing Stock: What’s Next for the Quantum Computing Pioneer in the Next 3 Years? - TECHi
summary: Rigetti Computing, a quantum hardware and software firm, is progressing towards early commercialization with technical milestones such as a 36-qubit system and aiming for 100+ qubits. Despite technological challenges and competitive pressures from industry giants and pure-play rivals like IonQ, Rigetti aims for stable business outcomes by focusing on scaling qubits, improving error rates, and converting early orders into sustained customer relationships.

The partnerships highlight an accelerating AI infrastructure boom, with AMD emerging as a strong challenger to Nvidia's market dominance.

authors: Matt Miller, Katie Greifeld, Isabelle Lee, Carol Massar

The innovation aims to enhance customer experience, disrupt OTAs, and sets a new benchmark for AI adoption within the airline industry.

title: Save over $40 on the Xbox Elite Series 2 wireless controller at Walmart
summary: Walmart is offering a discount of over $40 on the Xbox Elite Series 2 wireless controller, making it available for $153. These technologies aim to drastically improve energy efficiency and power density in AI data centers, reducing energy loss by up to 5% and potentially achieving 98% efficiency in power supply units. This development addresses the growing power consumption and thermal management challenges in AI, enabling more sustainable and scalable AI infrastructure.

title: Microsoft plans to rent data center capacity in Portugal from Nscale: report
summary: Microsoft is reportedly planning to rent data center capacity from Nscale in a new facility in Portugal. This facility will be powered by Nvidia's AI chips and is expected to open early next year, located south of Lisbon, as per a Bloomberg report.

title: MGE Energy (MGEE): A Steady Utility and Reliable Dividend King Focused on Clean Energy - Insider Monkey
summary: MGE Energy (MGEE) is highlighted as a reliable utility and "Dividend King" due to its consistent financial health, disciplined capital management, and 50 consecutive years of increasing dividends. title: Walmart partners with OpenAI so shoppers can buy directly in ChatGPT

The company emphasizes its focus on helping organizations build secure applications at scale amidst the complexities of cloud, AI, and regulatory changes.

summary: Walmart is partnering with OpenAI to integrate its offerings into ChatGPT's new "Instant Checkout" feature, allowing shoppers to complete purchases directly within the AI-powered bot. The move follows similar ventures into agentic AI by Amazon, as major retailers increasingly invest in artificial intelligence to enhance the shopping experience.

title: NetApp Introduces Comprehensive Enterprise-Grade Data Platform for AI
summary: NetApp has unveiled new products a comprehensive enterprise-grade data platform for AI innovation, addressing the shift from AI pilots to mission-critical applications. The new NetApp AFX, featuring disaggregated ONTAP, and the NetApp AI Data Engine, integrated with NVIDIA AI Data Platform, simplify and secure the AI data pipeline, accelerating enterprise AI retrieval augmented generation (RAG) and inference across hybrid and multicloud environments. These solutions provide high-performance storage and intelligent data services, ensuring data is AI-ready.

title: Analyst Says This ‘Beaten Down’ Cheap Healthcare Stock Can See a ‘Nice Pop’ - Insider Monkey
summary: An analyst from G Squared Private Wealth believes UnitedHealth Group Incorporated (UNH) is a "beaten down" and "cheap" healthcare stock that could experience a "nice pop" if it executes its plans effectively, particularly regarding revenue growth and medical loss ratio. LRT Global Opportunities Strategy highlighted UNH's strong competitive moat due to its dominant health benefits platform and rapidly growing health services business. The article suggests that while UNH presents investment potential, some AI stocks may offer higher returns in a shorter timeframe.

title: Microsoft Hit with Antitrust Lawsuit Over AI Pricing and OpenAI Deal - PYMNTS.com
summary: Microsoft is facing a class-action lawsuit in San Francisco federal court, accused of illegally inflating generative AI service costs through a secret agreement with OpenAI. The lawsuit claims Microsoft leveraged its exclusive cloud computing deal with OpenAI to limit computing power, thereby restraining competition and artificially raising ChatGPT subscription prices. Eleven consumers are seeking damages for alleged overcharges and an injunction to prevent Microsoft from re-establishing such restrictions.

title: Salesforce Turns Slack into an AI Hub with Agent360 Integration

Unveiled at Dreamforce 2025, this initiative aims to boost enterprise productivity by centralizing collaboration between people, AI, and agents, leveraging Slack as an agentic OS. These enhancements are currently in pilot with select customers, with general availability expected in January 2026.

title: Seilern Investment Management Sells $43 Million Worth of IDEXX Laboratories (NASDAQ: IDXX) Stock

The article highlights IDEXX's strong operational outlook and growth prospects, suggesting that the stock's recent appreciation led to Seilern's rebalancing rather than a lack of confidence in the company.

title: Walmart, OpenAI Partner to Bring Shopping Inside ChatGPT
summary: Walmart and OpenAI have partnered to integrate a shopping experience directly into ChatGPT, allowing users to browse, plan, and check out items conversationally using Instant Checkout. This collaboration aims to transform traditional e-commerce by replacing search bars with an AI-driven, personalized interface for purchasing groceries and household essentials. Walmart is also expanding AI training for its workforce and implementing ChatGPT Enterprise internally to leverage AI tools more effectively.

title: Nasdaq 100 Outlook As Quantum And AI Bubble Fears Intensify - The Market Periodical
summary: The Nasdaq 100 Index is facing potential bearish pressure due to intensifying fears of an AI bubble and risks within the quantum computing sector. Analysts are concerned about inflated valuations in both industries, with a Bloomberg survey indicating that 54% of participants believe the AI industry is in a bubble. The article highlights the significant market capitalization of quantum computing companies despite low revenues and substantial losses, and concludes with a technical analysis suggesting a potential bearish breakout for the Nasdaq 100.

title: Oracle AI Database 26ai Powers the AI for Data Revolution - MarketScreener

The new database features Agentic AI workflows, AI Vector Search, and an Autonomous AI Lakehouse supported across major cloud providers like OCI, AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud. Oracle AI Database 26ai also leverages Oracle Exadata for accelerated AI performance and enhanced security with SQL Firewall capabilities.

title: Microsoft (MSFT) to Boost Cloud Computing Capacity with Nscale’s Data Center in Portugal - TipRanks
summary: Microsoft is expanding its cloud computing capabilities by renting capacity from Nscale's new data center facility in Sines, Portugal. This builds on previous partnerships between Microsoft and the British cloud computing startup, including a $6.2 billion deal for AI infrastructure in Norway and a project to build the UK's largest supercomputer. The Portugal data center is expected to be operational early next year and will utilize Nvidia's Blackwell Ultra GB300 GPUs, further solidifying Microsoft's efforts in AI innovation.

title: Oracle Unveils Next-Generation Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Zettascale10 Cluster for AI - MarketScreener
summary: Oracle announced its new Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Zettascale10, which is touted as the largest AI supercomputer in the cloud. This supercomputer connects hundreds of thousands of NVIDIA GPUs across multiple data centers, forming multi-gigawatt clusters capable of delivering up to 16 zettaFLOPS of peak performance. OCI Zettascale10 is built on Oracle Acceleron RoCE networking architecture and is being deployed with OpenAI at the Stargate site in Abilene, Texas.

title: AI momentum, FX debasement drive markets ahead of earnings, Goldman Sachs says - Proactive financial news

The firm raised its gold price forecast and noted the metal's role as a diversifier, while also warning about potential vulnerabilities in high-momentum segments due to low S&P 500 correlations ahead of the Q3 earnings season.

title: Market Reacts Strongly to Coeur Mining (CDE) Sharing Exploration News - Insider Monkey

title: Arm joins with Open Compute Project to unveil new chiplet standards for AI data centers - SiliconANGLE
