summary: Oil services stocks are showing a strong rebound, outperforming the broader energy sector due to improving fundamentals and rising capital expenditures in oil exploration. Valaris and Baker Hughes are leading this recovery, with Valaris eyeing a rally towards $75 and Baker Hughes reaching an 11% gain after strong earnings. Technical indicators suggest sustained upward momentum for the industry.

title: 三年年化超14%，SPYV ETF表現有何秘密?
summary: SPYV ETF, which tracks the S&P 500 Value Index, has achieved over 14% annualized returns over the past three and five years, making it an attractive option for investors seeking stable, long-term growth in U.S. value stocks. The ETF focuses on undervalued, large-cap blue-chip stocks with a low expense ratio of 0.04%. Its strategic allocation across information technology, finance, and healthcare, along with defensive sectors, contributes to its balanced performance.

title: TCAF, 2 Years & $5 Billion Later
summary: The T. Rowe Price Capital Appreciation Equity ETF (TCAF) has reached its two-year anniversary and accumulated over $5 billion in assets under management, demonstrating its success in the active ETF market. Launched in June 2023, TCAF employs a GARP (growth at a reasonable price) investing approach, focusing on individual security research and companies with strong management, growth potential, and attractive valuations. This strategy has resonated with investors, offering a competitively priced option for active management amidst market volatility.

title: Why Simmons First National (SFNC) Stock Is Down Today
summary: Simmons First National's (SFNC) stock fell 4.3% following the announcement of a public offering of 16.22 million shares at $18.50 per share, a 7.9% discount, intended to raise $300 million for general corporate purposes and potential "balance sheet repositioning." This stock drop is attributed to the dilutive effect of new share issuance despite the company recently reporting strong Q2 2025 financial results with significant earnings growth and a fifth consecutive quarterly increase in net interest margin.

title: Earnings call transcript: IPG’s Q2 2025 EPS beats forecast, stock rises
summary: Interpublic Group (IPG) reported a strong Q2 2025 earnings performance, with an EPS of $0.75 significantly exceeding the forecast of $0.5617, and revenue matching expectations at $2.17 billion. The stock rose 4.87% in pre-market trading, reflecting investor confidence despite a 6.6% year-over-year decrease in net revenue, as the company focuses on innovation, efficiency, and AI platforms. IPG maintains a positive outlook, anticipating a full-year organic net revenue decrease of 1-2% but an adjusted EBITDA margin well above 16.6%, with strategic transformation efforts and an upcoming acquisition by Omnicom poised for long-term growth.

title: AI Bubble Is More Unhinged Than Dot-Com—A Chilling Warning From The Inside
summary: Apollo's chief economist Torsten Slok warns that the current AI-driven market frenzy is more dangerously inflated than the 1990s internet bubble, primarily due to its concentrated nature within the S&P 500's largest names. He highlights that while the top 10 companies' P/E ratio is similar to 2000, the rest of the market is not as stretched, indicating a structural imbalance. Investors can use ETFs like Global X Robotics & Artificial Intelligence ETF (BOTZ) for exposure or Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (RSP) and ProShares Short QQQ (PSQ) for hedging.

title: VOO ETF Explained: Is It the Best S&P 500 Investment?
summary: This article examines the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO), evaluating its distinguishing features, comparing it to rival S&P 500 ETFs like SPY and IVV, and analyzing its risks, benefits, and role in an investment portfolio for 2025. It highlights VOO's low expense ratio, strong performance, and broad diversification as reasons for its appeal to long-term, cost-conscious investors. The article concludes that VOO remains a top-tier S&P 500 investment due to its low fees, solid performance, and large assets under management, making it a compelling option for a buy-and-hold strategy focused on steady growth.

title: ADP Processing’s AI Strategy: Analysis of Dominance in Human Capital Management
summary: This article analyzes ADP's AI strategy, highlighting its unique position to dominate the Human Capital Management (HCM) industry due to its market incumbency, unparalleled proprietary dataset, and pragmatic, trust-centric AI approach. It details how ADP leverages its global footprint, financial strength, and the "Data Network Effect" from its vast client base to create a formidable competitive moat. The report also compares ADP's strategy with major competitors like Workday, Oracle, and SAP, and addresses the challenge from AI-native HR tech startups, concluding that ADP's approach is highly sustainable and defensible.

title: With 59% ownership of the shares, Sony Group Corporation (TSE:6758) is heavily dominated by institutional owners
summary: Institutional investors hold 59% of Sony Group Corporation (TSE:6758) shares, making them the most powerful shareholder group and influencing the stock price significantly. BlackRock, Inc. is the largest single institutional shareholder with 9.2%. The general public holds a 41% stake, while insiders own less than 1% of the shares.

title: Fund Giants Put Faith in ‘Trump Put’ to Keep Stock Rally Rolling
summary: Major asset managers like Invesco, Fidelity International, and JPMorgan Asset Management are increasing their investments in risk assets, especially US and Asian technology shares and emerging markets. This bullish strategy is based on the expectation that while Donald Trump may threaten economic disruption, he will ultimately pull back, allowing the stock rally to continue.

title: Alphabet's AI Moment: Trading Q2 Results With 2X Bull and 1X Bear ETFs
summary: Alphabet (GOOGL) is set to report Q2 2025 earnings on July 23rd, with traders anticipating volatility due to heavy AI investments, competitive pressures, and ongoing legal battles. Despite outperforming earnings estimates previously, the stock has lagged the S&P 500. Traders can utilize Direxion's Single Stock Daily Leveraged & Inverse ETFs (GGLL and GGLS) to capitalize on potential price swings around the earnings release.

title: 'Overvalued' AI Stocks Like Nvidia, Microsoft May Trigger Market Crash Worse Than The Dot-Com Bubble, Economist Warns
summary: A leading economist warns that the current AI stock frenzy, particularly in companies like Nvidia and Microsoft, represents a market overvaluation potentially worse than the dot-com bubble of 1999. Torsten Sløk of Apollo Global Management notes that the top 10 S&P 500 companies are more overvalued now than during the 1990s IT bubble, suggesting a major market crash could be triggered if these inflated promises are not met. Other prominent figures like Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and billionaire Ray Dalio have also expressed similar concerns regarding a potential AI bubble.

title: Microsoft is collaborating with the U.S. Idaho National Laboratory to use AI to accelerate the nuclear power plant licensing process.
summary: Microsoft is partnering with the U.S. Idaho National Laboratory to utilize artificial intelligence in speeding up the licensing process for new nuclear power plants. This collaboration aims to generate necessary engineering and safety analysis reports more efficiently, addressing rising energy demands, particularly from AI data centers, and fulfilling a past executive order to accelerate nuclear plant licensing.

title: Intel cuts more than 5,000 jobs across four states as restructuring accelerates
summary: Intel Corp. is laying off over 5,000 employees across four states, including California, Oregon, Arizona, and Texas, as part of a restructuring plan to cut over 20% of its global workforce. These job cuts aim to streamline management and achieve significant operating expense reductions. The layoffs are part of a broader trend of workforce reductions by major tech companies, amid concerns about AI's potential impact on employment.

title: Top Reasons to Invest in VUG ETF for Long-Term Growth
summary: This article highlights the Vanguard Growth ETF (VUG) as a strong option for long-term growth investors. It delves into VUG's structure, performance, and key benefits such as exposure to innovative industry leaders, a low expense ratio, and diversification. The fund targets large-cap U.S. growth stocks, making it suitable for those seeking capital appreciation over time.

title: 5 Undervalued Companies That Are Investing in Renewable Energy
summary: Despite government policies, many corporations are continuing to push for renewable energy adoption due to factors like cost-effectiveness, AI needs, and reshoring. This article highlights five undervalued companies—Rogers Communications, Alphabet, General Motors, HP, and Salesforce—that are making significant investments in renewable energy and are highly rated by Morningstar analysts. These companies are committed to increasing their use of clean energy through various strategies, including PPAs and onsite generation, to meet sustainability goals and power their growing operations, especially in technology-intensive sectors.

title: XYLD: A Blend Of Ultra-High Yield And AI-Driven Growth (NYSEARCA:XYLD)
summary: The article discusses the Global X S&P 500 Covered Call ETF (XYLD), highlighting its ultra-high yield of 13% and significant exposure to AI and technology trends through major holdings like Nvidia, Microsoft, and Apple. It suggests XYLD is suitable for income-focused investors seeking growth with S&P 500 diversification and a strong tech tilt, emphasizing its long track record since 2013.

title: CGDV ETF Delivers 20% Upside With Strong Dividend Growth, Low Volatility
summary: The Capital Group Dividend Value ETF (CGDV) is highlighted as a strong dividend growth vehicle, offering a superior yield and risk-adjusted returns compared to the S&P 500. It features a concentrated portfolio of 52 wide-moat companies, including tech and industrial leaders, overseen by a multi-manager strategy. With a 0.87 beta and competitive expense ratio, CGDV aims to deliver 14-20% total return potential through capital appreciation and dividend compounding.

title: VTV Is a Great Choice for Most, but I Like the VUG ETF Better
summary: This article compares two popular Vanguard ETFs, the Vanguard Value ETF (VTV) and the Vanguard Growth ETF (VUG), along with the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO). While acknowledging VTV as a solid, low-fee option for investors seeking undervalued stocks and a margin of safety, the author expresses a preference for VUG due to its historical outperformance and focus on high-growth companies. The article provides detailed performance comparisons, expense ratios, holdings, and risk-reward considerations for each ETF, emphasizing that both are strong choices depending on an investor's strategy.

title: 4 Charts on Nvidia’s Record $4 Trillion Market Cap
summary: Nvidia has achieved a record-breaking $4 trillion market capitalization, becoming the first company to reach this valuation thanks to the booming demand for AI hardware and software. Shares of the semiconductor giant have rocketed 280% over the past two years, largely outperforming the broader market and other tech giants like Microsoft and Apple. Despite new competition, Morningstar analysts believe Nvidia will remain dominant in the AI market, with the company currently rated as fairly valued.

title: Workday (WDAY) major shareholder sells $17.3M in stock
summary: A major shareholder of Workday (WDAY), David A. Duffield, sold 62,251 shares of Class A Common Stock for over $17.3 million on July 8, 2025. This transaction was conducted under a pre-arranged Rule 10b5-1 trading plan. The company, a prominent player in software with a $61.2 billion market capitalization, also converted Class B shares to Class A, while analysts offer mixed views on its valuation and AI strategy.

title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company (HPE): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company (HPE) by Stock Region Research. The thesis highlights HPE's strategic focus on edge computing and hybrid cloud, particularly through its GreenLake platform, which integrates AI and machine learning capabilities. HPE is seen as well-positioned to capitalize on increasing enterprise IT budgets for AI and cloud initiatives.

title: Should Fidelity Quality Factor ETF (FQAL) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The Fidelity Quality Factor ETF (FQAL) offers broad exposure to the Large Cap Blend segment of the US equity market, with over $1.05 billion in assets and a low expense ratio of 0.16%. It holds a Zacks ETF Rank of 2 (Buy) and has shown strong performance, returning 7.89% year-to-date and 14.09% over the last year. The fund's top holdings include major tech companies like Microsoft, Nvidia, and Apple, primarily focusing on the Information Technology sector.

title: Accenture and Microsoft Expand Collaboration on Gen-AI Powered Cyber Solutions
summary: Accenture and Microsoft are deepening their collaboration to develop advanced generative AI-driven cyber solutions, aiming to help organizations combat rising threats, optimize costs, and enhance business resilience. This expanded partnership focuses on four key areas: SOC modernization, automated data and AI security, security-centric cyber migration and consolidation, and enhanced identity and access management. The companies have already successfully assisted clients like Nationwide Building Society in streamlining cybersecurity operations and accelerating threat detection through these innovative solutions.

title: Nvidia's $4 trillion milestone caps rise of stock market behemoth
summary: Nvidia Corp reached a $4 trillion market valuation, highlighting its significant importance in the stock market and the technology sector, driven by a massive surge in its stock price since late 2022. This milestone gives Nvidia the largest weight in the S&P 500 and reflects the growing influence of tech companies, which now comprise one-third of the S&P 500's market value. Other tech giants like Microsoft and Apple are also nearing or exceeding the $3 trillion mark, underscoring the dominance of technology in current market valuations.

title: IVV Is a Great Choice for Most, but I Like SPLG ETF Better
summary: This article compares two S&P 500 tracking ETFs, IVV (iShares Core S&P 500 ETF) and SPLG (SPDR Portfolio S&P 500 ETF), highlighting that both are excellent, low-cost options for investors. While their holdings are nearly identical, the author prefers SPLG due to its slightly lower expense ratio (0.02% vs. 0.03% for IVV) and more efficient bid-ask spread. The article reinforces Warren Buffett's support for low-cost index funds as a sound investment strategy.

title: AES Stock Jumps on Report That Renewable Energy Firm Is Exploring Sale
summary: AES Corp. shares rose sharply after reports that the renewable energy firm is exploring a potential sale due to takeover interest from firms like BlackRock's Global Infrastructure Partners and Brookfield Asset Management. The company, which has partnerships with major tech firms for renewable power, has seen its stock decline significantly over the past two years. The power sector is currently attracting significant investor interest, driven by the increasing demand for energy to support AI and cryptocurrency mining.

title: Nvidia briefly becomes the first $4 trillion company. How it beat Microsoft and Apple to the crown.
summary: Nvidia briefly achieved a $4 trillion intraday market capitalization on Wednesday, becoming the first U.S. company to do so. Although its shares pulled back slightly by the close, ending just below the milestone, Nvidia still set a new record for the highest closing market cap ever at $3.974 trillion, surpassing Apple's previous record. The company's stock reached an intraday high of $164.42, demonstrating its significant market growth.

title: Nvidia becomes first company to reach $4tn in market value
summary: Nvidia has become the first public company in history to achieve a $4tn market valuation, with its stock price rising roughly 2.4% to $164. This significant milestone is attributed to the ongoing surge in demand for artificial intelligence technologies, where Nvidia's chips and software are considered industry leaders. The company's market value has more than tripled in about a year, outpacing giants like Apple and Microsoft in growth speed.

title: Nvidia becomes first company to hit $4 trillion valuation
summary: Nvidia became the first company to reach a $4 trillion valuation, momentarily surpassing Apple's previous record, driven by surging demand for its AI chips. Despite closing slightly shy of $4 trillion, the milestone highlights its explosive growth and central role in the AI revolution, even as it navigates challenges like Chinese export restrictions. The company has seen its market value climb significantly in recent years, outranking other tech giants like Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, and Meta.

title: Intapp: Remaining Bullish Despite Weak Stock Action
summary: Intapp (INTA) is showing strong growth in AI-powered cloud solutions for professional services, driven by high gross margins and expanding operating leverage. While recent stock action is weak due to macro concerns, the article suggests current estimates may be conservative, offering upside potential. Key partnerships with Microsoft and Snowflake are enhancing its competitive position.

title: Nvidia becomes first US company to reach $4 trillion market cap
summary: Nvidia has become the first public company globally to achieve a $4 trillion market capitalization, driven by soaring demand for artificial intelligence technologies. This milestone solidifies its position as a top-performing stock, surpassing Apple and Microsoft in market value growth speed. The company's impressive financial performance and market weight on the S&P 500 highlight Wall Street's confidence in the future of AI.

title: Why Coca-Cola’s CIO prioritizes big-impact AI pilot projects
summary: Coca-Cola's CIO, Neeraj Tolmare, focuses on AI pilot projects that promise significant revenue generation or efficiency gains, a strategy driven by the company's leadership. He highlights successful AI applications in predicting retail demand and generating marketing content, while also acknowledging the challenges and ethical considerations of AI in creative applications. Tolmare emphasizes the company's strategic approach to AI vendor partnerships and its exploration of agentic AI.

title: SuRo Capital Corp. Second Quarter 2025 Preliminary Investment Portfolio Update
summary: SuRo Capital Corp. announced a strong second quarter for 2025, driven by investments in AI infrastructure companies like CoreWeave and OpenAI, leading to an anticipated NAV per share of $9.00 to $9.50. This performance led the Board of Directors to declare an initial cash dividend of $0.25 per share, with expectations of further dividends throughout the year. The company also made a new $5.0 million investment in Plaid and exited positions in CoreWeave and ServiceTitan, leveraging its publicly traded common stock to provide access to high-growth private companies.

title: VGT ETF Explained: Is It the Best Tech Investment Today?
summary: This article provides an in-depth analysis of the Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT), evaluating its framework, effectiveness, and potential risks as a tech investment. It details VGT's holdings, performance against the S&P 500, and compares it to other popular tech ETFs like XLK, QQQ, and FTEC. The piece concludes that VGT is a strong candidate for a core tech holding in a growth-oriented portfolio due to its diversified, low-cost structure and alignment with innovation, despite its inherent volatility.

title: NTT Communications achieves a safe hybrid work environment with Microsoft Entra ID and Intune
summary: NTT Communications adopted a Zero Trust security model by migrating to Microsoft Entra ID and Intune to establish a secure hybrid work environment. This transition involved moving employee IDs and the management of 40,000 "Secured PCs" from on-premises systems to cloud-based solutions. The migration has led to simplified device management, enhanced security through multi-factor and device authentication, and support for diverse employee work styles while reducing operational costs.

title: Ingram Micro confirms ransomware attack disrupted systems over July 4 weekend
summary: Ingram Micro Holding Corp. confirmed a ransomware attack by the SafePay group disrupted its systems over the July 4 weekend, impacting its website and ordering platforms. The company is investigating the incident with cybersecurity experts and cooperating with law enforcement, while customers express concern about potential network access. SafePay, known for double extortion tactics, may leak Ingram Micro's data if ransom demands are not met.

title: The intelligent data blueprint at NetApp, in detail
summary: NetApp is focusing on intelligent data infrastructure to unify cloud and AI, distinguishing itself by offering native storage integration across major public cloud providers. The company's strategy involves bringing AI capabilities directly to the storage layer, rather than moving massive datasets, and is collaborating with Nvidia on the Nvidia AI Data Platform. NetApp is also evolving its market focus to include data engineers and security leaders alongside traditional CIOs and storage administrators.

title: IBM’s stock is beating Big Tech this year. Why this analyst sees more gains ahead.
summary: IBM's stock has outperformed major Big Tech companies this year, climbing 33% year-to-date. Analysts believe there's more room for growth, especially as IBM's business model offers more stability compared to software companies facing AI and geopolitical threats. This performance significantly beats Meta, Microsoft, Nvidia, Amazon, Apple, and Alphabet.

title: Insight CEO: ‘We Are Pivoting To Become An AI-First Solutions Integrator’
summary: Insight Enterprises, led by CEO Joyce Mullen, is transforming into an "AI-first solutions integrator" to help clients navigate the rapidly evolving AI landscape. The company emphasizes continuous learning for its employees, ethical AI implementation, and delivering measurable results quickly for its primarily mid-market clients, actively seeking acquisitions to enhance its AI capabilities. With a focus on responsible AI, Insight aims to bridge the gap between AI hype and practical business value through strategies like the Radius AI assessment and specialized managed services.

title: Nvidia's $4T Countdown: Will Next Week's Chart Print A Trillion-Dollar Breakout?
summary: Nvidia is on the verge of reaching a $4 trillion market capitalization, potentially becoming only the second U.S. company to hit this milestone. Despite competitive whispers, Nvidia maintains its dominance due to strong demand for its AI chips, with strong European partnerships offsetting China sales pressure. Its valuation remains reasonable compared to peers, making a $164 breakout a key target for investors.

title: Tencent Cloud Newsletter Featuring Gartner Research: Data+AI Enabled NextGen Data Intelligence Platform
summary: Tencent Cloud has released a newsletter featuring Gartner research, titled "Data + AI: Build NextGen Data Intelligence Platform," which addresses challenges enterprises face with generative AI. The newsletter emphasizes the shift from "model competition" to "competition for high-value data assets" and highlights Tencent Cloud's comprehensive Data + AI product matrix designed to help enterprises build integrated platforms to manage these new demands. Key capabilities include composability of data/AI technologies, end-to-end lifecycle development, multimodal data processing, and unified metadata-driven governance.

title: About Us
summary: VivoPower aims to be the leading independent digital real estate and infrastructure partner, focusing on sovereign nations and hyperscalers. The company is a Certified B Corporation, committed to balancing profit with positive social and environmental impact. VivoPower's core values include strategic partnerships, efficient use of energy for computational assets, and solving infrastructure challenges in critical areas like AI data centers and sustainable energy.

title: Microsoft will lay off 9,000 people, including employees from Bethesda and King
summary: Microsoft has announced significant layoffs, impacting 4% of its workforce, totaling 9,000 employees. The gaming division, including Bethesda and King, will be affected, with at least 10% of King employees (around 200 people) being let go. Xbox head Phil Spencer stated these layoffs are necessary for increased business flexibility and efficiency, despite the gaming division's recent success.

title: Hedge Fund and Insider Trading News: Bill Ackman, Chris Hohn, Warren Buffett, Whetstone Capital Advisors, Millennium Management, Katamaran Capital, Third Point, Sprott Focus Trust Inc (FUND), BJ’s Wholesale Club Holdings Inc (BJ), and More
summary: This article compiles various news snippets related to hedge funds and insider trading, featuring prominent figures like Bill Ackman, Chris Hohn, and Warren Buffett. It covers topics such as Ackman's mayoral endorsement, Hohn's hedge fund performance, Buffett's philanthropy, and insider activities in companies like Sprott Focus Trust Inc (FUND) and BJ’s Wholesale Club Holdings Inc (BJ). The article also touches upon the current state of AI stocks and offers a recommendation for a more promising, undervalued AI stock.

title: Jim Cramer Contradicts AI-Led Job Cuts At White Collar Firms As Cathie Wood Says It's 'Hurting Entry-Level Jobs:' Here's How Experts Debunk AI's Impact On Employment
summary: Experts hold conflicting views on AI's impact on employment. While Cathie Wood suggests AI is hurting entry-level jobs and replacing some SaaS functions, citing examples from ARK Invest, Jim Cramer asserts that traditional white-collar firms are still hiring and have not experienced AI-related job cuts because AI is not yet fully trusted at higher corporate levels. Meanwhile, economist Craig Shapiro warns that AI could eliminate 25% of U.S. jobs by 2030, a structural crisis that traditional Federal Reserve tools may not be able to address effectively, supported by studies from Goldman Sachs and Harvard.

title: IWB ETF: Understanding the Russell 1000 ETF
summary: The iShares Russell 1000 ETF (IWB) offers comprehensive exposure to the 1,000 largest US companies, tracking the Russell 1000 Index. With over $41 billion in assets and a low expense ratio of 0.15%, IWB provides diversification and solid long-term performance, making it suitable for core holdings and tactical trading strategies. EBC Financial Group also offers ETF CFD trading for leveraged exposure to funds like IWB.

title: Hamilton Lane co-CEO Juan Delgado speaks at 'Post' Conference in New York
summary: Hamilton Lane co-CEO Juan Delgado spoke at The Jerusalem Post Conference in New York, highlighting Israel as a world-class high-tech investment destination. The firm, a leading global private market investor with over $950 billion in assets, has been investing in Israel for 20 years and is the largest foreign investor in the country's high-tech sector. Despite recent conflicts, Hamilton Lane continues to invest in Israeli private equity and tech companies, with Delgado himself visiting Israel during the war to support its team and clients.

title: IWF ETF: The Smart Way to Access US Growth Stocks
summary: The iShares Russell 1000 Growth ETF (IWF) provides investors with a diversified way to invest in large-cap US growth stocks, tracking the Russell 1000 Growth Index. Managed by BlackRock, it focuses on companies with strong earnings growth and high return on equity, primarily in technology and consumer discretionary sectors. With substantial AUM, low expense ratio, and a strong performance track record, IWF is a compelling option for long-term growth-focused investors, despite its sector concentration and higher volatility.

title: How to Invest in the Gaming Market
summary: The gaming market has evolved significantly from a hobby into a major source of profit, showing resilience during economic downturns and continuous growth driven by mobile gaming and technological advancements. This guide explores why investing in the gaming market is compelling, highlighting its consistent consumer spending, global audience accessibility, and the profitability of free-to-play models. It also covers investment opportunities such as individual gaming stocks (Nintendo, Microsoft, Take-Two Interactive, EA, Roblox, GDEV, NetEase, KRAFTON) and Gaming Exchange-Traded Funds (Vaneck Video Gaming and Esports ETF, GX Video Games & Esports ETF), while acknowledging challenges like high competition and economic factors.

title: DGRW Is a Popular Dividend ETF for Passive Income. But Is It the Best?
summary: The article evaluates DGRW, the WisdomTree U.S. Quality Dividend Growth Fund, as a popular ETF for passive income. It highlights DGRW's focus on quality dividend growth but suggests it may not be the best choice for investors primarily seeking high passive income due to its lower yield and higher expense ratio compared to alternatives like VYM and SCHD. The fund weights companies by dividend payout relative to market cap, emphasizing dividend size over overall company size.

title: Why Intermedia Is the Smarter Choice for Microsoft Teams and Business Communications
summary: Intermedia offers a flexible and scalable cloud communications solution that integrates directly into Microsoft Teams, providing a powerful alternative to one-size-fits-all platforms. The company aims to help organizations maximize their Teams investment by embedding telephony, contact center, advanced archiving, and AI without requiring additional Teams Phone licenses or third-party middleware. Intermedia's partner-first approach and hybrid, resilient architecture also offer benefits, including increased margins for partners and reduced downtime risks.

title: Tech Battles And Gains: Locafy Impresses As Meta, Microsoft Struggle
summary: Locafy's shares surged after a key partnership in digital search services, indicating market enthusiasm for its AI-ready offerings, while Microsoft faced a slight dip due to AI chip delays. Meta Platforms Inc. showed resilience despite EU regulatory challenges, with its shares rising slightly. The varied performance suggests tech sector volatility and the impact of both innovation and regulation on different companies.

title: Microsoft Corp: AI and Fossil Fuels
summary: A shareholder resolution requests Microsoft to report on the climate and financial risks associated with providing advanced technology, including AI and machine learning, to facilitate oil and gas development. Despite Microsoft's climate commitments to be carbon-negative by 2030, the company is a global leader in providing technological platforms for new oil and gas production projects, which carries significant reputational and legal risks for both Microsoft and its investors. The resolution aims to increase transparency regarding Microsoft's climate impact and exposure to climate-related financial risk.

title: Meta Platforms is nearing new highs on a wave of potential acquisition reports 📈
summary: Meta Platforms is nearing new highs as reports surface about its potential acquisition of PlayAI, an AI startup specializing in voice imitation. This move is seen as part of Meta's broader strategy to lead in artificial intelligence development, following a significant investment in Scale AI and bringing its CEO into Meta's "superintelligence" team in mid-June. The company's stock prices are consequently approaching all-time highs as it strives to outpace competitors like Alphabet, Microsoft, and Amazon in the AI race.

title: KraneShares KOID ETF: Humanoid Robot Rings Nasdaq Opening Bell
summary: KraneShares marked the launch of its Global Humanoid and Embodied Intelligence Index ETF (KOID) with a historic event at Nasdaq, where a Unitree G1 Ultimate humanoid robot, "Iris," rang the opening bell. This event highlights the rapid advancements in robotics and AI, with projections suggesting 1 billion humanoids and $5 trillion in annual revenue by 2050. The robot was customized by RoboStore and Stanford University's OpenMind engineers, running on OM1, an open-source operating system for embodied artificial intelligence.

title: IVE ETF: How It Tracks the S&P 500 Value Index
summary: The iShares S&P 500 Value ETF (IVE) is a popular choice for investors seeking exposure to large-cap US value stocks. This article explains how IVE tracks the S&P 500 Value Index using a passive, full replication strategy with periodic rebalancing, highlighting its cost-efficiency and diversification benefits. Key features, top holdings, and performance data are provided to assist traders in understanding its role in portfolio construction.

title: A10 Selected by Microsoft to Protect Mission-critical AI Infrastructure
summary: A10 Networks announced its selection by Microsoft to secure mission-critical generative AI workloads, highlighting A10's capability to scale protection for AI-optimized infrastructure. This collaboration demonstrates A10's role in safeguarding cloud innovation by delivering advanced threat detection and mitigation tailored for hyperscale AI deployments. Dhrupad Trivedi, A10’s board chair and CEO, emphasized the company's commitment to ensuring continuous protection for the transactions powering future innovation.

title: Better Home Hit With Lawsuit Over Google, LinkedIn Web Trackers
summary: Better Home & Finance Holding Co. is facing a proposed class action lawsuit for allegedly using web trackers from Google and LinkedIn to collect customer data without consent. The lawsuit claims that the real estate and mortgage company shared sensitive personal and financial information, such as home addresses and credit scores, which customers expected to remain private. The complaint was filed in the US District Court for the Central District of California, on behalf of potentially millions of affected individuals.

title: Microsoft, Wisconsin Economic Development Corporation, University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee and TitletownTech officially open AI Co-Innovation Lab to accelerate manufacturing innovation
summary: Microsoft, in collaboration with the Wisconsin Economic Development Corporation, the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee, and TitletownTech, officially opened an AI Co-Innovation Lab on the UWM campus. This lab is Microsoft's first AI Co-Innovation Lab with a dedicated focus on manufacturing innovation, building on a $3.3 billion infrastructure investment made a year prior. It aims to accelerate AI adoption across various industries in Wisconsin, providing hands-on collaboration, prototyping, and design sessions with Microsoft engineers to help businesses leverage AI for operational improvements and competitive advantage.

title: IBD Rating Upgrades: PPL Corp Flashes Improved Relative Price Strength
summary: PPL Corp (PPL) saw its Relative Strength (RS) Rating improve from 68 to 71 on Tuesday, indicating improved price performance. This upgrade highlights the utility company's upward momentum in a market where AI is transforming once-sleepy utilities into growth stories. The article also mentions previous upgrades and related news about PPL's strong position in the AI-driven utility sector.

title: Palantir could profit from the Middle East conflict. But here’s why Wall Street thinks its stock is overpriced.
summary: Palantir, a leader in AI technology used by the defense sector, is well-positioned to gain government contracts due to rising tensions in the Middle East, with its stock PLTR seen as a bullish signal by investors. Despite its potential to profit from the conflict, Wall Street analysts believe the company's stock is currently overpriced. This sentiment stems from the discrepancy between its market valuation and the average analyst price target.

title: IWF Is a Great Choice for Most, But I Like VUG ETF Better
summary: The article compares two growth-focused ETFs, the iShares Russell 1000 Growth ETF (IWF) and the Vanguard Growth ETF (VUG). While both offer similar top holdings, VUG is favored due to its significantly lower expense ratio and historically better returns across most periods. The author recommends VUG for investors seeking to add growth to their portfolios due to its cost-efficiency and superior performance.

title: China Fund Board Votes to Shut Down: What Shareholders Need to Know About the Liquidation Plan
summary: The China Fund (NYSE: CHN) Board of Directors has approved a plan of liquidation and dissolution, which will be submitted to stockholders for approval at a Special Meeting. This decision was influenced by geopolitical conditions, fund size, trading volume, discount to net asset value, and the availability of competing investment products like ETFs. Shareholders are advised to carefully review the upcoming proxy statement with detailed information about the proposed liquidation and vote accordingly.

title: Johor Corporation aligns divisions, data, and purpose in its digital growth strategy with Microsoft AI and Cloud
summary: Johor Corporation (JCorp) unified its core business segments by centralizing data on Microsoft Azure, adopting Microsoft 365, and implementing Microsoft Copilot and Power BI to improve decision-making speed and alignment. This digital transformation has enabled faster, data-driven decisions and scaled innovation, with over 100 AI use cases mapped and 500+ users leveraging AI in daily workflows. JCorp's strategic adoption of AI and cloud technologies aims to foster a digitally mature organization, transforming its workforce and operations.

title: $1,000 in AGG Could Turn Into $4,200
summary: The iShares Core U.S. Aggregate Bond ETF (AGG) is a major bond ETF with over $126 billion in assets under management, offering broad exposure to U.S. investment-grade bonds. While its historical average annual return has been around 3.1%, the current higher interest rate environment suggests a potential yield to maturity of almost 4.8%, which could turn a $1,000 investment into over $4,200 in 30 years. Investing in AGG helps diversify portfolios, generate income, and reduce risk and volatility, making it a valuable component for a balanced investment strategy despite lower return potential compared to stocks.

title: Should iShares S&P 500 Value ETF (IVE) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The iShares S&P 500 Value ETF (IVE) offers broad exposure to the Large Cap Value segment of the US equity market, launched in 2000 and managed by Blackrock with over $38 billion in assets. It maintains a low expense ratio of 0.18% and has a Zacks ETF Rank of 2 (Buy), making it a suitable option for investors seeking exposure to large-cap value stocks. The ETF primarily invests in Information Technology, Financials, and Healthcare sectors, with Apple, Microsoft, and Amazon as top holdings, offering diversification and medium risk.

title: Tech Tactically Trimmed: Why I'm Holding MAGS But With Caution
summary: The author remains bullish on big tech long-term but advises caution due to current Magnificent 7 valuations and macro headwinds. While the MAGS ETF offers a unique hybrid structure, its performance can be replicated with a DIY approach. Valuations are stretched for some names, but Microsoft, Google, Apple, and Amazon still show upside potential, leading the author to rate MAGS a Hold, preferring QQQ for now.

title: Should SPDR Dow Jones Industrial Average ETF (DIA) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The SPDR Dow Jones Industrial Average ETF (DIA) is a passively managed ETF designed for broad exposure to the Large Cap Value segment of the US equity market. With over $37.79 billion in assets and a low expense ratio of 0.16%, it's considered a cost-effective option. The ETF holds a Zacks ETF Rank of 1 (Strong Buy) and has shown a year-to-date performance of -0.06% and a one-year gain of 10.54% as of June 18, 2025.

title: ‘매그 7’을 넘어서: 테마 ETF가 AI 투자의 다음 물결을 이끌 수 있을까?
summary: 이 기사는 인공지능(AI) 투자의 다음 물결을 이끌 테마 ETF에 대해 다룹니다. 특히, "매그니피센트 세븐"에만 집중하는 것이 아닌, AI 산업의 변화에 유연하게 대처할 수 있는 새로운 세대의 ETF, 예를 들어 Wedbush ETFMG Global Cloud Technology ETF (NYSE: IVES)의 중요성을 강조합니다. 이 펀드는 AI 혁명의 미래 방향에 맞춰 적응할 수 있는 "살아있는 프레임워크"를 제공하여 장기적인 집중력을 유지하도록 설계되었습니다.

title: Diskover gets $7.5M from Snowflake, NetApp and others to facilitate unstructured data discovery for AI
summary: Diskover Data Inc. secured $7.5 million in seed funding from investors including Snowflake and NetApp to enhance its unstructured data discovery platform for AI. The startup also announced its first acquisition of CloudSoda Inc. and strategic partnerships aiming to help enterprises make their vast amounts of unstructured data usable, searchable, and secure for AI models. This funding will facilitate the expansion of Diskover's go-to-market and engineering teams.

title: The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights Microsoft, AstraZeneca and BlackRock, Taylor Devices and Geospace Technologies
summary: This Zacks Analyst Blog highlights major stocks like Microsoft, AstraZeneca, and BlackRock, along with micro-caps Taylor Devices and Geospace Technologies, citing new research reports. It provides an overview of each company's performance, growth drivers, and potential challenges. The article emphasizes Zacks' unique micro-cap research and offers daily market insights.

title: Todd Corporation embraces Microsoft’s Extended Security Suite for huge security and efficiency gains
summary: Todd Corporation, a vital player in New Zealand's infrastructure, has adopted Microsoft's Extended Security Suite to address fragmented legacy systems and evolving cyber threats. This unprecedented integration in New Zealand's private sector provides Todd with world-class protection, enabling better planning and innovation. The implementation, supported by Arinco, utilizes Microsoft Defender, Intune, Entra ID, and Purview tools, fostering cross-functional engagement and setting a foundation for future innovation, including renewable energy projects.

title: ProShares Launches First ETFs to Target 2x and -2x Daily Returns of Nasdaq-100 Mega Index
summary: ProShares has expanded its lineup of leveraged and inverse ETFs with the introduction of ProShares Ultra Top QQQ (QQUP) and ProShares UltraShort Top QQQ (QQDN). These new ETFs are the first to target 2x and -2x daily returns, respectively, of the Nasdaq-100 Mega Index, which comprises the largest companies within the Nasdaq-100. This launch provides investors with convenient single-ETF access to leveraged or short exposure to a concentrated group of top tech companies.

title: Oracle shares hit record high as AI cloud demand propels revenue forecast
summary: Oracle's shares surged 14% to a record high, breaching the $200-mark for the first time, after the company raised its annual revenue forecast. This growth is attributed to strong demand for its AI-related cloud services, including a joint venture with OpenAI called Stargate. Analyst sentiment is positive, with several brokerages raising their price targets, indicating Oracle's strong position in the enterprise software market.

title: Cisco Mission Statement | Vision | Core Values | Strategy (2025 Analysis)
summary: This article analyzes Cisco's mission statement, corporate social responsibility goals, and core values, providing a comprehensive look at the company's strategic direction for 2025. It details Cisco's commitment to shaping the future of work for all, embracing global reach, ensuring security, and promoting an inclusive future through environmental sustainability and community impact. The article also touches upon key company information, its products, services, and market position.

title: Microsoft recognized for second consecutive year as a Leader in the 2025 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Data Science and Machine Learning Platforms
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader for the second consecutive year in the 2025 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Data Science and Machine Learning (DSML) Platforms. This recognition highlights Microsoft's comprehensive toolchain for building and deploying machine learning models and AI applications through Azure Machine Learning and the Azure AI Foundry. The article details how Azure AI Foundry, with features like Model Router, Model Leaderboard, Model Benchmarks, and fine-tuning capabilities, empowers developers and organizations to create, manage, and deploy AI solutions efficiently and effectively.

title: ‘Forever chemicals’ industry aims to capitalize on AI boom
summary: The "forever chemicals" industry, particularly Chemours, is increasing PFAS production to meet the soaring demand for semiconductor chips driven by the AI boom. This expansion raises environmental concerns due to the long history of pollution associated with PFAS manufacturing plants and the substances' links to serious health problems. Despite these concerns, PFAS manufacturers argue their products are essential for semiconductor production, and finding alternatives without PFAS for certain applications remains a significant challenge.

title: How to Buy Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO)
summary: This guide details how to invest in the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO), one of the largest and most popular ETFs, known for its low expense ratio (0.03%) and its goal to match the S&P 500 index returns. It covers VOO's holdings, reasons to invest or not invest, its dividend payments, and historical performance. The article also provides a step-by-step guide to buying shares through a brokerage account.

title: Meta Losing AI Spending War To Google, Microsoft, Warns 'Big Short' Investor Steve Eisman
summary: Steve Eisman, the investor known for predicting the 2008 collapse, warns that Meta Platforms Inc. is losing the AI spending war against Alphabet Inc.'s Google and Microsoft Corp. He attributes this to Meta's lack of a cloud business, which prevents it from generating revenue from its AI investments unlike Google and Microsoft, whose cash reserves are increasing while Meta's is plummeting. Despite this, Eisman believes the massive spending from all three tech giants indicates the AI boom is far from over.

title: What Are Equal-Weight Index Funds?
summary: Equal-weight index funds hold assets in identical proportions, differing from cap-weighted funds that prioritize larger companies. While they offer benefits like reduced concentration risk and a value-minded approach, they tend to have higher expense ratios and can be more volatile. Despite underperforming cap-weighted funds in recent years due to the dominance of mega-cap tech stocks, equal-weighting can be attractive to investors concerned about over-concentration in large companies.

title: Investment Opportunities as AI, Robots Transform Labor
summary: The article discusses how AI and robotics are rapidly transforming global labor markets, presenting significant investment opportunities. It highlights that this transformation extends beyond manufacturing to service industries, requiring investors to understand the dynamic changes and gain exposure. Companies within the ROBO Global Robotics & Automation Index and ROBO Global Artificial Intelligence Index offer strategic exposure to this multi-decade investment theme with substantial return potential.

title: How AI Could Be Raising Your Energy Bill
summary: The accelerated growth of AI data centers is creating an unprecedented demand for power, risking a shift of infrastructure costs onto consumers through increased electricity rates. Research from Harvard Law School's Environmental and Energy Law Program highlights how special contracts between utilities and data centers lack transparency, leading to consumers subsidizing the development for trillion-dollar tech companies. Regulators and transparent processes are crucial to ensure tech giants pay their fair share, or alternative private energy parks could be developed to isolate data center costs.

title: Alliance Entertainment Launches Alliance Home Entertainment Division to Drive Future of Film and TV Distribution
summary: Alliance Entertainment has announced the formation of a new division, Alliance Home Entertainment, to centralize film and television distribution. This new division combines Mill Creek Entertainment, Distribution Solutions, and new strategic hires to better serve studios, retailers, and fans. The company aims to lead the evolution of physical and digital media by focusing on growth in legacy formats and expanding premium offerings, reinforcing its commitment to the home entertainment category.

title: AudioCodes Certified for Microsoft Teams Operator Connect: What Channel Partners Need to Know
summary: AudioCodes has been certified for Microsoft Teams Operator Connect (OCP), providing a streamlined path for channel partners and IT leaders to deploy Teams Phone services. This certification allows AudioCodes to offer a fully integrated PSTN service within Microsoft Teams, simplifying deployments by reducing infrastructure complexity and lengthy processes. The service is live in the US and Europe and empowers channel partners to offer competitive and efficient Teams voice solutions without significant overhead.

title: TOPT ETF: Historical Outperformance Can Continue (NYSEARCA:TOPT)
summary: The iShares Top 20 U.S. Stocks ETF (TOPT) provides concentrated exposure to the largest U.S. companies and has shown strong performance despite higher volatility. The author is bullish on TOPT's major holdings, believing the ETF is well-positioned to benefit from companies that leverage their scale. Consequently, the article rates TOPT as a Buy.

title: Microsoft announces quarterly dividend
summary: Microsoft Corp. announced that its board of directors declared a quarterly dividend of $0.83 per share, payable on September 11, 2025, to shareholders of record on August 21, 2025. The ex-dividend date will also be August 21, 2025. Microsoft (Nasdaq “MSFT”) emphasizes its commitment to AI-powered solutions to empower individuals and organizations globally.

title: The Future of Fandom: Why Esports and Gaming Are Outpacing Traditional Sports
summary: Traditional sports are struggling to retain younger audiences who are increasingly drawn to the interactive and digital-first experiences offered by esports and gaming. Esports and gaming provide scalable, globally accessible, and digitally monetizable models with higher fan engagement and recurring revenue streams compared to traditional sports. Investors can gain exposure to this growing sector through thematic ETFs like the VanEck Video Gaming and eSports ETF (ESPO).

title: This AI-Focused ETF Just Launched -- Here's What's Inside and Why It Matters
summary: Wedbush's Dan Ives has launched an AI-focused Exchange Traded Fund (ETF) called the Dan Ives Wedbush AI Revolution (NYSEMKT: IVES), which holds 30 stocks across various AI-related industries. The ETF aims to provide investors with exposure to traditional AI stocks, including several "Magnificent Seven" companies and other prominent AI players, focusing on themes and disruptive impact rather than valuation. With an expense ratio of 0.75%, the IVES ETF offers an actively managed option for investing in the AI boom.

title: Want AI Exposure? These 3 ETFs Offer Different Angles
summary: As earnings season concludes, the AI sector continues to show strong momentum with many companies surpassing expectations and issuing positive guidance for 2025 and beyond. Investors looking for exposure to this growing trend can consider three ETFs: Xtrackers Artificial Intelligence and Big Data ETF (XAIX) for mega-cap tech focus, Invesco AI and Next Gen Software ETF (IGPT) for aggressive growth in pure-play AI, and Global X Artificial Intelligence & Technology ETF (AIQ) for a diversified approach with a solid return history. These ETFs offer different investment angles for those seeking to capitalize on the continued growth in artificial intelligence.

title: Barclays to roll out Microsoft 365 Copilot to 100,000 colleagues, transforming employee experience
summary: Barclays Bank PLC and Microsoft Corp. announced that Barclays will implement Microsoft 365 Copilot for 100,000 employees globally. This integration will create a single AI agent within Barclays' productivity tool, offering enhanced employee self-service solutions, personalized content search, and a comprehensive agentic dashboard through Microsoft Viva. The initiative aims to improve productivity, simplify workflows, and transform the employee experience by leveraging AI.

title: Looking for Exposure to Salesforce Stock (NYSE:CRM)? Try These Two ETFs
summary: This article suggests two ETFs, iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (IGV) and First Trust Dow Jones Internet Index Fund (FDN), for investors looking to gain exposure to Salesforce (CRM) stock. Salesforce's growth is driven by its AI platform, cloud ecosystem, and strategic acquisitions, with strong demand for its products. Both ETFs offer diversified investment in the tech sector with significant holdings in CRM.

title: New IVES ETF Uses Dan Ives’ Research Framework
summary: Wedbush Fund Advisors has launched the Dan Ives Wedbush AI Revolution ETF (IVES), designed to offer long-term returns through a concentrated portfolio of AI companies. The ETF leverages the research framework of Dan Ives, Wedbush Securities' Managing Director and Global Head of Technology Research, to identify and invest in the top 30 companies driving AI innovation. IVES maintains a balanced portfolio, with no single company accounting for more than 6% of the overall weight, providing a diversified approach to AI exposure.

title: 2 Unstoppable ETFs for Growth Investors to Buy and Hold for Years
summary: This article highlights two ETFs for growth investors: the iShares Exponential Technologies ETF (NASDAQ: XT) and the Invesco QQQ Trust (NASDAQ: QQQ). The iShares ETF focuses on innovation leaders globally, offering broad exposure to growth stocks across various sectors, while the Invesco QQQ Trust tracks the top 100 non-financial stocks on the Nasdaq, with significant holdings in high-performing tech giants like Microsoft, Nvidia, and Apple, leading to strong past returns. Both are presented as long-term investment options for growth.

title: XOVR ETF Adds Anduril, Joining SpaceX to Offer Pre-IPO Access
summary: ERShares, through its XOVR ETF, has added Anduril Industries as a new private equity position, offering retail investors access to pre-IPO companies. This move follows previous investments in SpaceX and Klarna, with Anduril becoming the second-largest private holding for XOVR. The ETF aims to provide diversified, liquid access to high-growth public companies and elite pre-IPO firms, leveraging a proprietary research model to identify category-defining companies.

title: Docusign shares fall on billings outlook despite strong earnings
summary: Docusign's shares dropped over 17% despite strong fiscal Q1 2026 earnings, primarily due to a lowered full-year billings forecast. The company reported adjusted EPS of 90 cents and revenue of $763.7 million, both exceeding analyst expectations, and introduced new AI-powered product features like Iris and Workspaces to enhance agreement workflows. The slight downward adjustment in billings guidance, from $3.3 billion-$3.354 billion to $3.285 billion-$3.339 billion, raised investor concerns about future growth.

title: Constellation Brands Inc. Cl A stock outperforms competitors despite losses on the day
summary: Constellation Brands Inc. Cl A (STZ) stock experienced a 3.60% decline to $170.60, breaking a two-day winning streak, despite a generally poor trading session where the S&P 500 and Dow Jones also fell. The stock's performance still indicates outperformance compared to its competitors. This report uses world-class market data from Dow Jones and FactSet, partnered with Automated Insights.

title: Procter & Gamble to cut 7,000 jobs as part of broader restructuring
summary: Procter & Gamble plans to cut 7,000 jobs, or 15% of its non-manufacturing workforce, as part of a two-year restructuring program. This decision is influenced by slowing U.S. growth and increased costs from tariffs, which are projected to create a $600 million headwind in fiscal 2026. The company also expects to reevaluate its portfolio, restructure its supply chain, and incur up to $1.6 billion in noncore costs.

title: Plus, an AI-Based Virtual Driver Software Company Powering Factory-Built Autonomous Trucks, to Go Public via Merger with Churchill Capital Corp IX
summary: Plus, an AI-based virtual driver software company for autonomous trucks, announced its plan to go public via a merger with Churchill Capital Corp IX. The transaction is expected to provide up to $300 million in gross proceeds to fund Plus through the commercial launch of its SuperDrive-enabled, factory-built autonomous trucks in 2027, valuing Plus at $1.2 billion pre-money equity. This strategic move aims to address the $2 trillion trucking freight market by leveraging Physical AI and OEM partnerships with companies like TRATON GROUP, Hyundai, and IVECO.

title: Google cuts trust in Chunghwa Telecom's certificates: What's at stake for internet security chain?
summary: Google has decided to remove default trust for digital certificates issued by Chunghwa Telecom starting July 31, 2025, due to "longstanding patterns of compliance failures." This move, following Mozilla Firefox's earlier consideration of delisting, has significant implications for Chunghwa Telecom, which dominates Taiwan's market, and highlights broader issues in internet security and certificate authority governance. The article explores the function of digital certificates, why browsers can unilaterally delist CAs, and the potential fallout for businesses and users.

title: Alumni Spotlight: Kate Pytlewski
summary: This article spotlights Kate Pytlewski, VP, Deputy General Counsel at EPAM Systems, Inc., highlighting her career progression from an associate at Faegre Drinker to her current leadership role. She discusses the challenges and rewards of in-house counsel work, particularly navigating global crises, and reflects on her positive experiences and mentorship at Faegre Drinker. Pytlewski also shares her thoughts on artificial intelligence in the legal industry and her personal interests and future plans.

title: Should SPDR MSCI USA StrategicFactors ETF (QUS) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The article analyzes the SPDR MSCI USA StrategicFactors ETF (QUS), highlighting its suitability for investors seeking exposure to the Large Cap Blend segment of the US equity market. It details the ETF's low expense ratio, sector allocation (heavily in Information Technology), top holdings like Microsoft, Apple, and Meta, and its performance and risk profile. The article concludes that QUS is a good option for specific market exposure and suggests alternatives like SPY and VOO.

title: Is iShares MSCI ACWI Low Carbon Target ETF (CRBN) a Strong ETF Right Now?
summary: The article analyzes the iShares MSCI ACWI Low Carbon Target ETF (CRBN), highlighting its performance, risk profile, and smart beta strategy. It details the fund's expense ratio, top holdings, and year-to-date gains, concluding that it's a reasonable option for investors in the World ETFs segment. The article also suggests alternative ETFs for consideration.

title: Will the MAG 7 Stocks Continue to Lead the Stock Market?
summary: The article discusses the continued influence of the "Magnificent Seven" (MAG 7) stocks—Microsoft, NVIDIA, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, Meta Platforms, and Tesla—on the US stock market. It highlights their market capitalization leadership and their resilience following a market correction caused by tariff fears. The author suggests that the MAGS ETF offers a diversified way to invest in these leading technology companies and expects them to maintain their market leadership.

title: Better Dividend Growth ETF: Vanguard Dividend Appreciation ETF or iShares Core Dividend Growth ETF
summary: This article compares two prominent dividend growth ETFs: the Vanguard Dividend Appreciation ETF (VIG) and the iShares Core Dividend Growth ETF (DGRO). It details their different index tracking methodologies, top holdings, expense ratios, and historical performance to help investors decide which fund is better suited for their dividend growth strategy. While DGRO offers a slightly higher yield, VIG boasts a lower expense ratio, making both solid options depending on investor priorities.

title: Nosso Relatório de Sustentabilidade Ambiental 2025
summary: Microsoft has released its 2025 Environmental Sustainability Report, detailing progress toward its ambitious 2030 goals of being carbon negative, water positive, zero waste, and protecting ecosystems. Despite growth-related increases in total emissions, particularly from AI and cloud expansion, the report highlights significant advancements in renewable energy contracts, datacenter innovations, carbon removal initiatives, and operational efficiencies. Microsoft emphasizes its commitment to integrating sustainability into all business aspects, empowering customers, and fostering global partnerships to accelerate climate solutions.

title: A envergadura de TI do JPMorgan Chase & Co.
summary: Darrin Alves, CIO de plataformas de infraestrutura do JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPMC), detalha a estratégia de TI do banco, que combina data centers corporativos robustos com uma abordagem multinuvem e híbrida. A empresa, um gigante bancário, visa resiliência e eficiência, tendo superado a meta de mover uma grande porcentagem de seus dados e aplicações para a nuvem. Apesar dos investimentos significativos em tecnologia, o JPMC mantém e otimiza seus data centers on-premise, priorizando segurança e conformidade regulatória.

title: C3 AI Announces Record Fiscal Fourth Quarter and Full Fiscal Year 2025 Financial Results
summary: C3 AI announced record financial results for its fiscal fourth quarter and full fiscal year 2025, with revenue growth of 26% and 25% year-over-year, respectively. The company highlighted significant milestones including renewed and expanded strategic alliances with partners like Baker Hughes and Microsoft, and substantial growth in its C3 Generative AI business and Federal sector agreements. C3 AI also provided its financial outlook for Q1 and full fiscal year 2026, anticipating continued growth.

title: Salesforce to acquire Informatica for $8bn to advance AI data capabilities
summary: Salesforce plans to acquire cloud data management company Informatica for approximately $8 billion, paying $25 cash per share. This acquisition aims to significantly strengthen Salesforce's data foundation, crucial for developing and deploying advanced agentic AI solutions by integrating Informatica's data management capabilities. The deal is expected to enhance Salesforce's Data Cloud, Agentforce, and Customer 360 platforms, creating a more unified and intelligent data architecture to support scalable and responsible AI applications across enterprises.

title: REX Financial launches covered call Nvidia ETF hours before earnings release
summary: REX Financial has launched the REX NVDA Growth & Income ETF, a single-stock exchange-traded fund tied to Nvidia, just hours before Nvidia's earnings release. This covered call ETF uses option strategies to generate income and offers investors exposure to a portion of Nvidia's stock price upside, aiming to provide a balance of growth and income. The move targets self-directed individual investors seeking alternative income-generating products.

title: Sonata Software and Qualtrics Partner to Transform Customer Experience for Global Brands
summary: Sonata Software and Qualtrics have formed a strategic partnership to provide a comprehensive, technology-driven customer experience management solution for global enterprises. This collaboration combines Qualtrics' XM for Customer Experience™ suite with Sonata Software's integration services and Sonata CX's consulting and implementation capabilities. The goal is to help businesses meet evolving customer expectations, deliver hyper-personalized experiences, and enhance operational efficiency through a fusion of technology, insight, and execution across all digital and physical touchpoints.

title: Guild in M&A talks with Bayview Asset Management
summary: Guild Holdings Company and Bayview Asset Management are engaged in M&A talks, exploring various options including a significant minority investment or a full merger. Bayview, which already owns 7.3% of Guild's Class A common stock, initiated these discussions. The potential transaction would involve due diligence and board approval, while Guild recently reported a net loss of $23.9 million in Q1 and a servicing portfolio of $94.0 billion.

title: Surging Data Center Growth to Help Lower Energy Costs for PG&E Customers
summary: PG&E anticipates that the significant growth in data center electricity demand, projected to reach 8.7 GW over the next decade, will actually help lower energy costs for its existing customers. The company estimates that for every 1 GW of new data center demand, residential monthly electric bills could decrease by 1-2% due to better utilization of existing infrastructure and spreading costs over more consumption. PG&E is actively working on numerous data center projects, particularly in Silicon Valley and the Bay Area, and is conducting further studies across California to accommodate future growth and integrate these large loads efficiently.

title: CoStar Group breaks ground with Azure AI Foundry and GPT-4o Realtime API audio models
summary: CoStar Group is revolutionizing the online home search experience by developing a conversational AI search solution with Azure OpenAI and the Mistral model in Azure AI Foundry Models. This innovative approach aims to replicate the nuanced conversations buyers have with human real estate agents, leveraging CoStar's extensive proprietary data. The solution utilizes the GPT-4o Realtime API audio models for low-latency performance, offering a secure, scalable, and intuitive way for millions of users to find homes globally.

title: CISA Warns of Attacks Targeting Commvault SaaS Environment
summary: CISA has issued a warning regarding attacks targeting Commvault's Metallic SaaS service, where a threat actor gained unauthorized access to a small number of customers' Microsoft 365 environments. The attacks exploited a zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2025-3928) in Commvault's webserver and are believed to be part of a broader campaign targeting cloud application configurations. Organizations using Metallic are advised to prioritize protecting M365 credentials managed within the service and implement mitigation measures.

title: Oracle Corporation (ORCL) Plans $40 Billion Nvidia Chip Purchase for OpenAI Data Center Project, FT Says
summary: Oracle Corporation (ORCL) is reportedly planning to spend approximately $40 billion on Nvidia's GB200 chips to support OpenAI's new data center in Abilene, Texas, as part of the US Stargate Project. This initiative aims to bolster the nation's AI capabilities and reduce OpenAI's dependency on Microsoft's computing resources. The data center is expected to be operational by mid-2026, with Oracle leasing the computing power to OpenAI.

title: Arqit Quantum Inc. Announces Financial Results for First Half of Fiscal Year 2025
summary: Arqit Quantum Inc. announced its financial results for the first half of fiscal year 2025, reporting $67,000 in revenue. This figure was adversely affected by end customer delays, though the company expects a previously signed multi-year government contract to generate seven figures in annual recurring revenue. Arqit also highlighted significant recent developments, including new contracts with the U.S. DoD and a Tier 1 network operator, and collaborations with Intel on quantum-safe solutions.

title: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT): Our Calculation of Intrinsic Value
summary: This article provides a discounted cash flow (DCF) analysis for Microsoft (MSFT) to calculate its intrinsic value. The analysis concludes that Microsoft is significantly overvalued at its current market price, with an estimated intrinsic value of $228.64 per share compared to a current price of $452.27, resulting in a negative margin of safety of -49.5%. Investors are advised to consider whether the stock's premium is justified by long-term dominance and future growth.

title: Should iShares Russell 1000 ETF (IWB) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The iShares Russell 1000 ETF (IWB), launched in 2000 by Blackrock, offers broad exposure to the Large Cap Blend segment of the US equity market with over $40 billion in assets. With an annual operating expense of 0.15% and a 1.12% trailing dividend yield, it is considered a cost-effective option for investors. IWB has a Zacks ETF Rank of 2 (Buy) and effectively diversifies company-specific risk with approximately 1011 holdings, making it a medium-risk choice for investors.

title: Manhattan Associates Launches Cloud-Native Solution for Existing ERP Environments
summary: Manhattan Associates has launched Enterprise Promise & Fulfill, a new cloud-native solution designed to enhance existing ERP systems with advanced order management capabilities. This solution aims to improve inventory visibility, intelligent order promising, and fulfillment optimization for B2B fulfillment without requiring a complete ERP overhaul. It addresses challenges like limited inventory visibility and fragmented order orchestration, offering scalability and seamless integration with current systems.

title: Meta to buy 200 MW of wind energy from TransAlta as it expands footprint
summary: Meta has signed a long-term agreement to purchase 200 MW of wind energy and environmental attributes from TransAlta's Horizon Hill Wind Power Project in Oklahoma. This deal supports Meta's goal of powering global operations solely with wind and solar energy as its footprint expands. The project, expected to cost between US$290 million and US$310 million, contributes to TransAlta's goal of adding 2 GW of renewables by 2025.

title: Stock Of The Day Quanta Services Near Buy Point As Energy Appetite Expands Backlog
summary: Quanta Services is highlighted as the Stock Of The Day, nearing a buy point with a handle valid after Tuesday at $348.42. The company's backlog is expanding significantly due to the AI-spurred demand for power projects, leading to a strong Composite Rating of 97/99. Several heavy construction stocks, including Quanta Services, are seeing increased activity and approaching buy zones amidst this energy appetite.

title: Is iShares Paris-Aligned Climate MSCI USA ETF (PABU) a Strong ETF Right Now?
summary: The iShares Paris-Aligned Climate MSCI USA ETF (PABU), launched on April 8, 2022, is a smart beta ETF focused on the Style Box - All Cap Blend category, aiming to align with Paris Agreement objectives through decarbonization and reduced climate-related risks. With over $2.12 billion in assets and a low expense ratio of 0.10%, PABU primarily invests in Information Technology, with Apple, Nvidia, and Microsoft as top holdings. The ETF has shown strong performance, up 13.72% over the last year, offering a diversified option for investors in climate-aligned strategies.

title: Expedia Group Expands B2B Platform and Launches GenAI Partnerships to Enhance Travel Discovery
summary: Expedia Group is expanding its B2B technology platform with new APIs for car, activities, insurance, and air, enabling end-to-end trip packaging and aiming to save hotels significant operational costs with a new Reservation Management API. The company is also launching GenAI-powered discovery experiences like Expedia Trip Matching for personalized recommendations from Instagram reels, and enhancing its AI Agent on Hotels.com for intuitive trip planning, further expanding its reach through integrations with OpenAI Operator and Microsoft Copilot Actions. These initiatives are designed to foster partner growth, improve traveler engagement, and modernize travel discovery.

title: Introducing NLWeb: Bringing conversational interfaces directly to the web - Source
summary: Microsoft has launched NLWeb, an open project designed to enable natural language interfaces for websites, effectively turning them into AI-powered applications. This initiative aims to simplify how users interact with website content using natural language queries, similar to AI assistants. NLWeb leverages existing web data formats and LLM-powered tools to create richer user experiences and empower web publishers to participate in the emerging agentic web.

title: ESG Investing, Explained: 10 Top Socially Responsible Stocks
summary: The article explains ESG investing and provides a list of 10 top socially responsible stocks for beginners. It highlights companies like Microsoft, Levi Strauss, Teladoc Health, Home Depot, NextEra Energy, Intuit, and NVIDIA, along with ESG-focused index funds and ETFs, detailing their commitment to environmental, social, and governance factors. This guide aims to help new investors build an ESG-based portfolio with diversified and ethical choices.

title: The Best ETFs for Tech Stock Investors | Morningstar Europe
summary: The technology sector experienced a recovery in early 2025 following a challenging start, driven by positive earnings and a China trade deal. Morningstar identifies seven highly-rated ETFs, including offerings from Xtrackers, iShares, SPDR, and Amundi, that provide investors with exposure to this rebounding sector. These ETFs are highlighted for their potential to outperform, with detailed performance metrics provided for the largest strategies.

title: 🦾 The Investing Case For Automation And Robotics Stocks
summary: This article explores the investment case for automation and robotics stocks, highlighting the convergence of AI, IoT, and falling costs as key tailwinds driving demand amidst labor shortages and the quest for efficiency. It breaks down the industry into seven segments, from industrial automation to humanoid robots, and provides guidance on how investors can find opportunities in this diverse sector, while also cautioning about the capital-intensive nature and potential for over-hype in some areas.
authors: Richard Bowman, Michael Paige, Bailey Pemberton

title: A Balanced Approach to U.S. Equity Through GARP
summary: The article highlights the Barron’s 400 ETF (BFOR) as an alternative to market-cap-weighted benchmarks, offering a Growth at a Reasonable Price (GARP) methodology. BFOR tracks an equally weighted index of 400 U.S. companies chosen based on fundamental indicators, ensuring diversification and avoiding concentration in mega-cap tech stocks. The fund's balanced approach, semi-annual rebalancing, and sector capping aim for robust performance across market cycles despite potential short-term volatility due to its tilt towards smaller and mid-sized companies.

title: From Costco to Hinge, corporate storytelling is heading back to print
summary: Major U.S. companies like Microsoft, Hinge, and Costco are investing in print magazines to tell their corporate stories, enhance their reputation, and engage with specific audiences. This trend represents a strategic return to analog storytelling, combining marketing with corporate communication to reach hard-to-reach demographics.

title: How AGIX and KWEB Provide Access To The Distinct U.S. & China AI Ecosystems
summary: The article discusses how combining AGIX and KWEB ETFs offers a blended approach to investing in the global AI opportunity by accessing both the U.S. and China AI ecosystems. It highlights the distinct characteristics and developments within each region's AI landscape, from the U.S.'s rapid innovation spurred by ChatGPT to China's cost-effective, open-source models exemplified by DeepSeek. The piece concludes that a combined portfolio effectively harnesses the long-term growth potential of the AI sector by leveraging the complementary strengths of both countries.

title: Here’s Why Every Investor Should Consider Vanguard’s VIG ETF
summary: The Vanguard Dividend Appreciation ETF (VIG) is a compelling investment for stability, growth, and income, especially in volatile markets. Launched in 2006, VIG tracks the S&P U.S. Dividend Growers Index, holding 338 stocks of companies with a decade-long record of dividend increases, excluding high-yield stocks to avoid yield traps. With a low expense ratio of 0.05% and strong performance, VIG offers a diversified, low-cost, and resilient option for investors seeking long-term financial success through dividend growth.

title: Churchill Capital to Acquire Skillsoft and Global Knowledge
summary: Churchill Capital Corp II is set to merge with Skillsoft in a $1.3 billion transaction, and the combined company will then acquire Global Knowledge for an additional $233 million, bringing the total deal to $1.5 billion. The new entity, operating as Skillsoft, will be listed on the New York Stock Exchange and aims to become the leading digital learning company globally. This acquisition will expand its course portfolio and client base, including over 70% of Fortune 1000 companies, to address the growing demand for digital learning and workforce upskilling.

title: Is SPDR MSCI USA StrategicFactors ETF (QUS) a Strong ETF Right Now?
summary: The SPDR MSCI USA StrategicFactors ETF (QUS), launched on April 15, 2015, offers exposure to the Style Box - Large Cap Blend category with a smart beta strategy. Managed by State Street Global Advisors, it has over $1.49 billion in assets and seeks to match the performance of the MSCI USA Factor Mix A-Series Index, with an expense ratio of 0.15%. The ETF's top holdings include Apple Inc., Microsoft Corp, and Meta Platforms Inc., and it has shown strong performance, adding 2.29% year-to-date and 11.24% over the last 12 months as of May 13, 2025.

title: Microsoft Earnings Reaffirm Strength in Cloud Computing, AI
summary: Microsoft's strong Q1 earnings, particularly the Azure cloud computing service exceeding revenue expectations by topping 33%, indicate ongoing strength in both cloud computing and AI sectors. This performance is seen as a significant win for Microsoft, bolstering its position among its Magnificent Seven peers and highlighting the increasing demand for AI services and cloud infrastructure. The article suggests that traders can leverage this trend through specific leveraged ETFs for Microsoft, cloud computing, and AI.

title: Wynn Resorts, Microsoft, Palantir And A Health Care Stock On CNBC's 'Final Trades'
summary: CNBC's "Halftime Report Final Trades" featured picks for Wynn Resorts, Vertex Pharmaceuticals, Palantir Technologies, and Microsoft. Wynn Resorts and Vertex Pharmaceuticals both missed analyst consensus estimates for their recent quarterly earnings and sales. Palantir Technologies reported impressive earnings with strong revenue growth, while Microsoft also exceeded financial expectations and issued strong guidance.

title: Cineverse Acquires U.S. Rights for Return to Silent Hill, The Newest Installment in the popular Video Game Horror Film Franchise from Davis Films
