summary: Cineverse has acquired the U.S. rights for "Return to Silent Hill," the latest film in the horror franchise based on the KONAMI video game series. The movie, which is a faithful adaptation of "Silent Hill 2," stars Jeremy Irvine and Hannah Emily Anderson, and brings back original director Christophe Gans and composer Akira Yamaoka. A wide theatrical release date will be announced soon for this psychological horror experience.

title: INPEX Digitalization: Windows 11 boosts operational efficiency, MDM, and security
summary: INPEX Corporation implemented Windows 11 with Windows Autopilot and Microsoft Intune to enhance operational efficiency, security, and device management, transitioning 2,000 computers by early 2024. The energy company also established an internal team, AIR, to promote generative AI, deploying Microsoft 365 Copilot for 650 users and planning further expansion to transform work styles and boost productivity. This digital transformation supports INPEX's goals of a stable low-carbon energy supply and a responsible energy transition.

title: Winning the AI race: Strengthening U.S. capabilities in computing and innovation
summary: Brad Smith, Vice Chair and President of Microsoft, testified before the Senate Commerce Committee on the critical issue of artificial intelligence, emphasizing three strategic priorities for the U.S. to win the AI race: innovation, diffusion, and exporting AI to allies. He highlighted the need for federal support in expanding datacenters and electrical grids, training a skilled AI workforce, and investing in research and development. The article stresses that winning the AI race requires a robust ecosystem including both private sector efforts and government policies, focusing on both technological advancement and widespread adoption of AI across all sectors.

title: Kellanova Chief Data & Analytics Officer: Collaboration Is Key to Success
summary: Loretta Franks, Kellanova's Chief Data & Analytics Officer, emphasizes that collaboration and adaptability are crucial for traditional companies to thrive. She highlights how Kellanova leverages data, GenAI capabilities like Microsoft Copilot, and personalized consumer experiences such as Pringles Poptopia to stay relevant and make data-driven decisions. The company's "culture of best," focusing on integrity, accountability, and courage, underpins its agile approach and continuous improvement.

title: Google's parent company Alphabet shares plunge over 8% amid AI search competition, malware threats
summary: Alphabet Inc. shares dropped over 8% following revelations from an antitrust trial, citing increased AI search competition and new malware threats. Apple executive Eddy Cue testified about declining Google search traffic due to AI alternatives and announced future AI choices in Safari. Google also disclosed a new malware strain, LOSTKEYS, linked to a Russian hacking group, and partnered with Elementl Power to build nuclear plants to power AI data centers, addressing the anticipated surge in electricity usage.

title: The Honest Company Announces Appointment of Curtiss Bruce as Chief Financial Officer
summary: The Honest Company (NASDAQ: HNST) announced the appointment of Curtiss Bruce as its new Chief Financial Officer, effective June 2, 2025. Bruce brings over 30 years of experience in the consumer products sector, previously serving as SVP, Corporate Financial Planning and Analysis and Investor Relations at Hain Celestial Group. He will lead the Finance, Accounting, and Investor Relations organizations and work to strategically execute the Company’s Transformation Pillars.

title: Arista Networks beats expectations in its latest results, but stock moves lower
summary: Arista Networks reported strong first-quarter earnings and revenue, surpassing analyst expectations. Despite beating targets and seeing increased AI spending from key customers, the company's stock fell almost 4% after it warned of a sequential decline in gross and operating margins for the current quarter, disappointing investors. The company's board also approved an additional $1.5 billion in share repurchases.

title: As Investors Brace for Volatility, Look to Dividend ETF FDVV
summary: Given current market uncertainties like sticky inflation, high interest rates, and geopolitical tensions, many investors anticipate continued volatility. Dividend ETFs, such as the Fidelity High Dividend ETF (FDVV), offer a potential solution for stability and income generation. FDVV invests in large- and mid-cap dividend-paying companies and can provide diversification benefits, offering a consistent revenue stream that can help offset market volatility.

title: Johnson Controls rethinks IT for the cloud-native and AI era
summary: Johnson Controls, a $47 billion building products and services company, is undergoing a significant IT transformation to build in-house capabilities for the cloud-native and AI era. CDIO Vijay Sankaran is leading this shift after years of relying on technology partners, focusing on optimizing internal IT operations, leveraging AI with Microsoft OpenAI Azure, and streamlining complex ERP systems. The company is already seeing productivity gains from generative AI applications deployed for field technicians and customers.

title: Star Tribune - Earnings To Watch: L.B. Foster (FSTR) Reports Q1 Results Tomorrow
summary: L.B. Foster (NASDAQ: FSTR) is set to announce its Q1 earnings before market hours tomorrow. Analysts anticipate an 8% year-on-year revenue decline to $114.4 million and adjusted earnings of $0.03 per share, following a previous quarter where the company missed revenue, EBITDA, and EPS estimates. Despite past misses, analysts have reconfirmed their estimates, and the stock has seen positive sentiment in the general industrial machinery segment, with shares up 10.7% over the last month.

title: 3 Reasons Every Investor Should Own Fidelity’s FTEC ETF
summary: The article advocates for investors to own Fidelity's FTEC ETF due to its diversified exposure to the information technology sector, significant growth potential, and stability derived from its broad diversification. FTEC offers immediate access to major tech firms, boasts 143% returns over five years, and maintains a moderate expense ratio and volatility compared to the S&P 500. Its portfolio of 283 stocks helps mitigate risks associated with individual company performance.

title: FPT Software pioneers AI adoption with Microsoft 365 Copilot to increase customer engagement and leads
summary: FPT Software has successfully integrated Microsoft 365 Copilot across its back-end services to enhance efficiency, equip its workforce with AI skills, and improve customer engagement. This adoption led to an eightfold increase in engagement on revised website sections and a 3.5 times rise in lead conversion. The company plans to further scale AI adoption, particularly in software development, to boost productivity and empower its workforce.

title: Chunghwa Telecom seeking further satellite deals – report
summary: Chunghwa Telecom is actively pursuing additional satellite partnerships to bolster its capacity and network resilience, engaging in discussions with Amazon's Project Kuiper and Canada's Telesat. This move follows previous agreements with OneWeb and Astranis, and comes as the Taiwanese telco aims to diversify international capacity after incidents involving offshore cables and faces delays in cable infrastructure projects. The company has ruled out a partnership with Starlink due to "regulatory restrictions" and security concerns related to Elon Musk's ties to China.

title: O’Reilly Automotive, Inc. (ORLY): Among Charles Akre’s and John Neff’s Stock Picks With Huge Upside Potential
summary: This article highlights O’Reilly Automotive, Inc. (ORLY) as a key holding in Charles Akre’s and John Neff’s portfolios, emphasizing its significant upside potential. It discusses Akre Capital Management's investment philosophy, focusing on high-quality growth stocks, and details ORLY's strong market position, consistent sales growth, and future expansion plans, noting its 9th rank on a list of high-potential stock picks from Akre Capital.

title: iShares Core Dividend Growth ETF (NYSEARCA:DGRO) Trades at $59.20 as Investors Flock to Reliable Income
summary: The iShares Core Dividend Growth ETF (DGRO) is trading at $59.20, down almost 4% year-to-date, but offers a defensive tilt with a 0.08% expense ratio and a 2.3% trailing yield. Its composition in Financials, Healthcare, and Consumer Staples, along with a forward P/E of 17.5x, positions it as a hedge against market volatility. With institutional inflows and a modest undervaluation, the article suggests accumulating DGRO for a 12-month target of $65.

title: These 3 Funds Offer Sky-High Yields of 15% or More and Trade at a Discount
summary: This article identifies three closed-end funds (CEFs) that offer exceptionally high distribution yields of 15% or more and trade at a discount to their net asset value. These funds are abrdn Life Sciences Investors, BlackRock Capital Allocation Term Trust, and BlackRock Science and Technology Term Trust. While attractive for their high yields, the article cautions that these funds' returns often do not fully cover their large distributions, potentially leading to a decline in net asset value over time.

title: FY25 Q3 - Press Releases - Investor Relations
summary: Microsoft reported strong third-quarter results for fiscal year 2025, driven by significant growth in its Cloud and AI services. The company achieved $70.1 billion in revenue, a 13% increase, with operating income rising by 16% to $32.0 billion and net income up 18% to $25.8 billion. Diluted earnings per share reached $3.46, reflecting continued demand for Microsoft's differentiated cloud offerings.

title: Socket Mobile Introduces World's Smallest, Most Affordable Direct Part Mark (DPM) Barcode Scanner
summary: Socket Mobile, Inc. has launched the DuraScan D764, heralded as the smallest, lightest, and most affordable Direct Part Mark (DPM) barcode scanner on the market, designed for precise traceability across various industries. This new device excels at reading DPM codes on challenging surfaces and also scans standard 1D and 2D barcodes, providing a versatile, mobile, and cost-effective solution for inventory management and asset tracking. The D764 seamlessly integrates with iOS and other Bluetooth-enabled mobile devices through Socket Mobile's CaptureSDK, offering high-performance scanning without the need for cumbersome cables.

title: PayPal Brings Together Developers, AI Leaders to Power Agentic Commerce at Dev Days
summary: PayPal is leading the agentic commerce revolution, providing developers and merchants with innovative AI tools to create next-generation shopping experiences. The company is hosting Dev Days, collaborating with AI leaders like Amazon Web Services, Anthropic, Google Cloud, and Microsoft, to demonstrate the power of agentic experiences. PayPal's goal is to enable AI agents to transact on behalf of customers and businesses, providing secure and efficient commerce operations.

title: How cloud technology and storage are helping power AI
summary: This article explains how cloud computing and data storage are fundamental to the advancement of artificial intelligence (AI), providing the necessary scalability and data processing capabilities. It highlights key companies within the Invesco QQQ ETF, such as Microsoft, Amazon, Alphabet, and Micron Technology, that are leading innovations in cloud and storage solutions for AI. The piece concludes by emphasizing the deepening relationship between AI and cloud technology, and their increasing demand for greater infrastructure and storage capacity in the future.

title: NTNX Stock Price, News & Analysis
summary: Nutanix, Inc. (NASDAQ: NTNX) operates in the information sector as a software publisher focused on hybrid multicloud computing, offering a unified, cloud software platform for running applications and AI and managing data across different environments. The company emphasizes its Nutanix Cloud Platform (NCP) designed to support hybrid multicloud infrastructure, including deployments in core data centers, at the edge, and in public clouds with a consistent operating model. Nutanix highlights its subscription-based business model, global customer base, and focus on AI, security, and compliance, with offerings like Nutanix Kubernetes Platform (NKP) and Nutanix Enterprise AI (NAI).

title: AVPT Stock Price, News & Analysis | Avepoint
summary: AvePoint, Inc. (AVPT) specializes in data security, governance, and resilience for organizations utilizing SaaS and cloud collaboration platforms, offering its "Confidence Platform" to manage and protect critical data across various environments like Microsoft, Google, and Salesforce. The company is particularly focused on AI governance, including agentic AI systems, with solutions like the AgentPulse Command Center to track and manage AI agents. AvePoint emphasizes its multi-SaaS and multi-cloud data protection capabilities and operates a global channel partner program, with its shares dual-listed on Nasdaq and the Singapore Exchange.

title: Why Fidelity’s Dividend ETF (FDVV) Is a Safe Haven in Today’s Market
summary: The Fidelity High Dividend ETF (FDVV) offers investors a blend of safety and income through exposure to diversified large-cap dividend-paying businesses. Its significant yield of 3.28% and relative resilience make it attractive for those seeking compounding opportunities and portfolio growth, especially in uncertain economic times. With a low expense ratio of 0.16%, FDVV provides a cost-effective way to invest in established companies that can withstand market volatility.

title: How food manufacturers are embracing AI to forecast trends and navigate regulatory hurdles
summary: Food manufacturers like Kellanova and Ingredion are increasingly using AI for product development, quality assurance, and supply chain management. This technology helps them navigate regulatory hurdles, forecast consumer trends, and adapt quickly to market disruptions. AI platforms, including those from Tastewise, provide insights into ingredient substitutions and consumer preferences, enabling companies to stay competitive and efficient.

title: Lobbying Update: $40,000 of QUALCOMM INC. lobbying was just disclosed
summary: A recent disclosure revealed that QUALCOMM INC. spent $40,000 on lobbying in Q1 2025, focusing on trade, telecommunications, and the U.S. semiconductor industrial base. The article also details recent congressional and insider trading activity in QCOM stock, along with hedge fund movements, analyst ratings, and price targets for the company.

title: Microsoft Data Center Approved by San Jose Planning Commission
summary: The San Jose Planning Commission has approved a proposal by Microsoft Corporation for a new data center at 1657 Alviso Way. This project involves constructing two single-story data center buildings totaling 397,205 square feet, including office space, a new electrical substation, and a reconstructed visitor center. The development, which faced previous delays, signifies a continuing trend of data center construction in the South Bay area.

title: 2 Penny Stocks With $10 Potential
summary: This article highlights two penny stocks, KORE Group Holdings (KORE) and Banzai International (BNZI), that are positioned for significant growth due to their involvement in the AI service industry and IoT sector, respectively. KORE is an IoT services provider seeing a resurgence in growth and institutional interest, while Banzai International, specializing in web-based event platforms, is considered a ripe takeover target. Both companies are expected to achieve substantial growth, with analysts projecting significant upside for BNZI.

title: Don’t Miss KCSH in the Flight to Ultra-Short Bonds
summary: The article highlights the KraneShares Sustainable Ultra Short Duration Index ETF (KCSH) as a diversification option for investors amidst market volatility caused by shifting U.S. tariff policies and a flight to safety in ultra-short bonds. KCSH tracks investment-grade corporate bonds with maturities up to one year and offers a diversified portfolio with lower interest rate and credit risk. The ETF aims to provide stability and income in a climate of uncertainty for equities and longer-duration bonds.

title: 60 days to launch: Coca-Cola reaches millions with immersive campaign built on Azure
summary: Coca-Cola leveraged Microsoft Azure, particularly Azure AI Foundry and Azure AI Speech, to launch an immersive holiday campaign in just 60 days. This campaign featured a custom AI Santa model that conversed in real-time with over a million people in 26 languages, successfully enhancing emotional connections and brand loyalty across 43 markets. The initiative highlighted Azure's robust capabilities for scalability, multilingual support, and secure, AI-powered marketing campaigns.

title: Laminated Labels Market to Get an Explosive Growth| Avery
summary: The Laminated Labels market is projected for explosive growth, expected to reach USD 132.99 billion by 2032 from USD 95.08 billion in 2025, with a CAGR of 4.9%. This report provides insights into market trends, drivers, and the strategies of key players like Avery Dennison Corporation, Coveris Holdings S.A., and CCL Label Inc. It segments the market by product type, application, end-user, and region, offering a comprehensive overview for businesses aiming for market dominance.

title: Criteo Announces Changes to its Board of Directors
summary: Criteo S.A. announced changes to its Board of Directors, naming Frederik van der Kooi as the new Chairperson, succeeding Rachel Picard who will remain a director. The company also nominated Stefanie Jay for election as a new independent director at its 2025 Annual General Meeting. Additionally, Hubert de Pesquidoux will not stand for re-election, which, with Jay’s election, will result in an eight-director board with seven independent members.

title: Absolute Application Resilience
summary: Absolute Application Resilience ensures that critical security and business applications remain healthy and effective by monitoring and automatically remediating their performance. It provides visibility into application efficacy, instantly repairs app failures through automation, and helps maintain end-user experience by monitoring business and productivity apps. This solution supports over 80 commonly used security apps and tracks over 2000 business and productivity apps, helping organizations stay compliant and reduce IT helpdesk strain.

title: Technology Alliances
summary: Absolute Software offers "Technology Alliances" that integrate its self-healing security solutions with leading cybersecurity and IT platforms. These alliances aim to ensure applications remain operational, protected, and secure by leveraging Absolute's Application Resilience and Persistence Technology to counter security gaps and software vulnerabilities. Partners benefit from enhanced security offerings, continuous protection against cyber threats, and seamless integration capabilities.

title: FYAI: How agents will transform business and daily work | The Microsoft Cloud Blog
summary: This article discusses the transformative potential of AI agents in business and daily life, drawing parallels to historical technological advancements. Charles Lamanna, Corporate Vice President of Business and Industry Copilot at Microsoft, explains how AI agents are moving from being "add-ons" to core drivers of business, enabling new levels of efficiency and scale. The piece highlights real-world examples from companies like Estée Lauder, Dow, and Microsoft, and envisions a future where agents handle routine tasks, freeing up individuals for more meaningful activities.

title: Microsoft announces quarterly earnings release date
summary: Microsoft Corporation has announced that it will release its fiscal year 2025 third-quarter financial results after the market closes on Wednesday, April 30, 2025. The results will be available on the Microsoft Investor Relations website, with a live webcast of the earnings conference call scheduled for 2:30 p.m. Pacific Time. The company, known for its AI-powered platforms and tools, reiterated its mission to empower individuals and organizations globally.

title: HP imprime forte investimento no Brasil. Saiba o papel do País na evolução da companhia
summary: HP is making significant investments in Brazil, leveraging the country's operation as fundamental for its global business, which had a revenue of US$53.6 billion. The company's evolution in Brazil is driven by the adoption of AI in products, a strong focus on sustainability, and an increase in exports from local factories. Brazil plays a strategic role in HP's global supply chain and has shown double-digit growth in PC and printer sales, surpassing global averages.

title: Bookworm: This ASX name meets many of Terry Smith’s criteria
summary: This article examines Terry Smith's criteria for a quality business, focusing on five key tenets: high return on operating capital, growth potential, intangible and difficult-to-replicate assets, resilience, and lack of reliance on leverage. The author then applies these criteria to the ASX company Cochlear (ASX: COH), highlighting how it aligns with many of Smith's principles despite being considered overvalued by analysts. The piece concludes by reinforcing Smith's investment philosophy of investing in good companies, not overpaying, and holding for the long term.

title: Growth or Bubble? Decoding the Rapid Rise of CXAI Stock
summary: CXApp Inc. (CXAI) stock is experiencing a significant rise, up 32.54%, driven by positive market sentiment and strategic advancements including the appointment of Terry Blanchard as SVP of Engineering. The company faces financial challenges, as shown by its Q3 2024 operating revenue of $1.897M against $5.223M in total expenses, but maintains a strong gross margin of 80.9%. The market awaits its rescheduled Q4 and FY24 earnings call for further insights into its AI-native platform and future trajectory.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: Klaviyo, Inc. (NYSE:KVYO) Shares Slammed 26% But Getting In Cheap Might Be Difficult Regardless
summary: Klaviyo Inc. (NYSE:KVYO) shares have recently dropped 26% in the last month, though they've shown a 14% gain over the past year. Despite the recent dip, the company's price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 8.1x remains high compared to the software industry average, suggesting strong market expectations for its future revenue growth. Analysts forecast a 22% annual revenue increase for Klaviyo over the next three years, outpacing the industry's projected 15% growth, which helps explain the elevated P/S ratio.

title: The state of AI at PMI
summary: Philip Morris International (PMI) is actively integrating AI into its operations, commencing significant deployment in 2024 with Microsoft Copilot. The company prioritizes a people-first approach, focusing on employee competence and confidence in AI through extensive training and a governance framework to manage risks and ensure responsible AI use. PMI aims to leverage AI for process optimization, content creation, knowledge management, and business growth, with plans to scale successful applications in 2025.

title: Rob Arnott on Deep Value and ‘Running Towards Lions’
summary: Rob Arnott, founder of Research Affiliates, discusses his deep-value NIXT ETF which invests in underperforming, deleted stocks, aiming to capitalize on their greater upside potential compared to frothy, expensive additions to indexes. He emphasizes the importance of diversification into cheap alternatives, even if uncomfortable, and views the financial advisor's role as guiding clients away from "stupid mistakes" like performance chasing.

title: Jim Cramer Says He’s ‘Concerned’ About Alphabet (GOOG) Amid AI Threat – ‘I Stopped Going to Google’
summary: Jim Cramer expresses concern about Alphabet (GOOG) due to the increasing threat of AI impacting its search business, stating he has stopped using Google. Despite these concerns, the article highlights Alphabet's strong performance in YouTube ad revenue and Cloud revenue, as well as its strategic investments in AI to maintain market dominance. The company's valuation also appears attractive compared to its sector average.

title: JFrog report finds AI growth driving new software supply chain threats
summary: A new report from JFrog Ltd. reveals that the expansion of AI technology is significantly increasing security threats across the software supply chain, coinciding with a rise in malicious AI models and vulnerabilities. The report identifies a "quad-fecta" of security issues, including CVEs, malicious packages, exposed secrets, and misconfigurations, while also highlighting inadequate binary scanning and ongoing issues with open-source security practices. Additionally, the proliferation of security tools is contributing to complexity, suggesting a need for more streamlined approaches to protection.

title: Expedia pursues agentic, generative AI with caution
summary: Expedia Group is cautiously integrating agentic and generative AI into its operations, balancing innovation with scalability and cost. The company has created an internal "playground" where employees can experiment with various AI models and agents, fostering engagement while adhering to responsible AI principles. Expedia sees AI as an accelerator for better experiences, growth, and operational efficiencies.

title: PIC makes investment decisions twice as fast using Microsoft 365 Copilot
summary: Public Investment Corporation (PIC), Africa’s largest asset management firm, significantly accelerated its investment decision-making process by integrating Microsoft 365 Copilot. This adoption has reduced the time for investment approvals from 12 to six months and drastically cut down the time spent on tasks like creating presentations and surveys. PIC achieved this through a structured change management strategy and is now looking to expand Copilot's use further across its organization.

title: Spectral AI (MDAI) Secures $17.7 Million to Launch Burn Wound AI System
summary: Spectral AI Inc. (MDAI) has secured $17.7 million in financing, including a $15 million debt facility and $2.7 million in equity, to accelerate the commercialization of its DeepView System. This AI-powered medical diagnostic tool aims to provide faster and more accurate wound care for burn patients. The company's goal is to launch the DeepView System in the U.S. market, improving patient outcomes and reducing healthcare costs.

title: CXApp Inc. (Nasdaq:CXAI) Announces the Appointment of Terry Blanchard as Senior Vice President of Engineering
summary: CXApp Inc. (Nasdaq:CXAI) has announced the appointment of Terry Blanchard as Senior Vice President of Engineering. Blanchard, with over 30 years of engineering leadership experience from companies like Apple, WhatsApp, and NVIDIA, will lead CXAI's global engineering organization and drive the development of next-generation AI technologies for workplace experiences. This strategic hire aims to accelerate CXAI's product roadmap and technical strategy, focusing on creating advanced Agentic AI solutions.

title: PTC Launches Codebeamer 3.0 to Boost Speed, Quality & Sustainability
summary: PTC has launched Codebeamer 3.0, an updated Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) solution designed to accelerate product development, improve sustainability, and ensure regulatory compliance through new features like a modern branching method and scaled working sets. This new version, building on PTC's acquisition of Intland Software, includes a Sustainability Template for eco-conscious design and enhanced traceability for safety-critical industries. The launch comes as PTC leverages AI innovations like Windchill AI and strategic collaborations to further boost its product lifecycle management.

title: Intermedia Named a Leader in the Aragon Research Globe™ for the Intelligent Contact Center for SMB, 2025
summary: Intermedia Cloud Communications has been recognized as a Leader in the Aragon Research Globe™ for the Intelligent Contact Center for SMB, 2025, for its innovative AI-powered solutions, Microsoft Teams integration, and unified communications offerings. The company aims to make enterprise-grade AI accessible to small and medium-sized businesses, enabling them to enhance customer engagement, streamline operations, and gain deeper business insights. Intermedia's SPARK AI suite, including Agent Assist and Sentiment Analysis, provides advanced tools for improving efficiency and customer experience.

title: CoreWeave Stock Treads Water After Scaled-Back IPO
summary: CoreWeave, an AI-focused cloud computing company, had a lukewarm IPO, with its stock ending the day at its IPO price of $40 per share, despite initial stumbling. The scaled-back IPO and initial trading performance raise questions about investor appetite for AI stocks amidst a broader tech slump and concerns about CoreWeave's concentrated sales and significant debt. The company's debut is seen as a litmus test for the AI market after Nvidia's recent decline.

title: AGRW - Allspring LT Large Growth ETF Stock Price and Quote
summary: This article provides detailed stock information for the Allspring LT Large Growth ETF (AGRW), including its current price, performance metrics, financial details, and fund objectives. It highlights the ETF's focus on large-capitalization U.S. companies for long-term total return. The fund aims to invest at least 80% of its net assets in equity securities of large-cap U.S. companies, defined as those within the S&P 500 Index market capitalization range.

title: Accelerating Japan's growth with AI - Microsoft Stories Asia
summary: Microsoft is making a significant $2.9 billion investment in Japan to expand its cloud infrastructure and boost AI capabilities by 2025, including the introduction of Azure High Performance Computing with NVIDIA GPUs. This initiative aims to accelerate Japan's AI transformation across various industries, enhance cybersecurity, and equip millions with AI skills through new programs like "CyberSmart AI" and partnerships with academic institutions. The investment underscores Microsoft's commitment to supporting Japan's economic growth and innovation in the AI era.

title: KT Cloud to establish AI Data Center demonstration center in Seoul, South Korea
summary: KT Cloud is establishing an AI Data Center Demonstration Center in Seoul, South Korea, set to launch in November 2025 at its Mok-dong DC 2 Center. This center will explore sustainable AI data center operation strategies, focusing on AI-based automation, optimized power consumption, cooling, and network operations, including the deployment of liquid cooling and renewable energy. The company also plans to develop an independent, energy self-sufficient AI DC Demonstration Center by 2028.

title: Microsoft Expands AI Collaboration with Korea, Empowering Innovation and Growth Across Key Industries
summary: Microsoft is significantly expanding its AI collaboration with Korea, showcasing key industry innovations and accelerating AI transformation. The company unveiled new deep reasoning agents for Microsoft 365 Copilot, making their global debut in Korea, and reaffirmed its commitment to fostering innovation through partnerships with major Korean companies like KT Corporation, LG Electronics, and Hanwha QCells. Microsoft also emphasized responsible AI principles and launched an AI Skills Initiative to enhance AI literacy across various sectors in Korea.

title: SentinelOne CEO Tomer Weingarten sells $1.17 million in stock
summary: SentinelOne (NYSE: S) CEO Tomer Weingarten recently sold 60,864 shares of the company's Class A common stock for approximately $1.17 million. This transaction was executed under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan, leaving his direct ownership at 920,297 shares, despite also acquiring shares through conversions and exercised options without cash exchange. The sale comes amid varied analyst responses to SentinelOne's Q4 results and future guidance, leading to adjusted price targets from several firms.

title: PTC Brings AI-Powered PLM to Hannover Messe 2025 with Windchill AI
summary: PTC is set to preview its AI-powered Windchill AI product lifecycle management (PLM) assistant at Hannover Messe 2025, alongside Codebeamer AI and ServiceMax AI. This initiative demonstrates PTC's commitment to advancing agentic AI across the product digital thread, aiming to enhance engineers' efficiency by leveraging product data for informed decision-making and task automation. The preview will include the Document Vault AI agent, designed to extract critical product information from Windchill-stored documents.

title: Brunswick is cruising to success with Dynamics 365
summary: Brunswick Corporation, a global leader in marine recreation, has undergone a digital transformation by adopting Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Supply Chain Management to address its fragmented ERP landscape caused by significant acquisitional growth. This migration has standardized operations, improved warehouse efficiency, enhanced inventory management, and streamlined procurement processes across its global divisions. The company is also exploring Dynamics 365 Business performance analytics and AI-driven insights to further optimize its operations.

title: Equities in 2025: Embracing a Broader Landscape
summary: Goldman Sachs Asset Management foresees a broadening landscape of equity market opportunities for active investors in 2025, moving beyond the dominance of US mega-cap tech. The report highlights potential in small-cap companies, developed markets like Japan and Europe, and emerging markets such as India and specific sectors in China. Investors are encouraged to pursue diversified, active strategies and explore long-term themes like reshoring and increased energy demand.
authors: Steve Barry, Alexis Deladerriere, Başak Yavuz

title: Rob Arnott on Market Inefficiencies and Investing Opportunities
summary: Rob Arnott, founder of Research Affiliates, discusses market inefficiencies and investing opportunities, focusing on the behavioral mistakes of performance chasing and impatience. He elaborates on the impact of user-friendly AI, the nature of market narratives, and how index investing creates exploitable inefficiencies. Arnott also addresses the growth versus value debate, arguing that value stocks can be as growth-oriented as growth stocks.

title: IPO News - US IPO Week Ahead: AI-focused CoreWeave set to debut in $2.5 billion deal
summary: Three IPOs are scheduled for the upcoming week, headlined by AI-focused cloud computing provider CoreWeave, which plans to raise $2.5 billion at a $29 billion market cap. The company specializes in cloud hardware for AI applications and boasts significant revenue growth, though it faces concentration risk with Microsoft as a major customer and substantial capital investments. Also scheduled are Singapore-based OMS Energy Technologies, an oil & gas equipment maker, and network software firm FatPipe.

title: US tech sector now decently undervalued
summary: The US technology sector, as of March 26, is now considered decently undervalued, shifting from being modestly overvalued a quarter ago. The median tech stock is 13% undervalued on a price-to-fair-value basis, with hardware, software, and semiconductors also below fair value estimates. Wide-moat names like Microsoft, Salesforce, ServiceNow, and Tyler Technologies, along with cybersecurity firms like Palo Alto Networks and Okta, are highlighted as attractive long-term investments due to their recurring revenue models and sticky customer bases.

title: 4 tech giants look cheap ahead of earnings
summary: Ahead of their earnings reports, four major tech companies—Apple, Amazon, Facebook, and Microsoft—are considered undervalued. Analysts see Apple as undervalued despite recent revenue guidance adjustments, Amazon as continuing its impressive growth, Microsoft showing broad-based strength, and Facebook maintaining its competitive advantages in digital advertising despite recent controversies.

title: Coastal Community Bank self-identifies material weakness
summary: Coastal Financial Corp., the parent company of Coastal Community Bank, identified a material weakness in its internal controls over financial reporting related to interest income and banking-as-a-service expenses. The company restated financial reports for 2023 and the first three quarters of 2024, noting that while the accounting errors had no impact on consolidated pre-tax income, net income, or retained earnings, they did affect assets, liabilities, and cash flow statements. Coastal Community Bank recently partnered with fintech Dave, a deal analysts believe will be beneficial given the bank's strong position in the BaaS space.

title: Microsoft announces new HR executive, company veteran Amy Coleman
summary: Microsoft has appointed company veteran Amy Coleman as its new executive vice president and chief people officer, succeeding Kathleen Hogan. Coleman, who joined Microsoft in 1996, will report directly to CEO Satya Nadella and lead HR for the software giant, which employs 228,000 people. Hogan will transition to a newly established Office of Strategy and Transformation.

title: Longtime Microsoft HR chief Kathleen Hogan shifts to corporate strategy role for CEO Satya Nadella
summary: Microsoft's longtime Chief People Officer, Kathleen Hogan, has been appointed to the new role of Executive Vice President of Strategy and Transformation, reporting directly to CEO Satya Nadella. In this capacity, Hogan will focus on the company's overarching corporate strategy and continuous transformation, particularly in the AI era. Amy Coleman will succeed Hogan as Chief People Officer.

title: Anthropic Enterprise Edge: How Investors Can Gain Exposure Through The AGIX ETF
summary: This article highlights Anthropic's significant position in the AI sector and its ethical approach to AI development. It explains how investors can gain exposure to this private AI company through the KraneShares Artificial Intelligence & Technology ETF (AGIX), which holds Anthropic as its fourth-largest holding. The piece also details Anthropic's rapid growth, strategic partnerships with tech giants like Amazon, Google, Salesforce, and AWS, and the launch of its advanced Claude 3.7 Sonnet AI model.

title: OSRH Stock Plummets to 52-Week Low at $1.31 Amid Market Challenges
summary: Bellevue Life Sciences Acquisition Corp. (OSRH) stock has fallen to a new 52-week low of $1.31, reflecting tumultuous market conditions and an oversold RSI. The company’s market capitalization is now $25.6 million, with a one-year return of -86.51% and a YTD return of -87.55%. In other news, OSR Holdings secured an equity financing agreement with White Lion GBM Innovation Fund, allowing it to sell up to $80 million in common stock to White Lion to enhance its financial flexibility in the medical device industry.

title: Microsoft responds to TRC Capital’s “mini-tender” offer
summary: Microsoft has issued a response to an unsolicited "mini-tender" offer from TRC Capital Investment Corporation to purchase up to 300,000 shares of Microsoft's common stock at $391.00 per share. Microsoft states it is not affiliated with TRC, does not endorse the offer, and remains neutral, advising shareholders to exercise caution and consult with financial advisors. The company also highlights that mini-tender offers are not subject to the same SEC disclosure and procedural requirements as larger tender offers.

title: Five Investment Themes to Watch in Equity and Alternative for 2025
summary: In 2025, investors are focusing on diversification and risk management due to shifting macroeconomic conditions, a new U.S. administration, and evolving trade policies. Key investment themes include diversifying within U.S. equities, increasing exposure to international equities, particularly in Japan, and utilizing commodities and cryptocurrencies for portfolio diversification and inflation hedging. The article highlights the role of CME Group's various futures and options contracts in managing these investment strategies.

title: Oracle Mission Statement | Sustainability Goals | Core Values | Strategy (2025 Analysis)
summary: This article provides an in-depth analysis of Oracle's mission statement, corporate responsibility, sustainability goals, and core values as of 2025. It details how Oracle aims to help customers manage and leverage data, promote technological freedom, and contribute to a sustainable environment through various initiatives and its commitment to values like integrity, customer satisfaction, and teamwork. The article also provides key financial and company information for Oracle.

title: Cerence Inc. Launches Cerence xUI, Innovative AI Assistant Platform for Next-Generation In-Vehicle User Experiences
summary: Cerence Inc. has launched Cerence xUI™, an AI assistant platform designed to enhance in-vehicle user experiences through conversational AI, leveraging both edge and cloud technologies. This platform, developed in collaboration with NVIDIA and Microsoft, utilizes the CaLLM™ family of large language models to offer personalized and engaging automotive voice interactions. Cerence xUI allows automakers flexible integration options for new and existing vehicles, promising advanced performance, reduced latency, enhanced privacy, and cost efficiency.

title: Oxygen Therapy Market Size, Scope 2032 by Key Companies- Linde
summary: The global Oxygen Therapy Market is projected to grow from USD 16.07 Billion in 2024 to USD 38.26 Billion by 2032, at an 11.45% CAGR. This growth is driven by rising respiratory diseases and advancements in AI, IoT, and portable devices, enhancing therapy precision and remote monitoring solutions. Key players include Linde plc, Chart Industries, and Philips Respironics, while challenges like high costs and regulatory hurdles persist.

title: Ex-Rep. Greg Walden to Lobby for Constellation Energy
summary: Former House Energy and Commerce Committee Chairman Greg Walden has registered as a lobbyist for Constellation Energy Corp. Walden will focus on policies impacting data center power generation and the nuclear, solar, and natural gas industries. This move is associated with Constellation's partnership with Microsoft to restart the Three Mile Island reactor to power Microsoft's data centers.

title: Is it time to buy the Magnificent Seven?
summary: The "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks have experienced a significant selloff, making some of them appear undervalued according to Morningstar's fair value metrics. While Meta, Amazon, Microsoft, and Alphabet are now rated as buys, Nvidia and Tesla are fairly valued, and Apple remains overvalued. Morningstar strategists still recommend underweighting growth stocks overall, favoring value stocks due to market volatility and slowing economic growth.

title: Tech Moves: Longtime Google leader Umesh Shankar joins Microsoft as new corporate VP
summary: Umesh Shankar, a veteran leader from Google, has joined Microsoft AI as a corporate vice president of engineering, focusing on privacy and security for the Copilot AI assistant. This move is part of a trend of Google executives moving to Microsoft AI. The article also details other significant personnel changes at Remitly, Crelate, Bloomberg, Pioneer Square Labs, Seattle Aquarium, Built Oregon, Fred Hutch Cancer Center, and Trove.

title: Board Approves Termination of Investment Sub-Advisory Agreement for First Trust TCW Securitized Plus ETF
summary: First Trust Advisors L.P. announced that the Board of Trustees of First Trust Exchange-Traded Fund VIII voted to terminate the investment sub-advisory agreement for the First Trust TCW Securitized Plus ETF, effective May 9, 2025. First Trust Advisors L.P. will assume portfolio management responsibilities for the Fund, maintaining existing investment strategies. The company, along with its affiliate First Trust Portfolios L.P., manages approximately $266 billion in collective assets.

title: What Coca-Cola has learned on its generative AI journey so far
summary: Coca-Cola's head of generative AI, Pratik Thakar, discusses the company's early adoption and evolving strategy for generative AI, predating ChatGPT's launch. The article highlights their "Create Real Magic" platform and a Christmas campaign that garnered mixed reactions, emphasizing the human element in creative decisions despite AI integration. Thakar also details how Coca-Cola balances consumer-facing and internal AI applications, fostering an ecosystem where employees contribute to AI projects across different units.

title: CISO Global Continues to Advance AI-Powered Security Solutions within Microsoft and Amazon Cloud
summary: CISO Global is advancing its AI-powered security solutions within Microsoft Azure and Amazon AWS ecosystems. The company successfully developed a Proof of Concept for integrating its Argo Secure platform with Microsoft Security Copilot, enhancing asset management and threat detection. Additionally, CISO Global's TIGRIS GRC solution is now available on the AWS Marketplace, offering cloud-based security assessment and compliance tools.

title: Anthropic Stake for the Masses Is Latest ETF Industry Gambit
summary: KraneShares has acquired a direct stake in Anthropic, a privately held AI company and competitor to OpenAI, through one of its exchange-traded funds. This move combines the surging interest in artificial intelligence with the growing trend of offering private assets to a broader investment audience. Anthropic recently secured funding at a valuation exceeding $60 billion.

title: Microsoft Dragon Copilot provides the healthcare industry’s first unified voice AI assistant that enables clinicians to streamline clinical documentation, surface information and automate tasks - Source
summary: Microsoft is launching Dragon Copilot, the healthcare industry's first unified voice AI assistant, which combines the capabilities of Dragon Medical One (DMO) and DAX Copilot (DAX). This new AI assistant aims to streamline clinical documentation, surface information, and automate tasks for clinicians, addressing burnout and workforce shortages in healthcare. Dragon Copilot will be generally available in the U.S. and Canada in May, with subsequent rollouts in other countries.

title: Alphabet director Frances Arnold sells shares worth $20,606
summary: Alphabet Inc. director Frances Arnold sold 121 shares of the company's Class C Capital Stock for a total of $20,606 on February 28, 2025, as part of a pre-arranged trading plan. Following the sale, Arnold still holds 16,938 shares of Class C stock and various Class C Google Stock Units. The transaction occurred while Alphabet's stock declined 11% year-to-date, though InvestingPro analysis suggests it may be slightly undervalued.

title: AI Hinges on Rapid Electrification
summary: The article discusses how the rapid growth of AI is leading to unprecedented demand for electricity and infrastructure, similar to how energy-efficient lightbulbs ultimately increased overall energy consumption. It highlights the significant power costs associated with training AI models, using AI applications, and manufacturing AI chips, putting immense pressure on the U.S. power grid. The author suggests that investments in grid modernization, power generation, and innovative energy solutions like small modular nuclear reactors (SMRs) are crucial to meet this surging demand.

title: Digitally transforming Microsoft: Our IT journey - Inside Track Blog
summary: This article details Microsoft's digital transformation journey in IT, from its on-premises origins to the current AI era. It highlights the company's strategic shifts, cultural changes, and the evolution of IT roles, emphasizing key principles like vision-led initiatives, a growth mindset, and customer obsession. The narrative showcases how Microsoft Digital powers, protects, and transforms the digital employee experience, leading the company's AI transformation while enabling customers to reshape their businesses.
authors: Keith Boyd, Lisa Miniken and David Hirning

title: Happy 3rd Anniversary, Capital Group ETFs
summary: Capital Group's active ETF business celebrated its third anniversary with $57 billion in assets, making it the fifth-largest manager of active ETFs. The firm's success is highlighted by several funds with over $1 billion in assets, including the Capital Group Dividend Value ETF (CGDV) and Capital Group Growth ETF (CGGR), which have significantly outperformed their respective Morningstar categories. Capital Group continues to expand its lineup to meet strong demand for active ETFs, which now constitute about 9% of the total ETF market.

title: Microsoft completes landmark EU Data Boundary, offering enhanced data residency and transparency
summary: Microsoft has completed its EU Data Boundary for the Microsoft Cloud, allowing European commercial and public sector customers to store and process their customer data and pseudonymized personal data within the EU and EFTA regions. This multi-year engineering effort enhances data residency, transparency, and customer control for core cloud services like Microsoft 365 and Azure, and includes professional services data from technical support interactions. The initiative underscores Microsoft's long-standing commitment to Europe, with significant investments in AI and cloud infrastructure, and a focus on cybersecurity through its Secure Future Initiative.
authors: Julie Brill, Corporate Vice President and Chief Privacy Officer and Paul Lorimer, Corporate Vice President, Microsoft 365

title: Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL) Reports Strong Q4 Earnings, Advances AI-Powered Real Estate Solutions
summary: Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL) reported strong Q4 2024 earnings, with a 16% revenue increase and improved EPS. The company is actively integrating AI into its operations to boost productivity and efficiency within the real estate sector. The article also touches upon the broader AI investment landscape, highlighted by data center expansions and significant investment offers within the AI industry.

title: 8 Best Quantum Computing Stocks to Buy in 2025
summary: Quantum computing, while still largely in an R&D phase, holds immense potential to revolutionize technology with its ability to accelerate computing speeds far beyond current capabilities. Despite a projected commercialization timeline closer to the mid-2040s, advancements in cloud computing are increasing accessibility for developers, making it a promising, albeit speculative, investment area. The article highlights key companies such as IonQ, Microsoft, Nvidia, Alphabet, Intel, Honeywell, IBM, and Rigetti Computing, suggesting that investors can gain exposure through these tech giants or specialized quantum computing ETFs.

title: Microsoft’s Majorana 1 chip carves new path for quantum computing - Source
summary: Microsoft unveiled Majorana 1, the world's first quantum chip utilizing a new Topological Core architecture, aiming to achieve industrial-scale quantum computing within years. This breakthrough leverages topoconductors and topological qubits, offering a path to scalable quantum systems with millions of qubits to solve complex global problems. The technology addresses previous challenges in qubit stability and control, positioning Microsoft as a leader in the race for practical quantum computing.

title: Arista Networks’ growth accelerates, driven by big AI investments
summary: Arista Networks Inc. reported a significant increase in profit and revenue for its fourth quarter, driven by strong demand for advanced networking infrastructure supporting AI workloads. The company beat Wall Street estimates for both profit and revenue, with CEO Jayshree Ullal highlighting fiscal 2024 as a "remarkable year." Despite a conservative forecast for the current quarter which caused a temporary stock dip, analysts remain optimistic about Arista's long-term prospects due to continued AI investments from major hyperscale customers and effective cost management.

title: Adeia Announces Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Financial Results
summary: Adeia announced strong financial results for Q4 and Full Year 2024, achieving record post-separation revenue and cash from operations and signing 10 deals in Q4, including new strategic agreements with Amazon, Canon, and a luxury retailer. The company also paid down $50 million in debt and repurchased $20 million of common stock, while growing its patent portfolio by 12% to over 12,000 assets. Adeia provided a positive financial outlook for full year 2025, projecting revenue between $390.0 million and $430.0 million.

title: 3 Options to Capitalize on Cloud & AI Growth
summary: This article discusses investment opportunities in the growing cloud computing and artificial intelligence (AI) sectors. It highlights two Direxion leveraged ETFs, CLDL and UBOT, for traders seeking amplified exposure to these industries. Additionally, it suggests Microsoft, with a corresponding leveraged ETF MSFU, as a strong single-stock option leveraging both cloud and AI advancements.

title: Major Aviation Merger: flyExclusive's $22M Strategic Takeover Reshapes Private Charter Market
summary: flyExclusive (NYSE: FLYX) is set to acquire Jet.AI's (NASDAQ: JTAI) aviation business for $12-22 million in an all-stock deal, transforming Jet.AI into a pure-play AI company. The transaction, expected to close in Q2 2025, involves spinning off Jet.AI's charter business into a new entity which flyExclusive will then acquire, while Jet.AI shareholders will retain their stock and receive new flyExclusive shares. This strategic move aims to provide flyExclusive with growth capital and enhanced shareholder liquidity, leveraging synergies between the two companies.

title: Gaming ETF (ESPO) Hits New 52-Week High
summary: The VanEck Video Gaming and eSports ETF (ESPO) recently reached a new 52-week high, surging 62.5% from its low. This strong performance is largely attributed to significant gains by holdings like Applovin Corp (APP), which saw a 24% increase following positive earnings, as well as Roblox and GameStop. The ETF is expected to continue its upward momentum, indicated by a positive weighted alpha of 59.63.
